product_title: Kingston Brass K150F2 Designer Trimscape Showerscape Shower Arm Flange Polished Brass 2 25 x 2 25 x 0 38
product_description: High Quality Brass Construction 75 Inner Diameter 2 25 Outer Diameter Flange for K15A2

reviews.review_body: I didn't care for this item. That's probably mostly on me, but to save others the money who are looking to save $$$ by purchasing this; I didn't realize how small this was, and that it's made of cheaper plastic. Get the nicer, thicker, larger metal flange and be happier with money well spent.
I like it
Taking into consideration where it rests, I guess the thinness is OK though. By the price they sure must be proud of this thing.
Purposely bought it because it said it was brass.  Installed Aug 2014.  Have to replace it May 2016 as it has rusted badly.
as advertised
The arm flange fit perfectly and matched the shower arm.  Installation went easy.  Arrived promptly, was packaged properly.  No issues.
Fit the sch. 40 pipe nipple snuggly and looks great. Thick metal with firm "gripping" tabs to keep it in place.
It came quick, has some weight to it and is very durable. It matches my delta setup almost perfectly.
Perfect fit and finish, solidly made and looks great.

product_title: KOHLER 22166 G 2MB Purist Four Function Handshower Handheld Showerhead with 3 Spray Settings 1 75 GPM Vibrant Brushed Moderne Brass
product_description: Multifunction Handshower With Nonpositive Shutoff 3 spray shower wand offers a full coverage pulsating massage and silk spray handheld shower head high pressure spray has a flow that is ideal for everyday use 1 75 gpm 6 6 lpm flow rate Vibrant Brushed Moderne Brass Easy to Use Easy to Clean Kohler handheld shower head features a thumb tab that allows you to transition between spray modes with ease hand shower comes with a finish that resists corrosion and tarnishing and a MasterClean sprayface that is easy to cleanse helping prevent mineral buildup Easy to Install Handshower Upgrade your shower system with this multi function handheld shower faucet using a bracket or slidebar for wall mount installation or a deck mount holder for deck mount installation mounting accessories and shower hose are not included Additional Hardware and Equipment Needed Detachable shower head coordinates with accessories from the Purist Stillness and Composed collections complement your shower faucet set with a K 8593 or K 9514 Shower Hose a K 98360 or K 98359 Smooth Shower Hose or a K 45981 or K 45982 Ribbon Hose ASME and DOE Shower Heads Kohler shower heads meet the DOE Energy Policy Act 1992 ASME A112 18 1 CSA B125 1 ADA ICC ANSI A117 1 CSA B651 and OBC Criteria this product is also registered with the California Energy Commission CEC 8 17 18

reviews.review_body:
The whole thing is plastic including the treads for the hose. If there is metal, it is a foil over the plastic to make it look metal. If I wanted a plastic wand I would have purchased somewhere for 1/2 the cost. Look around a reviews for this series of wand in a different finish. They will confirm this review.

Update: For some reason a 5 star review was given on this item without any headline or write-up. Didn't know you could do that. Could it be because they are trying to lift the ratings?
I’m not 100% confident this is genuine Kohler construction. Though these items come in Kohler boxes with their seal you can immediately notice the material construction is not the same.

product_title: DELTA FAUCET 95B932 27S SS Lorelai Workstation Kitchen Sink Undermount Stainless Steel Single Bowl with WorkFlow Ledge and Chef s Kit of 6 Accessories
product_description: WORKSTATION SINK w WorkFlow LEDGE creates a multi functional workspace allowing you to work right over the sink Rounded corners offer a clean transitional look OUTER DIMENSIONS 27 in L x 19 in W x 9 5 in D Bowl Dimensions 25 in L x 16 in W x 9 in D Min Cabinet Size 30 in KIT INCLUDES workstation sink acacia cutting board w mobile device holder roll up drying rack w removable utensil holder silicone drying mat bottom grid and drain assembly w cover Made with heavy duty TRU16 GAUGE STAINLESS STEEL for long lasting durability 6 INCLUDED ACCESSORIES Work over the sink on ACACIA CUTTING BOARD w MOBILE DEVICE HOLDER for hands free use while cooking Stainless steel ROLL UP DRYING RACK w silicone coating and UTENSIL HOLDER is perfect for drying dishes and protecting countertops from hot items dishwasher safe holds up to 85 lbs heat safe to 400 degrees F Self draining SILICONE DRYING MAT for drying glassware and utensils helps keep your kitchen counters cleaner STAINLESS STEEL BOTTOM GRID keeps dishes elevated and protects sink surface STAINLESS STEEL DRAIN ASSEMBLY w COVER conceals drain opening and keeps drain clear helping prevent clogs SPACIOUS SINGLE BOWL provides generous space for washing large items while containing mess and splatter inside the sink REAR OFFSET DRAIN offers MORE STORAGE underneath the sink UNDERMOUNT DESIGN with no exposed mounting deck allows you to wipe water and crumbs directly into the sink NOISEDEFEND SOUNDPROOFING with extra thick sound absorbing pads on all sides of the sink greatly reduces noise and vibration ANTI CONDENSATION UNDERCOATING helps prevent moisture build up to reduce the risk of water damage to your cabinets EASY TO CLEAN with non porous surface and rounded EZClean corners allows so you can wipe away debris helping prevent buildup over time WEAR RESISTANT SatinSheen FINISH resists to rust and corrosion and is easy to clean DRAINAGE GROOVES and sloped sink bottom channel water into the drain helping prevent pooling in the sink OPTIMIZED SLOPE helps keep fragile stemware from tipping over INSTALLATION READY KIT with all mounting hardware and cut out templates included

reviews.review_body: I absolutely love this sink. A wonderful upgrade to my kitchen. The convenience of the workstations is a huge added plus!

The sink looks great.  It’s a high quality item, and I even got a compliment from the installer.  I also like that it has the technology to muffle the noise from running water or when piling up the dishes or utensils in the sink.
Video Player is loading.

This sink is more expensive than most of others.  It works well with our new kitchen.  The major problem we experienced was the strainer came with this expensive sink using plastic.  While our other section of the drainer has metal plumbing.  The threads on the new plastic strainer got damaged instantly.  We had to purchase a new one with metal in order to make it work properly
Another reviewer said this sink had a flat bottom & didn't drain well, but the drain speed, while not as fast as a steeply sided sink, is adequate to move food particles down.

17 inch size fits well in 30 inch cabinet. Happy with the design. The grate for the bottom is excellent and limits scratches. Drains well. We do not often use the shelf but nice to have the feature just the same.

I am far from a novice when it comes to kitchen sinks, for a tend to move often. With each move comes at the very least a kitchen renovation. Of all the sinks I have had in my kitchens over the years, this one is by far the best. I don't say that lightly, for it was competing with a hand-hammered copper farm sink with a live finish that I adored. The Delta Lorelai's undermount fits with the design of my current kitchen and, unlike the Kraus sink in a previous renovation, drains well. To boot, the Delta Lorelai smooths out the corners to make the sink exceptionally easy to clean. So, while I loved the look of the copper sink, I love the functionality and look of the Delta Lorelai with its handy accessories.

product_title: Moen DN7060 Home Care 22 Inch W x 19 25 Inch D Adjustable Height Bath Safety Shower Chair Glacier
product_description: SAFETY FIRST Bathroom accessories to lend a helping hand wheny ou need it 15 to 21 adjustable height fits a variety of tub and shower styles 18 leg width Supports up to 300 lbs Comfortable contoured seat back Non slip seat surface with built in drainage system Accessories sold separately

reviews.review_body: delivered one week early.  easy to assemble and sturdy.
Exactly as wanted and prompt delivery!!

It is the best chair
It is sturdy and very durable
We got one for my mother as well
Thanks for making this dependable and helpful shower chair
My family had used it following broken foot and hip replacement

I ordered this specific chair because the product specifications stated that it was tested up to 400 lbs. When the chair arrived, it clearly states the weight limit as 300 lbs.  Other than this major error on Amazon's part, this is a good shower chair. It goes together quickly, with no tools required. Once assembled, the chair is very stable and will work well, just not for the relative I purchased it for.
Very sturdy.  Large seat
According to Moen's website this item was supposed to be made in the US, but in the fine print on the box "Made in China".
I bought this, used it 3 times. It started to fall apart. The legs were always off. I would not buy this product. I was totally disappointed. I had to trash it
Just what I needed. Study and light.
True heavy duty construction with easy and simple assembly. Easily supports my 250# caboose without any wobble.
Great for taking showers when you have had surgery. My husband had knee surgery and needed chair for shower. Made it very easy for him.

I needed a new chair for my shower, as my old one broke. I ordered this thinking it would be nice. This chair is so straight, the seat & back. Very uncomfortable, I don't send things back so I am stuck with it.
AS BASIC AS IT GETS. HOW DO YOU REVIEW A CHAIR? IT HOLDS ME UP,AND DOSEN'T FALL APART WHEN SAT ON.A LITTLE RICKETTY PERHAPS,BUT STAYS TOGETHER IN THE SHOWER.

This chair had ALL the requirements I had.
Adjustable heights, fits all tubs, is extremely
Solid and Stable, so Easy to assemble, fair price, very well engineered. 100 % satisfied.
This is an amazing chair!  It was purchased after hip replacement surgery and the stability and comfort are exceptional!  It will be used all the time now, wish I bought it sooner!
Works perfectly! Great for my grandfather who fractured his pelvis and is unsteady on his feet. I would definitely recommend.
Was just like the one I used at the rehab center. Comfortable... easy to assemble... sturdy.
The wife uses it and loves it.  Has saved a few falls already.  VERY STURDY and that's good.  Well made and great for our big shower.
Water resistant, I like taking baths on it. It does not move at all, two people on top jumping on it and it holds very well. I just wanted more on it so two people can be on top.

When mom became unstable on her feet, I bought this sturdy shower chair.  It has a little assembly, no problems.  It is important, I think, to have the back rest.  It fits nicely in her tub.  She lives in an apartment and does not have an option to remove the tub for a shower stall. Be sure to measure your space before buying one of these chairs.

Good sturdy shower seat. Bigger than I expected.
May not be suitable for use in an average sized tub.
It was just what I needed for my shower.
I love it.

I have very poor legs due to MS and have therefore went through my share of shower chairs.
The Moen DN7060 is deep enough without feeling like a recliner.  You might be surprised how many shower chairs have problems with this.  Many are not very deep and it feels like I'm going to fall off or tip it whenever I move around.  I've had a couple which have had a significant depression for your backside that I assume makes some feel safer, but all that does is make it harder to get what I need to get done.
I've also had shower chairs which had smaller backs (boo) and which have had plastic legs.  The plastic leg model FELT more stable but I broke two of them in a pretty short amount of time.  The metal legs feel a little wobblier, but I promise you they are solid!
The chair is also adjustable height, which is obviously important if you want it taller or shorter.  I have mine basically level to the height of my wheelchair seat, so that makes transfer very easy.
Overall, after many shower chairs, this is my favorite, hence the 5-star review.

This is our third shower chair and from what I have seen with our other two chairs, this is by far the BEST,  It is much more comfortable than either of the other two, the seat is wider and you feel safe.  My husband uses it also and he feels that it is superior to other manufacdture's ahower chair.  If something should happen to this one (it is used often by both of us) I will be right back on line to replace it with another one from Amazon.

I actually did not want it for the shower -- just needed a sturdy seat in the bathroom.  On opening the box, all parts were included.  The seat and back looked large and comfortable; the whole thing was light weight.  Just what I wanted.  Very few parts and straightforward instructions.  There are five machine screws that attach the legs to the underside of the seat.  The heads of these screws are embedded in easy-grip knobs (genius) that you turn by hand to tighten for tool-free assembly.  Four of the screws started and spun easily to partially secure the legs.  The fifth screw was a little scratchy at first, but finally smoothed out.  Then I went back and started to tighten them all down to finish the job.  The fifth screw went in about three more turns and then just spun in place.  It would not screw in or screw out.  In order to get the thing to fit back in the shipping box, I had to get that screw out of the leg assembly.  The nut that was embedded in the seat popped out easier than I'd like to admit.  The whole thing is in the mail to be returned as I type this.  UPDATE:  I can highly recommend the Moen DN8060 Home Care Shower Chair, Glacier.  The 8060 model needs a phillips head screw driver for assembly.  There are no plastic knobs to turn (and possibly allow the screw head to slip inside).  I ordered the 8060 to replace this chair and am VERY happy with it!

This is the best purchase I made for my mother for her post-surgery rehab.  And Amazon beat the big box retailers (think Home Improvement stores) by nearly 30%, PLUS I didn't have to hassle with carrying it home from the store.  Easy assembly and surprisingly comfortable.  It is HUGE though - but very sturdy as a result.
Sturdy, functioned well. Perhaps a little wide for our tub.
I had the 7064 model first and it seemed more sturdier. I didn't care for this one too much.
The back could be more comfortable but overall I like it.
Not visually appealing but it is a shower chair.  Very sturdy which is what we needed

I like to sit when I take a shower and bought this to replace an old chair. It's a really nice unit. Well made. It would have worked well, but it was too wide to fit the width of my tub, so it was returned. Make sure the measurements will fit your purpose, before you buy. The seat is wide, so if you have one of those butts, it will be very comfy for you.

product_title: American Standard 2403128 222 Compact Cadet 3 FloWise Tall Height 1 Piece 1 28 GPF Single Flush Elongated Toilet with Seat Linen
product_description: Compact elongated design EverClean surface mains the cleanliness of the toilet bowl Includes slow close seat and lid for silent no slam convenience One piece construction eliminates the gap where dirt and grime collects for easy cleaning Right Height bowl for sitting and standing comfort is ADA compliant FloWise technology ensures highest level of water conservation available Uses 1 28 gallons per flush 4 8 Lpf and is WaterSense certified

reviews.review_body: Received in about 100 broken pieces
Not what is expected, poor quality
Great pricing. Awesome product quality. Fast shipping. Will do business again.

I would highly recommend this toilet to anyone in need of a reliable and efficient bathroom fixture. From its compact design to the slow-close seat, this American Standard toilet truly goes above and beyond. The EverClean surface ensures a sanitary experience, while the Right Height bowl provides maximum comfort. With FloWise technology and WaterSense certification, this toilet conserves water without sacrificing performance. The one-piece construction and glazed trap-way make cleaning a breeze. Trust me, you won't be disappointed with this outstanding toilet!
Great sized toilet for a small bathroom setup, no issues with install.

I recently purchased this toilet without knowing what to expect, but it has exceeded my expectations in every way. The slow-close seat is a game-changer, providing a gentle and quiet closing that prevents any unnecessary noise or accidental finger pinches. The height is perfect for taller individuals like myself, offering a comfortable seating experience. The only improvement I would suggest is a wider seat, as it can feel a bit snug for those who prefer a little more space. Overall, this toilet has been a fantastic addition to my bathroom and I highly recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable and efficient toilet.
It's quiet, efficient, and doesn't take up a lot of room.  The easy-close seat cover is a plus.

The toilet that was shipped was not the Flow Wise, instead I received a regular Cadet toilet. I should have checked it out upon arrival but didn't notice it until the plumber had arrived to install my new toilet.
This thing is the ultimate and low flush toilets. It just doesn't flush and I had to replace it with a cooler which worked wonderfully

This product is terrific. Really liked the compact design that fits perfectly in my small bathroom. The Cadet 3 flushing system works superbly, and the slow-close seat is a feature I never thought I'd appreciate this much. As an extra comment, this is a great toilet for the price! Overall, I am extremely pleased with this purchase.

This terrific product has a unique Bone color and a powerful flush. It's easy to maintain thanks to the EverClean surface and sanitary lift tab. The left hand trip lever and one-piece construction add to its neat look. It fits perfectly in my bathroom due to its compact design. The slow-close seat and Right Height bowl add comfort. It conserves water and is a great addition to my bathroom. Highly recommended!
The reason I like this toilet so much is the slow-close seat, no more clanging or slamming toilet seats! The Right Height bowl makes it more comfortable to use. Definitely a good investment!
I have owned this toilet for over two years and have had no problems at all. It is a quality product.
Still hard to believe that so little water is needed to flush.  Works perfectly and no clogs yet. : )
Did not meet my flush expectations from reviews. Slow and very little water.

This is the second identical toilet from American Standard we have ordered for two separate bathrooms.  The one we purchased from Amazon has a 2nd quality glaze on the tank top that is not even, nor does it cover the back edge of the piece.  Very disappointing.  Quality Assurance did not exist on this item.
This is a perfect size.  It fits in a small space and works very well.

This is a great product!
Easy to install, looks great, and it has a quiet flush.
The quality is above my expectations. I will definitely change out the other 2 toilets in the house with these.
Prod exactly as advertised.
easier to clean. like it.
We love this toilet.  It's low profile, conserves water, and looks great in our little bathroom. Have not had any issues with it, knock on wood.
Good choice, functions well, pleased customer

I love it.  It fits perfectly in a small bathroom.  the finish inside the bowl is
amazing, as it stays clean.  One flush is all you need.  I recommend this
very highly.
This s a very comfortable toilet

We just installed this and couldn't believe how a toilet this sleek and trim could do such a great flushing job.  It takes less space than our old one, gives our cabinet doors more room to open.  I like the self-closing feature of the lid, too.

Showed up fast, no damage, flushes great with minimal water usage.  I was worried it might be too long for my small bathroom but it fits great.  I'm going to get a few more and replace all of the toilets with these.
Works great. Flushes fast and fills the tank fast. Fairly quiet, and saves a LOT of water compared to our old toilet.

I did a bathroom remodel and decided to go with this toilet. It has been over a year now and I am still just as pleased as when I purchased it. The flush is powerful and I have not had a single clog!!!
So far so good! It's very small though. fits children's behinds better!
Looks very nice

I purchased this toilet upon a recommendation from Consumer Reports. The installation was simple. I enjoy the slow-close seat and particularily interested to see if this impacts my water bill. Even if it doesn't, it is nice to know I'm saving water vs. a standard 1.6 GPF toilet.

This is a solid purchase because the bone color blends in nicely with most bathrooms. I was particularly impressed with the sanitary lift tab feature. It's a simple but thoughtful addition that goes a long way in maintaining hygiene. However, the seat comfort could be bumped up a notch to take it from good to great. All in all, it's a good buy with minor room for improvement.

HORRIBLE product.  Toilet arrived in pieces.  I am still waiting for my refund from Amazon. Customer service for this has been HORRIBLE!  Don’t buy toilets from Amazon!  Amazon, refund my money from your already returned shattered toilets!

The innards don’t work. My plumber says that they are broken and need to be replaced. I have tried calling American standard bunch of times and I’m always on hold at least an hour and never get anybody.
Flushes great, compact, quiet. My expert toilet clogger kids haven’t clogged it up yet! Which is saying something.
Always the best choice. Much better deal than get it from Costco or Home Depot!
Nothing

I did a lot of research into toilets before purchasing this one.  Don't research the company - check out ALL the models. Some models rate much, much higher than others.  I am really pleased with this toilet.  PS I have a small bathroom.
Cheaper than Home Depot

Perfect no hassle dyi.
Will order other American Standard products

Arrived in perfect shape.Double boxed. Refills quickly,1plus gallons verses about 4 gallons. Quick flush ,soft close lid.
Comfort height , good for us codgers.
Ordered this toilet so that it would be higher and replace our old toilet.  The quiet lid is a nice touch!

Was a bit sceptical of these water savers but this one does the job. Simple as that.

My only complaints are it's made in Mexico and it has a cheap seat.
I am pleased all around and would purchase again should the need arise.
Good toilet but not as quiet as Mt Toto. My family loves the comfort height as well as it seems to stay cleaner longer than our old toilet.

American Standard IS the standard in toilets. Very happy with the toilet. Amazon, not so much... As a plumber I can’t have broken toilets delivered then have them sitting on my driveway for a week waiting for someone to pick them up. I also can’t tell the customer I just don’t know where their toilet is or when I will receive it. Not good...
A little heavy for a one-man install, but it worked out great, and the toilet is great

Pros: Delivered on time, perfectly packed. Easy to install. Works flawlessly and looks great.
  Included slow closing lid is excellent.
Cons: Not really a Con. If you are installing it upstairs (as I did), you may need help to move it.
  It is after all one piece toilet, consequently weighty.
I got it through a clearance on Amazon by the seller. Great product. Great sale price. Bought the last 2 units. Fast delivery by Amazon.
Better than expected with such low water usage.  Great, steak commode that functions quietly and efficiently. No regrets!  That why I bought one and a week later...bought a second one.
It works. Big improvement over my old toilet. Delivery was incident-free. It’s a toilet, not much else to say.
This toilet has a sleek design ,uses less water to flush and is taller than our toilet it replaced which is a real plus for my 6’5” husband.

We've had this toilet 2 1/2 months, installed by our plumber, and it has clogged 4 times.  We even double flush.  The tank is simply too small and does not hold enough water to achieve a decent flush. This last time, in an effort to clear it, I poured a bucket of water into the bowl.  That all leaked into the ceiling of our downstairs bedroom.
Since the "return window" is closed, I'll be discarding it and buying a different brand.
Seat is not as comfortable as that on the toilet we replaced

I've had this toilet in our powder room for about a year and love it. I'm buying another for the other bathroom. I love that it is one piece which makes it easier to clean. It's sleek and compact. I bought it because it's low flow and I've never had any issues with flushing. It takes everything right down and quickly. There isn't the round and round of the water with other toilets. Whoosh, it's almost like air is quickly sucking the contents down. Anyway, I highly recommend it.

I bought 3 of these toilets from Amazon. They would have been a good buy except for the fact that one was leaking water into the bowl, a tankful in 12 hours! None of the suggested fixes worked. I am observing another toilet which has a very slow leak, but still a leak nevertheless. The only bright note is the way Amazon responded to the problem. It replaced the defective merchandise without any hassle which left me very impressed with Amazon. My big disappointment is what seemed to be the lack of quality control with these American Standard toilets.

I PURCHASED AS 2403.128.020 ONE PIECE TOILET BECAUSE IT USED 1.28 GPF AND WAS RIGHT FOR A SMALL BATH.  FIRST I GAVE IT 4/12 STARS,GOOD FLUSH, SLEAK LOOGING ONE PIECE TOILET,BUT OVER NIGHT
I COULD HEAR THE FILL VALVE COME ON WITH OUT BEING USED.SO I CHECKED THE FLAPPER ASSEMBLY I COULD SEE AIR BUBBLES AROUND THE SEAL.AFTER INSPECTING THE TANK IT HAD IMPERFECTION WITH HIGH
PLACES AROUND THE OPENING SO THAT IT COULD NOT PROPERLY SEAL.SO MUCH FOR QUALITY CONTROL THEIR FOR I ONLY GIVE IT THREE STARS,BECAUSE THE PURPOSE WAS FOR WATER SAVEING.
Liked the color and special seat closure

I bought this particular toilet because I had one before so I got this one for my tenant.  I was disappointed that it did not have the sweep of water that the advertisement stated.  Also, I cannot get the oval cover to stay on the lid.  It continually slips off the attached end  and it is a large oval cover.

Ordered two. Both came well packed and on time. Installed the first. Found the bowl leaked. Called American Standard. Very non-caring. Installed the second. It's fine and works very well. Amazon was great with the return and sending a replacement which works fine. Amazon had the defective one picked up the next day.  American Standard's quality control is lacking as is their customer service!

Short Story:  Awesome flush power.  Water consumption for a two person, one bath, household reduced by 25%.
Long Story:  We totally agree with R. Fisk's detailed review of this toilet.  We purchased this American Standard Compact Cadet from Amazon in May 2011 at a much higher price.  It was worth it.  We installed it ourselves and have had no problems.  It is quiet and easier to keep clean.  The best toilet we have ever owned.  (P.S. I originally thought having a slow closing lid would be rather silly... not anymore!)

I never realized they made more than one elongated size toilet bowl, at least until we received this toilet. I knew the one piece toilet design was supposed to take up less space, but the sitting space on this bowl is tiny. A standard elongated toilet seat would not fit it, so luckily it came with a seat. Our builders already had it installed when we got home, or i would gave returned it. The flush is also weak. The overall perception of this toilet is "cheap" but the price does not reflect that.

I love the one-piece -- a bit heavy to lift however it is worth it.  No problem with flushing and no problem with installation.  I do wish there was standard when it comes to height since we have three bathrooms (2 kohler and now one american standard).  The difference is less than an inch and when sitting down, this makes a difference.  I guess that is a good reason to stick with one brand for consistency.

The toilet is good, but, at the time of purchase, country of origin stated USA. However, upon delivery, noticed box said made in China.

"American" Standard should be made in America. It's too large and too late to return. Amazon needs to up their game making sure this info is correct.

Compact (much smaller tank than typical 2 pc toilets)  which gives a little more space between side wall and bathroom vanity. Only funny thing is when you push flush lever and let it go immediately the flapper valve in the tank shuts off flush water immediately. If you need a harder flush you have to hold the handle down for a few more seconds.

A great replacement for our 30+ year round toilet.  The one piece looks great and was easy to install.  A great buy on Amazon compared to the local hardware warehouses.  The delivery to my house was fast and efficient.

Its swooshes the waste away with little noise.  There are no gurgling sounds or sounds of water filling the tank.
Performance-wise I give it an "A".  The plastic seat and lid cover seem that comes with the unit are a little "cheesy".
and the toilet seat is not comfortable.  I plan to replace them.  I wish it had a wrap around base so the curve of
the trap is not visible.  I guess you get that designer look with next price point up.  I've only had this product for two
weeks
A bit noisy. Does the job.

After much research on toilets, I picked the 2nd highest rated lowflo toilet. because I wanted to go American (the Toto being #1).  Well, the flush is pretty anemic, though some of that is just getting used to the low-flo-ness of it.  With more substance to handle though, it sometimes has to be flushed twice.  From my research, I thought the flushing twice business was a thing of the past with these new, improved low flo toilets. And the flushing twice sort of does away with the water efficiency. I'm not sure what the EverClean surface is all about.  I have to wipe down the sides more than any other toilet I've had. So, it looks pretty and has a fairly quiet flush, but don't expect the flush to wow you.  And that is what it's all about.

After putting up with a first generation (1999) low flow toilet, I finally bought two American Standard Compact Cadet-3 FloWise Toilets.
The are quieter and most importantly they work! I love the self-closing lid and seat (if only my guests would use it!). The design is only OK, handle has old fashioned look and I don't mean that in a complimentary way. These criticisms are small. I am happy with my purchase and would definitely recommend this model. I could have found less expensive models, but after the headaches I experienced previously, it wasn't worth it to m.
I think the seat arrangement causes on to lean back too much.
Great Toilet, Flushes strong! We used to think it was our pipe system, but this became a godsend to us.

the trucker was b=very professional, it was delivered when it was supposed to be. in perfect condition. i also saved a lot of $$$ as Amazon was  the least expensive by far. the install was easy. as this is a high efficiency toilet, it uses less water, so needs to be cleaned da bit more often, but it is, what it is.

This toilet is almost as good as the one piece that they offer for 200 or $300 more the value is in the toilet I purchased they were very helpful helping me get this toilet to my house and set up properly I would suggest anybody with any kind of back issues get a toilet that is not short but to ADA specifications

We installed two of these in our last home a couple of years before selling that home. We'd done the online research before buying them and noted these toilets had won awards for their "solid waste" flushing effectiveness. They worked flawlessly for us.  Fast forward to our new home which had archaic water-wasting toilets that seldom easily flushed even liquid waste successfully. We ordered two more of the Compact Cadet 3-FloWise toilets and they still work flawlessly. Super easy to install, as you'd expect. Highest recommendation.

Replaced an older leaky toilet with this model.  As a Disabled person I really appreciated the inside the Front Door delivery.  I had a Professional Service install this item..  IF you DIY; the Wax Ring is not included.  Also be able to adapt the Emergency Shot Off Valve as necessary.  The 1 piece design is a new style of appealing contemporary.

The unit is one piece which is a positive and negative.  Very good design, works excellent.  93 lbs.  Better have one really strong guy :P.  Or two if you have the room to place it.  Install was simple and direct.  my family are all tall people it it is a relief to my knees. !  Looks great !

After a year of research about toilets, we decided to buy the American Standard 2403.128.020 Compact Cadet-3 FloWise Toilet in white. WOW! this toilet does everything it says it can do except clean itself! It's quiet, it flushes a LOT of matter (you know what I'm referring to) and is very easy to clean. Some people have had problems with the cover, which was a concern for me after reading the reviews. However, my husband and I aren't small sized people and as long as you sit gently down (Not come crashing down with all your body weight at once, which most covers probably couldn't take anyway) we've had NO issues. I have a 4y.o. son so I love that the seat and the cover are slow closing. No way to get anything caught by dropping the seat or cover when closing. We bought two to replace the horrible all-in-one system toilets we had. So now after a year, the toilet(s) still work great! We've also saved about $30 a month on our water bill which means these toilets will have paid for themselves in a few years. Excellent toilet! We reccommend highly.

Most toilets today have a very small surface area of held water.  This and probably all Cadet 3 toilets have the most held water area I could find.  Easy to install however rather heavy at around 90 lbs.  I  stuck the wax ring as instructed, put a towel under the front of the base to protect it and used two wedges in the back of the toilet to lower it in place which worked fine for me (mid 70's).  Lift a little and slide each of the wedges apart one at a time until bolts found the base holes and then lower away.  Incidentally I used two wedges cut from a 4x4 post.

A bit smaller seat than i was expecting but its actually perfect. If you are very large i may not recommend but it is very sleek and pretty. And when it flushes it doesn’t spray water back up at you is a very calm flush. And it flushes well! Id definitely recommend!!

I am familiar w/ American Standard products having installed their products in the past.
I was in the market for a low water consumption (1.28 gal.) toilet that flushed on the first flush.
After seeing the videos of this product on U-Tube I was impressed.
I purchased this toilet, installed it and it works as advertised.
The installation was pretty easy and the toilet's footprint is only about
a half an inch longer and taller (right height) than the 40 year old
American Standard Cadet round front toilet that it replaced.
I like the slow closing seat as well.
While the unit was still in warranty the tank began leaking water into the bowl
 as a result of a faulty flapper gasket.
The round gasket on the bottom of the flapper was puckered causing the flapper to leak.
After contacting AmStd. they supplied a replacement gasket for the flapper.
Several years later the same problem developed.
After contacting AmStd. to obtain a rplacement gasket was informed that the gasket was not available
and I had to purchase the flapper at a cost of $21.00.
The gasket was probably a $2.00 part!

Got it from Amazon.com with free shipping. Great price ! The product arrived in four days. Plumber removed it out of the package and it was damaged in transit. I did an online return and Amazon was so quick they sent the return label through UPS and UPS picked up the returned item the next day. In five days I got the replacement. Installed it and am very happy. It uses so little water and flushes with such ease that it is indeed a great replacement for my 50 year old toilet which takes 3.4 gallons of water to flush as opposed to 1.3 gallons for the new one. So much for water savings. This particular model comes with a slow closing seat cover (not all models come with it, so watch out for the correct no. product) and it's great. Overall my experience with Amazon on replacement and the product with its functionality are both exuberant. I am thinking American standard products are made in America and it is one reason I chose this product. No reservation in recommending to one and all.

JAYARAMAN, Memphis, TN

I was pleasantly surprised with this product. It is made very well and has a sleekness about it.
Let me get to the surprise! The seat has a little tab on it to make lifting easier( & more sanitary).
I guess I missed it in the description, but any who I just love it!! Love the height as well. This product
is a testament to the longevity of American Standard.

I bought this toilet primarily for its one piece design (go from 4 potential leak sites to one).  Not sure if they changed the design from the reviews stating imperfections in the flapper valve seat causing leaks but both toilets I purchased have plastic flapper valve seats that screw in and work perfectly.  Used a Fernco, FTS-3, 3inch wax free toilet seal which makes the instal very easy, simply had someone spot the bottom and dropped it in place.  I also have a Fernco, FTS-3 on my Toto and lifted that toilet after about 4 years to refinish the floor and the seal was perfect. The directions call for caulking the bottom of the toilet to the floor.  I can see this to keep water from going under the toilet (spills, washing the floor etc.) but this will also hide a seal failure.  I calked everything but the very rear of the toilet for the aforementioned reason. You have to hold the handle down for a full flush, which I don't view as a problem.  It is better than the Toto for bowl cleaning and clogging (no clogs so far) and the Toto sets a fairly high bar.  It is a heavy toilet so if installing it yourself I would have someone present to line it up when you place it on the flange bolts.
Good quality and price

Love the size and look. cleaning is a breeze. Delivery shocked the truck drivers ( they didn't know what it was until we opened it for inspection) and packaging for protection was flawless. Installation was a breeze although I fail to understand why they don't provide a wax ring, cant be the cost as they are inexpensive, however its adds another trip to the hardware store before you can install. Although I installed it  without help, I would recommend an assistant as this toilet is heavy. I believe the Cadet 3 will save on water but time and the next water bill will be the proof. Now for why I didn't give it 5 stars. The self closing lid is nice when it works and it does not work all the time without assistance. Second, if you had a big dinner the night before, it sometimes requires a second flushing. In summary, I like the Cadet 3 and would probably buy another if the sale price is low enough but I am now waiting on the one piece Champion 4 right height, price to come down as it is quite a bit more expensive but appears to be better than the Cadet 3.

We have now purchased three of these toilets for different properties. They flush properly and they are easy to install.  At first glance we thought we had a perfect model we could standardize on.

Sadly these units do have a problem. Specifically they leak, new from the box.  It's not a huge leak but over the course of a few hours the tank level will drop by about an inch and the fill valve kicks in. They are using a Fluidmaster assembly and we believe the problem is with that specific component as the china toilet itself 'appears' to be fine.

American Standard denied there is a problem, yet we have three identical units all purchased since November 2019 and each one leaks the same way.

We are currently troubleshooting and are going to replace the OEM Flapper with a Fluidmaster 5403 at our own expense.  We shouldn't have to do this but the manufacturer isn't helping.  If this doesn't work then we will have to look at the interface where the flush assembly meets the china toilet itself.

When we arrive at a confirmed solution, I will come back here and share it with you hoping to save you the headaches we are enduring.

This was $269.00 plus $55.00 for delivery from Home Depot.  It was $269.00 with free delivery from Amazon.  Difficult decision but I went with Amazon.  I have a Toto toilet.  I have the American Champion 4.  Both were much more expensive and I find this Cadet 3 better.  Everything goes down.  The Toto handle has broken 3 times and the flapper had to be changed twice.  I had to get a plumber to change the Champion 4 flapper contraption (not just a simple flapper).  When the plumber fixed my Champion 4 he told me he liked the Cadet 3 better.  Old simple technology is still good.  I wish we could buy the old 3.5 American Standard toilets.  Not only did everything go down but they keep your main pipe clean and clear.  I already had to call a plumber to snake my main pipe.
Works well and good quality as expected from American Standard. Compact unit that works well for smaller than normal area.
This replaced an older toilet that used a lot of water and did not nearly the same suction power as this unit. I'm very pleased with the unit.

I tend to discount reviews that complain about a defective product; I know that every manufacturer will occasionally slip in a klunker. I also know that I'll return defective merchandise -- so I focus on what reviewers say about non-defective items.

So, here I am writing a review about a toilet I received that was defective. I'm taking one star off for the defect because an installed toilet is quite a bit different than most items when you contemplate returning it. In this case I think the defect should've been caught by the manufacturer.

Here's what it was: the toilet appeared to be in good shape when it arrived. I had it installed by a professional plumber. It had a slow drip from the tank into the bowl, causing the tank to partially refill every 4 minutes. I had the plumber come back, but he was unable to fix it (or thought he had).

I contacted American Std: they diagnosed a faulty flush valve (the entire piece with the "flapper" on it) and shipped out a new one. I requested Fed-Ex (since this is the only toilet in our house), but they used USPS so it took 10 days.

When I took off the old valve I discovered the real problem. There was a porcelain burr on the tank itself about 1/8" high and about 1/4" long. The valve was not sealing over that big of a lump. So I filed/sanded it down, installed the new valve (though the original one was probably fine), and it hasn't leaked since.

The tank appears to have been made in Mexico, while the valve was made in China. I assume that someone in America had to put the two together and should've realized it wasn't going to work with this defect on the tank right where the valve is supposed to seal. So Quality Control is a little suspect here.

Nevertheless, now that the defect has been removed, I really like this toilet. It uses an amazingly small amount of water (a sip rather than a big gulp), and the surface stays clean. I also like it being one piece: less to go wrong. I recommend it, and if yours has the same symptoms you'll now know where to look (unscrew the flush valve from the tank and look for imperfections on the tank itself).

Bone color exactly matches our paint and cabinets which are a warm linen or bisque shade. Flushes efficiently with less water, doesn’t plug up. Fits well in a tight space. No problems with installation. Very happy with it.
Contractor opened box and found toilet broken.

We bought the AS 2403.128.021 (this model has a 1000 rating by established Federal "flush standards") to replace a 2-peice Gerber that, after three return visits from the plumber who installed it, replaced the Gerber, at my insistence, with the AS. The Gerber would neither flush thoroughly; nor stop a persistent, slow leak in the refill assembly. Despite protestations from the "pro", I purchased the described AS model, which was "cast" in Costa Rica, and assembled in the US. Excellent toilet. Meets ADA standards; fills quickly, quietly and completely; surprisingly clean and thorough flushes; one-peice design is sleek, modern, and easy to keep clean; the included @ $50 slow-close seat is functional and well-made, although of plastic; and, perhaps most worth-while, there is a significant reduction in water usage. We were so impressed with this AS Cadet unit that we purchased another for our guest bathroom. Although this second toilet was "cast" in Mexico, it has the same positive attributes as the Costa Rican model, except for the flush stand-pipe assembly. That required some rookie, time-consuming adjustments, but now works as well as the earlier purchase. More importantly for you, dear reader, I am a Harry Homeowner. I pulled - and replaced the 40 year-old AS 2 peice toilet by myself - NO PLUMBER! NO LEAKS! One wax ring - one new flexible water line connection. Flush away!

My daughter and I installed this toilet. It is a heavy beast, but we got it done. Loved the fact is one piece - no tank to attach. New toilet styles keep using less and less water (not always a plus) but this flushes well and fast, with more of a big gulp sound in the beginning, then refills quickly.

The plus side to less water is the smaller tank. Even though this toilet seat is taller than my old one, it seems to take up much less space overall, which was an important factor when selecting this specific model. My powder room is very small, and this works beautifully.

Many kudos to Amazon for outstanding delivery right inside the home. I was afraid to order a toilet online after seeing pics online from various stores of mishaps and broken pieces, but this was packaged exceptionally well.

At this time, I have no complaints, other than the seat seems a bit cheap, but the slow-close is a nice feature. I would not hesitate to purchase this toilet again.

2022 update at end

Not really what I was expecting.  Maybe it's due to it's only a 1.28 gal toilet?

Flushing action is different but underwhelming - it flushes from around the rim downward (the amount is not that great) & it also at the same time shoots a blast of water from the front of "rectangular" bowl 'pit' (not sure what to call this opening?) towards the back of the toilet, basically pushing the bowl content out as the downward water flow pushes down.

The design of this rectangular bottom of bowl pit design is to push to the back and then up and down the modified S-hump (longer running start...?) - versus the old circular bottom of bowl pit design of pushing down, then up the S-hump and then down.
It is just a different design. But, with this 1.28 gal toilet, you may have to flush twice, no way around it. It depends on what kind of food you've eaten and how the waste feces adheres to the bowl (sorry, trying to be delicate). But, with that Everclean glazing, the 2nd flush seems to always clean out everything.

Maybe the 1.6 gal toilet has that more dynamic flushing action we've seen in the TV ads - more water?  But many buildings will only allow tenants, home owners (condos/coops) to install 1.28 gal toilets. Oh well, stuck with 1.28 until we get our own detached home or duplex....
It is still odd to watch this different flushing action, from the 2 points of water action.

So, due to the underwhelming flush action and the nice glazing, I've come to a 3 star rating.

Pros:
very quiet - while flushing and tank refilling (no gurgles or hissing or anything else - maybe from the other complaints I've read, it is due to how their units were installed?) - and I'm very noise adverse
fast tank refill,
Everclean glazing - definitely less cleaning,
slow close toilet seat,
small footprint,
THE HEIGHT (nice),
easy install (but I had building folks do it)

Cons:
slow close toilet seat - to me it is somewhat flimsy, I like the thicker seats better - going back to my previous seat which is great and giving this one to wifey (she likes it)

Aug 2022:
This toilet bowl does do the trick.  I just neglected to return and update it SOONER.  A neighbor was asking for some input and I told him about this model.
I do like it. No real regrets in purchasing it.  It is a solid, efficient flush - RARELY need to flush twice to remove bowl contents.  RARELY.  VERY quiet, still to this day.  Did I mention I RARELY have to flush twice....
The height is more than nice, it is MUCH better than the shorter toilet bowls (i.e. Toto).
Giving it 4.5 stars since I rarely give anything 5 out of 5 or 10 of 10 stars.
--- would recommend this to everyone.

This toilet is perfect. It works better than any new or old toilet I've ever seen or tested, it is compact everywhere except the seat, it looks nice and it is incredibly inexpensive (compared with what most people are spending on new toilets).
 I needed to get a new toilet. I'd seen &used the new lower water use toilets at other peoples' home. They varied from not
very good (less water in the bowl, but you have to flush 5 times to clear it), to terrible (even endless flushing couldn't deal with the smears). I spent ages researching toilets. Learned you shouldn't buy any toilet that hadn't been summited for a MAP score. Then I poured over buyer reviews. This toilet clears a tremendous amount with one flush. And there is no smear problem at all. (I believe work was done on creating a surface finish to stop this happening, and making the shape of the bowl better too - whatever was done, it works 100%)Zero.
It's a one piece, but not that heavy. It's compact, but with an elongated bowl (i.e. better for larger people) and is higher than a normal seat (good for older people), but not massively so.  The compact size, and it's being one piece means it is very good where space is limited. It sticks out from the wall much less than a 2 piece would, or a non compact one piece. And the cistern is compact -narrow from side to side, and from top to bottom. But the main thing is: this is a water efficient toilet that really is efficient. No need for multiple flushes, and it keeps really clean.  I can't recommend it enough. Didn't know the US still had a co. that could innovate properly and make a really good modern product.
Looks wise it's a pleasant blend of somewhat traditional in style with clean unobtrusive lines. (I learned to avoid the retro look toilets....most of them haven't even been submitted for MAP testing.)
Again..superb work on American Standard's part.

April 2015 update:
After four years of use, one of the Cadet-3 toilets started to refill on its own every half hour.  I tried a few modifications adjusting the bob height, but realizing that it was due to some other issue I ordered a complete internal plastics replacement.  What was fantastic is that purchasing the exact parts from Amazon

We bought two of these and saved a fair amount over the same model from the local big box store.  Delivery was very professional and they're excellent products.  They can handle a big load using a rather small amount of water.  I don't think the seat is quite as comfortable as the one on the more expensive Toto we already had, but it's fine.  One small hiccup was that after we picked a delivery date when we could be home, Amazon changed the delivery to an earlier date, and we had to call the delivery company to straighten that out.  The same thing later happened with a TV delivery.  I wish Amazon would recognize that customers pick delivery dates for a reason and not arbitrarily change them.

it fit

here quick, thanks
This flush valve is an exact replacement for the original on my Eljer Touch toilet.

Not bad, but after 3 years the screw assembly broke from the metal mount on the rubber, so i’ll need a new one. Toilet can’t be used more than twice a day, so that’s probably 2000 flushes until failure. Disappointed in the lifespan, certainly.

Fits easy
Great replacement
After looking around for the longest time, finally found the flapper to fit an older toilet. Simple instructions, simple to install. Much better than buying a new toilet.
fit perfect but the package was opened before i got it,and there was no clip to hook the chain to the handle.
Item was used for a repair. The chain included was too short.
Works really well in my strange old toilet.  Screw started rusting very fast, but otherwise as expected.  Fit my 1972 Eljier

Worked great like the old one. However it came with a small ball chain with now way of hooking it to the arm so I had to finagle the old chain to this new part and take the small ball chain off the new part.

This was a very hard to find flapper for a very old but working fine toilet. Thanks so much for this product. I was not looking forward to having to install a whole new flush mechanism for 5x the cost!

Terrible design. First of all, the chain doesn’t have any way to connect to the handle so I had to rig it with a paper clip. There just has to be a better way to do it. The chain is also very short but it does work. I had hoped that installing it would be the end of my headaches with this toilet, but no. You’ll see in the picture I included that there is a crevice where the chain gets stuck about every other time I flush the toilet. This is seriously annoying and totally defeats the purpose of having a new toilet flapper since I have to stick my hands in the water to free the chain every other time anyways. Not worth the headache, I’m sure there is a better product out there.
Perfect Fit, easy to install, exact replacement.
Works just fine

Consumer ADVOCATE rates this product two thumbs up. This assy fits ELJER TOUCH FLUSH toilets manufactured in the late 60's and 70's. Apparently, there are quite a few still in houses. Enough, for various aftermarket suppliers to make up repair kits. Okay, here's the info on ELJER TOUCH FLUSH. These toilets had some good points, but the linkgage was not the best. The aftermarket product is worse. This assy does not include the chrome PLASTIC handle. Even back then, ELJER used fake chrome. The clip that holds the handle is subject to repeat failure. There is a brittle connector link that goes from the handle to the chain that is pictured. Most kits have those part too. Plumcraft and Master Plumber are two complete kit vendors. Now, why did I buy this assy. Okay, the stopper ball is better quality as is the plastic in the attached arm. The chain is semi resistant to Chlorine. The cheaper kits contain metal chains that seem to disintergrate in tank water that contains a chlorine treatment tab. This metal chain seems resistant. I will get back in 3 months more and verify. Why chlorine affects a metal chain is a mystery to me. I do know from personal experience having two ELJERS that chlorine tabs result in the chain breaking into ten pieces after several months. The package for this kit says resistant to chloride.
Quick and easy to install, stopped my leaky toilet! The chain was a little shorter than the original, but still worked for me
it fit and works very well.

product_title: hansgrohe Raindance E 17 inch Modern Showerarm in Brushed Nickel for Wall Mount Showerhead 04731820
product_description: Solid brass construction ensures durability Brand name Hansgrohe Model number 4731820 Country of Origin Germany

reviews.review_body:
This is a top of the line fixture that coordinates perfectly with the Hansgrohe line. I am enthralled by the brushed black chrome -- this is a beautiful and unusual finish that is going to complement so many different aesthetics. It's modern and not dated, while retaining some of the 80s/90s style that so many homes possess.

I am really impressed as always with the craftsmanship as well. 10/10 here.

This 15" arm from HansGrohe matches their Raindance E series heads perfectly. It also gives the need extension to mount and clear the wall with their larger rain shower heads.
The finish is flawless and uniform. It matches the available finishes of the shower heads and trim perfectly.
It is robust and features a very strong and secure mount. It needs it to support the 15" extension with a heavier shower head.
It needs a wood or tile backing to provide adequate support.
5 stars.

This showerarm is impressively sturdy but heavy.  Admittedly, those tend to go together, but because of its shape this is particularly heavy for its length.  Ultimately, I ended up going with a showerarm that was rounded because I was worried about the strain this put on the plumbing when combined with my large Raindance showerhead.

The brushed black chrome looks great.  Much nicer than either brushed chrome or ‘regular’ black, IMHO.

But that’s JustMe.  (I received this product in exchange for an honest review, and that is what I have offered here.)

I remodeled a master bath and every fixture I installed, except this one, has a range of acceptable wall thickness, or counter thickness etc.  They all have some sort of adjustable trim plate or adapter to accommodate variances like that.  But this requires 1/2" NPT  to be 3/8" behind the finished wall, no more no less. It has a bracket that screws to the wall and fixes the position of the nipple relative to the wall surface.  My supply elbow is 5/8" and the threads don't even touch it.  So even if my rough-in were perfect, the maximum thread engagement is less than 1/4"?? I emailed Hansgrohe customer support asking if there was an adapter of some sort and still have received no response a week later. Another negative, it requires you to drill 4 holes for a large bracket. So, once you've installed this you're committed.  No other arm will cover the holes.  I bought this early in the remodel and it is long past the return window, so I am stuck with it, will probably sell it on ebay.

product_title: Peerless P3565LF Elmhurst Two Handle Bath Faucet Widespread Chrome
product_description: Fits 3 hole 6 16 in installations Push pop up drain assembly in matching finish included is ADA compliant and simple to install operate and clean ADA compliant WaterSense labeled faucet uses at least 20 less water than the industry standard without compromising performance Rigid spout does not swivel Ceramic cartridge

reviews.review_body: This faucet is good looking. The nickel finish matches the other hardware we have in the bathroom that are also "nickel". Easy installation and no leaks. Kit comes with everything you need. I would say that this Peerless faucet would give a Delta or Moen faucet from a big box store a run for its money. Great quality for the price. Would definitely recommend.

Very nice quality Peerless faucet.  Really cute design, looks great in the bathroom.  Gives it a whole new look.  Brushed nickel look, two handles, intended for three hole sinks.  A friend installed it for me, it only took a few minutes.  Works great, and I love the look.  It's attractive and the price is very reasonable.

This is quite a pretty bathroom faucet. It is mountless, so each piece sits directly on the counter/sink surface.

The brushed nickel really suits the design, and it is flawless. It has a strong contemporary design aesthetic that really can elevate the look of a whole room, balanced by traditional handles.

The construction is good, and this seems like a very nice "staple" faucet at a very good pricepoint.

We were updating a one-bedroom condo that we use as a rental property and ordered this Peerless Elmhurst bathroom faucet.  Peerless is made by the same company that owns Delta, so they know something about bathroom and kitchen fixtures.  The qaulity of this Peerless faucet is apparent as soon as you take it out of the box, and is better than similarly priced fixtures I've gotten from big box hardware stores.  The satin finish is flawless, and installation is relatively simple (everything you need comes in the box, except of course the water hoses).  The price to quality ratio for this faucet is excellent.

This is a nice 3 hole faucet with a good arch. The brush nickel finish is even and looks great with my granite top vanity.  My son, a remodeler, installed the faucet and said that the installation was simple and straightforward. Water flow is excellent, the handles are sturdy and there are no leaks. The stopper mechanism functions smoothly as well.

Overall, this is a good choice for a transitional bathroom - it can go with a little modern or a little classic. The finish doesn't show water spots.

This product was selected for my parents home, which stylistically is a little more traditional than mine. This fit right in with their home decor, and my mother loves the style and finish.

If you have ever installed a faucet before this installation is pretty run of the mill. If you haven't, don't sweat it, you will need a specialty wrench and some patience, but it is straight forward.

The biggest differences between this faucet and the less expensive ones from the home centers are the smoothness of the operation and the quality of the materials. Everything feels solid, well built. It opens and closes the valve smoothly and firmly. A little hard to describe in an online review, but it is a huge impact to the quality feel of the product.

You will note that this faucet in brushed nickel or oil-rubbed bronze commands a hefty premium over the same faucet in chrome--an over-fifty-percent premium. Think long and hard whether you want to spend that extra money on a simple aesthetic difference. If you do, this is a handsome piece of plumbing made by Peerless, a plumbing fixture brand owned by the American building products conglomerate Masco. Masco also owns Delta, among other plumbing fixture companies, and Peerless shares some of the same design and build qualities of more expensive Delta fixtures--and, importantly, the same nearly bulletproof lifetime-of-original-owner warranty. Peerless is marketed as a homeowner-installable brand and thus comes with detailed helpful instructions.

This is a three-hole fixture, coming with separate hot and cold valves and ceramic cartridges. Your vanity top must have three holes for this faucet to work in it. The faucet itself is stationary and does not swivel. The brushed nickel finish is handsome--and Peerless finishes, while not of the stellar quality of hansgrohe (another Masco brand) will last many years.

Honestly, if you like the appearance of this faucet, you will like your purchase. It will last a good long time, and if any part of it should break, Peerless's customer service will take good care of you.

This review is for Peerless P3565LF-BN Elmhurst Two-Handle Bath Faucet Widespread, Brushed Nickel

The installation was easy. The supply lines are NOT included which is a very big disappointment especially when you consider the price point. It comes with a matching pop-up drain.

The nobs operate very smoothly don’t require any effort to open or close and it is easy to set up the temperature. It looks really nice. I like the height not too tall or short.

The only issue is that if somehow you drop water on top of the faucet once it dries it is going to show horrible watermarks. It is cleanable and disappears easily when wiped but the look is annoying. Other than that it is a great faucet.
Although this faucet had a nice appearance and style, it was disappointing to find that it’s plastic! The supply lines were also cheap and thin. Sent it back

Very nice looking faucet and if you've ever installed a faucet before you won't have any problem installing this one. Here are a couple Pro tips. If you're installing this faucet onto any natural stone countertop be sure to use Clear 100% silicone under the handles and spout, do NOT use plumbers putty because the oil from the putty will stain the stone and you will end up with dark rings around the handles and spout. Also, don't skip the silicone step or you will find water inside your cabinet. Last, here's where you do use plumbers putty. Your kit will come with a rubber washer to use on the underside of the sink bowl which is great but if you want to prevent leaks for a longer period of time add a little ring of plumbers putty between the drain and the sink bowl. I'm referring to the part of the drain that you will see from above, not below. You don't need much and when you tighten the drain a little putty should squeeze out, just use your finger and remove the excess. Between the silicone under the handles and spout and the plumbers putty between the drain and the sink bowl you should be nice and leak free for many years.

If this helped you at all, please do me a favor and click the Helpful button below. Thank you!!

Really nice quality and a snap to install.

Take care when installing the tail piece or it will leak.

This is a beautiful bathroom faucet. It's brushed nickel and appears high quality, with high quality components. It includes everything you need except the water lines (you might have existing ones that will work but they're inexpensive and readily available at hardware stores). It took me approximately one hour to install each one (I installed two).

The directions are straightforward. You need a screwdriver, pipe wrench, plumber's putty and pipe thread tape (all inexpensive). Everything is labeled clearly and I had no issues installing. It comes with a quick connect water line connection which made it easy. It also includes the drain assembly which is nice.

Peerless makes high quality fixtures and this is no exception. Recommended.

reviews.review_body: Replaced our moen shower head with this hoping to take advantage of the water savings. Instead had to increase the hot water temp to get a warm shower. Shower twice as long and still doesn't clean off soap. Wand is terrible with a gap in between the nozzles that makes it useless. Doesn't even have enough spray to wash the dirt down the drain after a shower. Would be nice for a one time spa shower experience but not adequate for a day-to-day shower.

I am extremely disappointed by this product and don’t recommend wasting your money. It’s highly overpriced along with bad customer service. This shower head is not delivering the shower experience you would like to have, don’t be deceived by false advertising and all that cinematography, the mist doesn’t feel that great after all, not enough water pressure, the water coming cool and you would have to turn water heater way up to feel some hot water on your body. It’s not saving, it’s wasting and being disappointed. This a true review from a real customer with real experience.

Recently purchased a house and seeing this in the shower with the adjustable height was interesting and a selling point. Until we used it. It’s interesting for sure, almost atomized droplets but it makes the water far from the nozzle cold. To the point that when you get into the shower initially you have to brace yourself to get through the cold mist to the shower.

When I use the wand the wand temperature is noticeably hotter than the overhead, so when I use to wash my littles when they shower with me I’m cold and they are too hot.

Additionally, with the movement up and down the bottom was secured with a double sided adhesive. This wore out over the 3 months I’ve been in the house and recently fell off and the whole assembly landed on my foot. When I mean assembly I mean the entire freaking shower came off the wall, not just the wand.

The wand magnet is way too weak and falls off regularly. So then the plastic shield falls off repeatedly.

Truth be told I just replaced this overpriced and over engineered shower head for a less than $100 head and am much happier.

My wife didn’t care about the adjustable height as much as the droplets that actually make it feel like a shower and not a mister that doesn’t rinse.

We got the shower from Moen and installed it--pretty easy-peasy. Everything snaps in nicely and the directions clear and easy to follow.

The shower is a variation on a rain shower--and so it shoots misty water droplets rather than a steady stream. When you stand under it it's quite nice and you feel encompassed by the warmth of the water.

That's the good part. Unfortunately I'm quite a bit taller than my wife, who is 5'4" and by the time the water reached her it has significantly cooled off to the point that she had to turn the heat to max. That meant that when she used the wand (which is pretty feeble...) it was scalding. For both of us the shower just didn't really clean our lower-halves. It's great on your face and upper-body, but just doesn't have the rinse of a standard shower. It claims to be 45% more this or that, but it really isn't.

Three stars though for a good idea, excellent engineering, and much ease in de-installing it. We wrote to customer service to return it and they promptly answered in a thorough and helpful way.

Give it a try if you're really taken--maybe our shower pipe is situated too high or our water pressure isn't all that. But this didn't work out for us.
No pressure, not a great expert
Terrible water pressure! DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

It’s a mist- not a stream with any sort of force. It can’t rinse shampoo or conditioner out of your hair. It does provide a nice hit sauna experience if you can close off the room, but it’s just not practical.

I purchased this to replace a Nebia Spa Shower 2.0. I wanted to like this product, but I found several things lacking.

1. This shower feels more like a traditional shower than an atomizing shower. The drop size is quite large compared to the original Nebia shower, and it lacks that incredibly relaxing "soft but powerful" sensation I loved from the last model.

2. The silver hoses are quite ugly, and don't match the black trim or the chrome components. Why wouldn't they also make the hoses black?

3. The hoses are way too rigid. The handshower does not stay in position due to the rigidity of the attached hose. This is a major downgrade from the design of the original Nebia shower.

4. The rigid hoses make the product unsuitable for a small shower. The hoses will not hang against the wall, taking up space and making a small shower feel even more cramped.

It takes some getting used to.  Its very warm by your head, but until the air in the shower warms up, your lower half is cold.  Once the warm mist is everywhere, it is like showering in the rain forest.  It's blissful.

DO NOT BUY! Please read!!

First of all, I want to say that we were very excited for the showerhead. We watched videos on YouTube, and read reviews. Seemed like what we were looking for, so we went ahead and purchased.

Aesthetics wise, it looks great. It looks really nice in the shower, and gives the shower a modern feel. This is the only positive comment I can give for this shower head.

This shower head has stoped spraying from four nozzles after only two months of use. This SHOULD NOT HAPPEN for a product over $300. Period.  We have cleaned it multiple times, and attempted to take it apart to see if there was an issue. Nothing. There is no build up, and we do not have hard water.

DO NOT purchase this shower head!!
