So far so good... I replaced a couple of plastic bolts with these. The old plastic bolts were not holding very well. Hopefully I won't have to keep fixing it now.

My cat has a habit of flying through the house like superman. She loves to leap into the bathroom and land on the soft toilet seat. She has broken at least four of the plastic bolts that come with the seat so I ordered these and now she can soar and land on the landing pad without breaking it.
Hold tight. Would give 5 stars if they used wing nuts. Would buy again.

Needed replacement fasteners, these were inexpensive (cheaper than my local hardware stores) and flat out just worked. Hard to sing the praises (or faults) of some bolts that hold the toilet seat on. Bottom line, they worked as advertised and Amazon got them to me in a flash.

This product worked as good or better than I thought it would. It's universal and so glad I bought this instead of plastic bolts which this replaced. There is no slip now and hardware store wants too sell you a new toilet seat. $30 and this fix is great and only $6.59 roughly $7 with Prime free shipping 40-50 cents tax. You cant go wrong with this item. Bolts are long and brass plated.

These work but the weak link is the nylon nut. What's the point of a brass bolt to use a nylon nut which strips or breaks as the weak link?

You're better off to use them and get the right size metal nut on here and use that. It's like they locked the front door but left the backdoor wide open (and I just realized what a poor analogy that is for an item like this....)

I thought these because they were not plastic. I thought that they would hold the seat in place a lot better than the plastic ones that brakes so easily, but the seat still slides and it's not the best  hold but gratefully slides a lot less than did when using the plastic. But  either way it is fine.. sigh...

I'm not sure what idiot thought it would be a good idea to use the crap plastic screws to hold a toilet seat in place, but they simply don't work.  The DANCO 88653 are the perfect replacement, and in my case the seat no longer slides around.  I've used these screws on 6 toilets and believe me they WORK!  Don't be afraid to tighten them down, I initially didn't tighten them and have since tightened them and 'No More Sliding Around"

My apartment maintenance guy sucks.  I have to buy my own crap to fix things in the apartment and this was one of them.  Works great, but 1 star taken away because our toilet seat has caps to cover the seat hinge and the plastic part on this particular hinge is so large that our seat caps do not close fully.  Our toilet seat caps are left open with the hinges showing, but we don't care... Just wish the plastic part was smaller/flatter. Definitely keeps the toilet seat in place and we're happy.

The nylon bolts that came with my two new toilets didn't stand up to the job. One pair failed during installation and the other pair broke within the year. I purchased two pair and I'm pleased with the price and the product. I used the provided nylon washer on the underside of the toilet (against the nut) so I needed another washer on the top side to keep the bolt head from passing through the seat. I think it would be a great idea for them to add a couple of flat nylon washers in a couple diameters to make the kit suitable for more seat types but I would definitely purchase these again if needed.

I suppose this is a good product, but it was not needed with my new toilet seat.  If you purchase this product, make sure it is for the right toilet seat.  I have it in a junk drawer because it wasn't needed.

So often, these little bolts "give way" and it was very helpful to find out that they are for sale online.  You would not believe how expensive these handy little bolts are at the hardware store.  Also, employees at the hardware store assured me that "I couldn't buy these" and that the only way to repair my toilet seat was to buy a whole new seat.  I know, I should have known better...you will not believe me ... but I bought a new seat for my own house and for my parents before I realized I could buy the bolts online.

Honestly, these don't seem a whole lot better than the cheap plastic ones that they replaced.  They are sturdier, but they still loosen up easily, which is what I was trying to avoid.  I am constantly having to re-tighten them.  However, they were inexpensive, so its not a huge loss.

Back when I lived in an old apartment, the toilet seat that was installed had the plastic hinges.  Seeing as how the bathroom floor was uneven, the seat would shift to the left whenever somebody sat on it, causing them to break.  After going through so many of the plastic ones, I finally had enough and decided to purchase the metal ones.  This absolutely solved my problem!

Seeing as how they're pretty inexpensive and seemed to hold up well, I will purchase them again in the future if need be.

Oddly enough I only needed the washers and nuts, the plastic ones wear down after a while and I needed to replace the ones on my toilet. The seat has metal hinges and the screws it came with thread into the hinges so I can't use the bolts from this set, just the washers and nuts, but the slipped right on, tightened up nicely and I'll probably buy another set in 6 months to a year. I need to find a SKU on Amazon or elsewhere that just sells the plastic pieces, the metal ones don't tend to wear out.
These worked great.  I had to replace my plastic ones with these because my plastic ones would bend and fall out, and the toilet seat would come off.  No such problems with these!

I was getting tired of the dang seat making me do the twist every time I plopped my butt on the pot. No amount of tightening the plastic 'bolts' would work. ==Perhaps the force of my seating myself, accompanied by a questionably large but by no means unattractive heinie causing a stress if I sat down in a sideways motion and not directly positioned exactly over the 'target hole'. After I installed these metal bolts, I no longer have any problem and the seat is so secure it's as if it's glued to the bowl. If you have similar problems, this is the cure. Simple, metal bolts you can actually tighten.

These fit regular and soft toilet seats, not just wood toilet seats.  They are perfect, much sturdier than the cheap plastic things. UPDATE: While I absolutely continue to recommend these screws over the cheaper plastic things that usually come with replacement toilet seats.  However, I need to add that these screws will loosen up over time just as the plastic ones do.  Periodically it's necessary to tighten them again or your seat becomes unstable and starts to rock and slide around.  I don't know what the solution is to prevent this problem, but I will say that in my experience, this is what has caused the plastic bolts/screws to sheer off and break in the past.  At least you don't have to worry about that happening with these tough metal ones.

You should keep in mind though, that with enough force you could still potentially break the seat if it's unstable, even rocking off center just a little bit, and even if the bolts remain intact.  You could crack the seat or--more likely, snap the hinges if it slides around repeatedly as the unexpected stress will fatigue the hinges where it's most vulnerable--especially if the hinges are plastic (and most are).  Let the problem get bad enough and they could potentially be the only thing supporting the seat as weight is applied. The hinges aren't designed for that kind of repeated stress or torque and someone could easily wind up taking a tumble to the floor in the most compromising state (potentially leading to a most embarrassing predicament).  Imagine breaking a hip because your toilet seat fell off. Imagine that call to 911---and while you are waiting for your rescuers, imagine how entertaining this will be to the hard-working medical personnel who will be treating you--

Now imagine breaking a hip, being stuck on the floor and waiting for the medics when you had been in the bathroom in the first place--oh yeah! to relieve an urgent call of nature.... Even 15 minutes is going to seem like an eternity--and good luck keeping your modesty (let alone your dignity) intact if you can even manage to hold it long enough for anyone to help--if they are even willing to risk compromising your potentially broken hip......How do you spell relief?  U-R-I-N-A-T..... you get the idea.

Good reasons to keep those bolts tight, eh?.  Good reason to make sure those bolts don't break?  I betcha though, that even in your worst case scenario, these bolts will outlast your toilet seat--maybe even your toilet.  These bolts are not going to break under ordinary use.  I doubt they'd break even if you left them wobbly and loose.  They are solid and heavy duty--easy to install and easy to tighten.  Well worth the nominal price.

Anyone know how to prevent these bolts or screws from loosening up over time in the first place?

product_title: Sloan Valve A 19 AC Sloan Closet Relief Valve White
product_description: White Finish Single Pack Closet relief valve Repair part For Sloan products

reviews.review_body: OEM Sloan parts. I ordered 10 for my facility. Works great.
I got this for a 20 year old urinal that was not flushing anymore, it was a direct replacement and works great.
Excellent product 100% recommended and works very well

product_title: Comfort Seats C3B2E118BN Decorative Oak Wood Elongated Toilet Seat with Brushed Nickel Hinges Dark Oak
product_description: Hand Selected premium grade oak wood laminated to MDF for beauty and durability Natural wood products vary in color due to variations that occur during the growth cycle of a tree Simple to install corrosion proof self aligning hardware Traditional Design Bar Hinge with finish coordinated screws Multi coat surface finish provides a beautiful long lasting and durable finish

reviews.review_body: Was in middle of ordering a 2nd one because was so pleased with initial one I'd previously purchased. This item is very fine quality so I don't understand how it can be getting the reviews I read.  We've had the original one for about five years and it looks as new/perfect as when we first bought it!
Broke first day peace of junk. Never again lol
Installed into a new bathroom in January, by April/May the laminate was peeling underneath...and signs of rust
Thy were not solid oak, which when I went back to read the description after I received then, you had to read the fine print to get this.  do not like them, but thy work.

I purchased this last June.  The seat has always slid to the side unexpectedly while you are sitting on it, which can scare the crap out of you!  The hinge that holds the lid on broke in half a few months ago.  This toilet seat didn’t even last one year!  I would not buy this again.  It’s a piece of junk.
was very pleased with this but item does not hold up. After 3 months the seat cracked....not made of solid wood.
the image shown on the web site
The color was perfect!
Not solid wood. Not with bar hinges.
Very nice
fit well looks good
Very nice touch to class up the bathroom
easy transaction - product just as shown
screws came out of back&seat
Broke in less than a week!
This is junk!  We have tightened it several times and it still moves around.
not very dark ... a little flimsy ... feet fell off within 5 days ... returned
It looks great
I have had this seat just over 2 months.  Two of the three suports on the underside have split.
Barely 5 months in service and higes are busted.  This is a poorly made product.  Do not buy!
Nice seat
easy to install. looks great.
Sturdy and surprisingly not uncomfortable
The seats look nice and seem ok, BUT the bumpers break. Their hollow hard plastic and on contacting the company they never sent replacements
Seat broke at a willed joint piece of junk ... Can't return because it's been more than 30 days it's been like 31 days
Poorly made, "chrome" rusted in less than a month, screws worked loose and it started falling apart shortly after.  Don't buy this piece of crap!
Nice and comfortable.
Really cheap, made of press board, did not hold up.  I bought a good solid wood,  so go the extra and bypass this one.
Purchased this item a year ago and about 2 months ago the brass brackets broke on the lid.  Now we need to have it replaced.
THE TOILET SETS HINGES ARE BROKE. YHE WOOD ON THE SEAT IS COMING OFF.I TRIED TO CONTACT AMAZONS CUSTOMER SERVICE AND THEY HAVE NOT RESPONDED.
Junk, looks great but after a few months the hinges separated and now it will need to be replaced. Wouldn’t suggest anyone buys this poorly made seat.
Absolutely love the looks of this seat
Sometimes it gets loose from the bracket. I have to tighten it back together.
The seat's hardware got completely rusty, including the screws in 30 days of use - just after ended the return period. It is not acceptable to have a toilet seat without antirust treat.

One of the Bolts holding the Toilet Seat on. Broke Completely Off Within Two Weeks of Us Having Installed It!
My Husband and I are Average Size/Weight People!
Very Disappointed with This Product!
The hinges on this seat are too flimsy. The bolts are tight, but the seat will shift and may knock you off the toilet. If I could return it, I would. Do not buy.
Very cheap quality.
Does not sit tight
not a quality Product
Not true to size

This product is terrible.  It is of very poor quality materials and looks bad.  It started falling apart within 3 months. I had to replace it in less than a year when the hardware broke and it became unusable.

Piece of JUNK!! Fell apart in less than six months. First bumpers on the bottom of the seat collapsed - as they were hollow plastic and not solid rubber. Then the metal hinge on the top cover cracked. PIECE OF JUNK!!!!!
nice wood crappy hardware
This seat is fake oak. Has an oak stain, perhaps, but looks cheap.

Poor quality not as described! Photo shows bar hinges it has regular hinges. Sending back.
Avoid at all cost!

This item arrived unusable.  It clearly was packaged that way, since packaging material was all intact.  The hinges were broken away from the seat part, they were mangled and the holes had been ripped larger.  The finish was scratched.  It was terrible

The outside box appears undamaged.  Yet the side of the top is bashed-in and the seat looks as if someone tried to break it.  I've had a thousand box's from UPS and never a thing this damaged.  Poor packaging, lousy handling.  Willful?
It didn't fit all the way to the edge either.
I am looking for a solid oak elongated toilet seat, not press board wood.
Arrived broken in three places at hinges.  Hinges seemed to be poor quality

After receiving the item and unpacking it, I noticed the hardware had packing material stuck to it that would not come off even with a Dremmel buffer tip and the hardware was also loose and would not tighten. The screws were stripped. All in all, the item was sent back. Very unhappy.

A regretful purchase and we were saddened by it. This product is absent of any quality. Within in 5 days of the three seats being in place the alleged brass portions began to tarnish and look very bad. The wood is very light and feels hollow. We will never buy or recommend this product to anyone.
Not real wood and it looks as such too.

Poor Quality. First order was received with hing broken. Amazon replaced no questions asked. Second one hing broke within a month time with normal use. Picture looks great, but quality is very poor. This is a laminated wood not solid and the material used to make hinges is very fragile with no tensile strength. I do not recommend this product.

I Ordered this in spite of the reviews. The first one arrived damaged, apparently dropped on the assembly line. Amazon shipped another one. And the return was super easy. But this ones hinge broke in two months. Apparently it is designed for children,  not a 200 pound person. It should have been sold in China because it is Junk

Don't be deceived by its attractive finish. This toilet seat should be in the toilet, not on it. Made of particle board, the screws on the lid stripped out in the first 10 days of use and the cheap bumpers cracked and crushed. Do not waste your money ordering this piece of crap like I did; buy a better quality seat!
Wood is very comfortable, warm and clean looking. Easy to install, very different look and adds a touch of elegance to the bathroom.

This seat fell apart on Sunday when I installed it on Thursday. There was no use of the toilet from Thursday after installation until Sunday when the kids came home from their weekend with Dad.  The seat is made of some kind of particle 'wood' that does not hold the screws that attach it to the hardware. Buy something, anything, else.
If I have not purchased this seat on a discounted price, certainly I would have regretted wasting so much money on a toilet seat. The quality was not what I have expected.

The hinges broke after using it twice, and the pads collapsed right away.  We were disappointed as we felt it was advertised as an oak seat, and it really was a particle board interior with oak covering on the outside.  Needless to say as my husband put it, "the seat found its way to our round trash basket after about two days of usage".
Arrived damaged. I had to use wood glue to anchor most of the screws. Some were loose, others were completely stripped out of the holes. There was damage to both sides of the toilet.
Hinges are flimsy.
Cheaply built. Hinge system very sloppy. Not really pleased.
Very pretty but I could not tighten it so it wiggles a bit.

Not solid oak -the description now admits this - didn't when I bought it. Support bumpers are cheap hollow plastic and were not even installed flush. First 1 cracked in a month and they're an odd size - replacement bumpers don't fit. Lid screws started pulling out in a month or two - gorilla glue made this thing survive for a year (died yesterday). And the non-corroding hardware has rusted up very nicely.

Had this seat about a month. It is my extra bath, so it gets light use. This seat is already falling apart. The seat screws are out of the lid and it is made of a wood-like product not wood ?  Disappointment!
Looks cheap. Nice color though.
Fair quality. Broke after about 3 months.
Good price for a good product.  One of the two we ordered showed up with a small chip in the edge but great otherwise.
Looks and feels nice. Color is a bit more fake looking in person. Comes with some rubber washers and one of those broke after a couple months use.
Item has cracked in the center.  They should install a additional bumper in the center at the front.

Bought this in Nov last year and it started falling apart in Jan slowly till we had to toss it out in March and went to a Plumbing supply store and by a GOOD ONE....like they say you pay for what you get....do NOT BUY this piece of junk you would be better off standing in front of the toilet tossing and flushing $1 bills down the drain.....ALSO the color and materials were not top quality....best to buy quality if your looking for something that lasts
The seat is not as thick as I am used to but adequate.  Love the color and for the price it will do.
Flimsy, if you lean to one side of seat it will crack at bottom. , not top quality.

it broke after 33 days of light use.  It's beautiful but the lid is wobbly and one of the little screws holding it on came out leaving behind a pile of sawdust.  Thankfully the screw landed on the seat and not in the toilet.  And darn, it only has a 30 day return period.

I purchased this seat as it was wood and was replacing a wood seat as it is warm and comfortable for my husband & I at night and early mornings the middle of the night. The wood and hardware were nice BUT, the shape of the toilet seat had a sharp ridge around the seat itself and not rounded/ also maybe 2." thick. . making it The most uncomfortable seat I have ever owned.. As it was a toilet seat, I was not able to return it.

Represented as a new/used in box.  Received it with a big gouge in the seat bottom front, underneath.  Will be returning it asap.  Interestingly there was a post-it note under the seat that said "Not in Good Condition".  Unknown who wrote it or when it was attached however is was in original box.  Description was misleading on listing.

Based on some of the reviews, I hesitated to purchase this seat. I found one on Amazon warehouse deals and decided to take a chance. Since it seems that durability is the major complaint with this seat, I will update my review in a few months and/or as appropriate. So far, it seems sturdy and is VERY attractive. I'm happy with my purchase...day one!
UPDATE:
Very quickly, the dang thing broke!!!!
It will suffice, but not really what I was looking for. You can see MDF on the edges of the lid and toilet seat. If that had been trimmed in wood laminate also, I would be happier with it.

Not the same seat that I ordered.  The hardware is different.  It's only the single post on each side.  I want the bar in between for more stability and I don't believe this seat will last very long so I will more than likely be ordering something different in the near future.  I could have order a cheaper seat if all I wanted was the single post.
I have two more of these in my log home, it looks fine and works well.  Much better than sitting on the porcelain.
the seat slide everytime you set on it and that is not good.

Shipping was great, arrived within advertised time. The color is not the same as pictured, a little darker than light oak. Quality seems to be OK, not has heavy as the last seat I had, which was solid wood. It is functional, has a good finish and seems to meet expectations, except for color.

On the web site the seat looked in the photo to be one solid color of Dark Oak.  When it arrived it was a strange two-tone instead, with no indication in the description that it would be so.  We didn't like it so back it went.  Such a major feature should not have been left out of the description.

ordered a couple that were supposed to have the full bar hinge but did not called the manufacturer and was told of a design change which deleted the bar and no longer made but still pictured in ads composite wood not sturdy screws fall out
The oak laminate bubbles up and comes off with any moisture.

The wood seems more like a composite than wood, light weight.  Does not look bad when in place but not up to our standards. I do need to return it as it has been in place for two weeks in a bathroom that had moderate use...there are only two of us in the house now....and the bolt on the back fell off last night.  Was not to tight but just broke and fell off, not possible to fix, so hoping I can return.  This is the only item I have ordered through Amazon that I am totally disappointed in.  Looks like I cannot return it, out of the return period deadline, which is a shame because it just broke on June 13th...missed cutoff by 2 days.  Don't buy this product not worth the price, quality is bad.

This listing is completely false advertising. We have multiple Comfort Brand wooden toilet seats in our home, they have the Comfort logo on them. They are high gloss and heavy solid wood, pretty sure they're actually the seat shown. This seat is NOT that. It is a matte finish not high gloss as advertised. It feels very light duty and is definitely not solid wood, which is actually accurate to the description shown. But the hinges are standard NOT a bar hinge as listed. This listing should be taken down and replaced with one that's truthful to the product being sold. Infuriating! Do Not Buy!

I agree with both of the 1st two reviewer (I was in a hurry and did not read the reviews before purchasing), it looks great in the picture but when I got it out of the box I was quite disappointed in the poor quality of the hinge and that the seat is really made of resin board with a thin oak laminate on the top surface of the seat and cover.  On the plus side the stained finish is nice and the color difference between the two materials is minimal, but every time I look at it I will know.  I guess you get what you pay for since most solid wood seats are usually $75+.
The hinge was so sloppy (the seat slides side-to-side a good ¼") that I ended up taking the hinge off my old cracked seat, polishing it up with some steel wool, and attached it to this one.
If you can afford it, spend the money for something better.

WE REC'D THIS A WEEK LATE, HAD TO CANCEL & REORDER , DID REC'V THAT IN 3 DAYS . PUT IT IN PLACE. ONLY MY HUSBAND & I LIVE HERE ! 2 DAYS LATER SCREWS TO SEAT PORTION CAME LOOSE , MY HUSBAND HAD TO PUT EPOXY AROUND SCREW HOLES AND REPLACE SCREWS . 2 DAYS LATER LOOSE AGAIN , ALTHOUGH NOT AS BAD , BUT I THINK IT IS JUNK .. NO QUALITY . SOME SLIGHT DIS COLORING ON THE SIDE OF SEAT BOTTOM . WHITE CHAULKY LOOKING . VERY DISAPPOINTED !!!!!!!! WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS ITEM OR COMPANY !!!!!

I had purchased, what I thought,  was the same product that I had purchased before. Not as nice as my prior purchase. A cheaper product for sure…my prior seat was much better made & much better quality

I did not like the false advertising for this seat. The ad shows a bar hinge and that is not what you get. The ad shows and describes the hinge as Brushed nickel. What you get is a hinge without the bar and made of chrome, not brushed nickel. I am just waiting for the seat hinge screws to come off as listed by other buyers. That would be strike three and the toilet seat goes back to Amazon.

I never thought I'd be writing a review for a toilet seat, but here I am... Recently renovated the upstairs bathroom in my 114 year old house, and wanted a wooden toilet seat. It is heavy, well made, and the color works well with the antique oak pieces in the bathroom. Most importantly, I'm happy to report that the bolts that hold the seat to the toilet itself have remained tight.
Extremely dissapointed in this purchase - the cheap quality and the fact that it closes with a loud bang makes it totally not worth the high price.
A little darker than earlier purchases, but after getting used to it, it looks great.

It's a toilet seat so that is what we used it for. The color is a bit off but we needed the platinum hinges to match the other items in the bathroom. We had a plastic seat before and it wobbles, so this is great and sturdy.

The seat is really good looking. Unfortunately it's hinges leave a lot to be desired. A few weeks after it was installed the screws on the hinge of the seat bottom came loose. This allowed for the hinge to separate and the seat to slide off to the side of the toilet. Once the screws were secured we thought the problem was solved. Not! The plastic tube that fits inside the hinge and allows the seat or lid to move up and down is too short. This allows the hinge to come apart during any movement of the seated person. Hence the seat slides off to the side scaring the s--t out of the person. I know this what the person originally sat down for, but they didn't need to be scared to complete the task.
they sent me the wrong color . I ordered dark oak and was sent dark brown but i was needing it so i keeped it and installed it.

This is by far the worst toilet seat I have ever sat on.  I would of given it no stars but cant do that and post this!!  It looked nice but it sat crooked on the toilet and the connecting hinges came loose in about 1 month and so it slid when sat on.  My husband tried to fix it 3 times with it happening again and it was only my kids using it.  Very poor design and not worth any money at all really.  We ditched it and went to home depot, spent a bit more and got one with no problems.  I would AVOID this seat.
This is a good toilet seat. Definitely will purchase again.

product_description: Brushed Nickel finish brings the warm look of stainless to your bath single function handshower This eco performance showerhead conserves water without sacrificing performance 4 in spray face

reviews.review_body: Flow is definitely less than my previous shower head, I will be looking to replace it with a more powerful model.
Ordered replacement handle for shower, this was exactly the same as the original.

product_title: Symmons S 3601 Trm Duro Shower Trim Chrome
product_description: Showerhead not included Tub spout not included Valve not included

reviews.review_body: love this! I used it for the walk in shower and matched it with a delta faucet and tub spout for jacuzzi(vero) and it looks amazing!
I had some problems getting it to work right; problem may well have been my 60 yr old Symmons valve installation.

product_title: Westbrass ASB 2B3 62 Sink Top Waste Disposal Air Switch and Dual Outlet Control Box Flush Button Matte Black
product_description: Air switch for remote garbage disposal control eliminates shock hazard for safe operation Brass flush button and flange trim 3 in length switch body fits 2 1 2 in thick decks No shock dual outlet control box toggles between two 2 120V outlets Includes 6 foot connection hose

reviews.review_body: Works as expected
Perfect looks great on our new granite counter top
They have another model that does not have this problem. It extends higher and does not drop below the rim when depressed (as does this model)!!!  I love the other switch.
How easy to just push a button ... located beside the sink and the disposal turns on and off.  Works very well and blends nicely with the venetian bronze kitchen faucet!
This switch is amazing, so glad I found it.  It looks very sleek mounted on the countertop and is so much more convenient than a wall switch.
Best thing ever invented!!... No worries about getting shocked when turning on my garbage disposal or having to call my husband to turn it on because my hands are wet.
The switch functions wonderfully, however the Rubbed Oil Bronze color does not match what is pictured on the website nor our expectations.
Have had it for about 3 months and still works perfect. Took like 10 minfs to install and that was cause I took my time drilling through my countertop so that it woukd come out nicely

The outlet I got was side by side, instead of vertical like the one pictured.  That makes my new side by side outlet lose an extra outlet.  Also, the button is not brass as it appears to be advertised.  It isn't pretty polished brass like the picture would lead you to believe.  It's a dull plastic. It matches our other polished brass accessories close enough to not go through the hassle of returning it.  Other than that, it works as expected.  Just note that it is NOT the product pictured.
It works fine but the switch if press hard it went down and stuck in the cylinder and had to wiggle to get it out.
It works - the switch being metal rather than plastic was the biggest selling point and the main reason as I do not like painted plastic parts as in time the finish may peal off.  Easy install.
Missing a crucial bit of information.  No instructions included - how big a hole to drill in counter.  The only instruction sheet gives the dimensions of the box that plugs into outlet - who cares?

Westbrass makes a very high quality button, solid, THICK brass, with an Oil Rubbed Bronze that matches my Moen faucet well, BUT,  the quality control of the button finish is poor.  I've bought and returned 2x, and only on the 3rd order that I received a button that is not scratched and without blemish.  Note that the long shaft switch that the brass button rests on is plastic, but at the same time, it is longer than most (if not all)  other switches on the market, which is a must for (infrequent) installations where the granite top and plywood subsurface together measure up to 2 2 1/2" in thickness.

This was exactly what we needed for our new kitchen island. It plugs into an outlet and there is no electrical connection to the switch - just an air tube. Push it in about a half inch and the disposal comes on, push it again and the disposal is off. We mounted it on the face frame of the cabinet a few inches away from the edge of the sink and it's in a perfect position. The push button is hidden under the granite lip and is not noticeable until it is needed. Great product. Easy installation. We couldn't be happier. Shipping was also fast. Top drawer all the way around.

product_title: Bath Décor 1F1R6 90CH Premium Molded Wood Toiler Toilet Seat Black Chrome
product_description: Odor stain guard ingredient in paint Multi coat high Gloss enamel paint with sealer and primer Adjustable metal chrome finish hinge Closed front with cover Clean with warm soapy water osg inhibits the growth of odor and stain causing bacteria to extend life of seat

reviews.review_body: The toilet seat cover was scratched up
Excellent quality
It was broken!
Received this product see picture item states noncorrosive hardware!! It was corroded in the box before unwrapping! Received and returned!

Screw fell out of hinge immediately! Wood particles start falling out of hole where screw should have been secured.
The hassle of returning not worth it.
Terrible paint finish. And no quiet shut feature.

I love this beautiful toilet seat. The silver hardware along with the glow/shine give it an elegant look. It’s easy to clean just a quick wipe and dry and the shine stays on. The seat is not very hard as many others and I love it. The look alone gave my bathroom a huge upgrade, I am happy I purchased toilet seat.
Poor finish quality,  item scratched, probably due to very poor packaging.
Nice but had a crack in the finish.

The description says this is a molded wood toilet seat. This is not accurate it was a plastic toilet seat. The only reason I gave it one star is because the description is false and I don't have the ability to return it at the moment. I do not have time to wait for a new toilet seat.
LOVE IT, NOTHING TO DISLIKE!!!
Great seat, very sturdy, doesn’t slip, highly recommend it..
Easy to install love dealing with the metal rather than plastic
It is nice a few spots where chip paint but wasnt sending back
Was not impressed at all. The lid broke the first day. I don't believe the back is looked like pressed cardboard
Great looking toilet seat that adds glamour to my black and white bathroom
I wood recommend.
I love the color it matches my bathroom tiles

After having gone through several totally disappointing seats, this one is perfect! It is staying secure, not getting loose and sliding. If you want a durable secure place to park & do your business, then this seat is the way to go!
It looked like a good choice but the hinges have put after about 6 months, then the replacement ones (from another vendor) didn't fit right. Had to replace the whole works after just barely a year.

Arrived late and replaced it with my old seat. I sat down once and the entire back broke. I turned around and the lid was detached from the seat but attached to the seat screw. Not worth the purchase.
easy to install with the tool they include.  SO sturdy.  the metal hinge with the rubber washers/gaskets to hold the seat in place doesn't move around like the plastic..

This is solid wood w/ multiple pads underneath that are well placed and not just lightly attached. The hardware is very nice looking and functional. It was super easy to attach. The black is very sharp looking and stays cleaner looking longer than the previous whites ever had.
Very nice

Same as other pictures wooden with metal hinges but best price for same item at much higher cost for black seats. The plastic hinge easy clean as types, fail, break, slide, etc. and don't last. This is perfect for those big bottom folks or people with more than ideal body weights and not just skinny people. Good for chubbiers, long sitters, disabled cause it is stable and reliable. Pretty.
This toilet seat is one of the best I have owned.  I was a padded seat girl but this wooden seat takes the cake.  I will definitely purchase more in the future.

Replaced a flimsy plastic seat with this one.  Shortly after, I heard my wife yelling from down the hall, "I LOVE THIS TOILET SEAT!!"

That's what we're supposed to do, right: please our wife?

On the one hand, it's narrower than the measurements given.  On the other hand, I was able to reuse the hardware -- which is quite high quality -- on my old toilet seat that has the right dimensions but had broken its hinge, so it all worked out in my case.
It's a toilet seat, what is there to say? It's shiny black and looks cool in a white bathroom.
Easy to install, nice quality and what can you say about a toilet seat?  It works...
Made my plain bathroom, look very stylish, classy, and I love now how it looks matches the whole room and everyone loves it when they walk in. Not a bland bathroom at all.

What can you say? Do I love it? No, but then I don't really form those kinds of relationships with toilet seats. Does it do the job? Yes. Does it seem durable? Yes. If you're looking for a black toilet seat, look no further.

product_title: DELTA FAUCET 574 CZMPU DST Handle Bathroom Faucet Single Hole Standard Champagne Bronze
product_description: Watersense certification promotes water conservation Diamond seal technology features a valve embedded with diamonds to ensure like new operation for the life of the faucet Escutcheon included for use with additional mounting configurations and a cohesive look Includes matching finish drain assembly Meets standards set by americans with disabilities act ada Drain type Metal pop up

reviews.review_body: Love it!  My husband installed this in the master bath in a very short time.  No issues with installation.  The look is sleek and modern, exactly our style. We used this to replace a faucet set that must have been from the 70s, even though the house is from 1955.  I think this modern Delta faucet is more like the style of our mid century modern house than the ugly 70s faucet.  Delta is always our preferred brand of kitchen and bathroom hardware.  Beautiful appearance.  Very pleased.

I installed this thing myself! Like a real man! This was a momentous task for me, as I had never done any plumbing more complicated than installing a shower head.

I was worried that this faucet would look too modern or industrial in my old fashioned subway-tile bathroom, but it actually paired very well, complementing the tiles, giving my bathroom almost a steampunk look. I'm all about blending the old with the new, and I'm all about this awesome Zura faucet.

Stunning, modern look, in a class by itself for sure.  Futuristic elegance.  You can not lose with this quality beauty!  I have a double sink and will replace the other one now, after this masterpiece of the plumbing arts has been installed.
It was a bit more than I wanted to take on, so I had a plumber do it, took him about 40 minutes with the mechanical drain closure and all.  I wish I had the second one at the time, I MUST get another for the complete set.  This thing is gorgeous, must be from outer space.  Fine craftmanship, did I say it is beautiful?  Just buy this one!  It almost makes the bathroom a conversation area again.

This is a very unique faucet that works well and looks great!  My wife loves this.  It was ease to install and it came with everything needed with the exception of tools and sealer.  The installation took me about 45 minutes.  The biggest issue was getting the old faucet out of the sink.  Once out and I cleaned the area the new Zura installed nicely.

The finish looks and feels nice.  The single handle action is smooth and feels sturdy.

If you like the style of the unique Zura faucet you will love it once installed.
Video Player is loading.

This faucet is awesome, IF you have the right style in the bathroom.. its sleek modern look doesnt fit everywhere, thats for sure.. but its just such a nice shiny polished piece wow....

I agree with others its def a bit bigger than the pictures might let on.. DONT fret if you have 3 holes in your sink top as u can just get one of those cover plates (thats why they sell em lol). This is just such a sleek look in the bathroom!

While you could pay someone to do it... and yes I have ALOT of experience with tools and etc, if you or a friend have even the slightest bit of knowledge of tools, give it a whirl on youtube. Im POSITIVE you can save your self tons of money and install it yourself..

If nothings rusted, have all the parts, install could take........... 30 min.. Mine took 15 or so haha. Its not hard and give it a try!

Very attractive faucet.  Clearly a quality item.  It does look larger than I expected, but that contributes to the dramatic look.
The parts that came with it were all well made.

Finish truly shines.  The finish really makes the faucet stand out.

In evaluating a faucet, the installation should be discussed.

I received this through Amazon Vine, but elected to pay for the installation through Amazon Services.  That was a new experience for me.  My countertop sink combo is cultured marble, and the shape of the underside working area made for a tedious and more difficult installation.  The working area was very tight with almost no legroom.  The directions could have been clearer.  I have installed faucets before, without any problems, but I didn't want to tackle this installation.

Amazon will install items purchased elsewhere.  Installers may not be licensed professionals, but those are not needed for most installations.  I received word that an audio video firm would be installing mine.  A little surprising.  A 2 person team came out and did a fine job.  Perfect installation.  No damage.  By no damage, here's what I mean.  The previous faucet was installed 3 years ago by Lowes.  They sent out a handyman, who previously did some good jobs for us.  Plumbing was not his strong point.  On one faucet, he noticeably damaged the drain stopper rim.  On the other faucet, in the other bathroom, we had leaks.  He returned twice.  Tried his best. Couldn't fix the leaks.  We finally got a plumber.

Given Amazon's installation guarantee, and their care in selecting contractors, I am thankful that Amazon entered this arena.

Great faucet look.  Fine installation.

This is a modern appearing faucet that is more hefty than petite. Mine is chrome, and the finish is nicely applied and without blemish or scratch. The faucet handle works smoothly and is perfect for both right and left handed users. The faucet comes with all necessary hardware, Delta's usual complete instructions, and an escutcheon in case you need to cover the holes from cold and hot water faucet handles. Note that the escutcheon is just large enough if your previous handle openings were immediately next to the faucet opening. If the spread is more than that, the included escutcheon likely will not cover the space. Measure carefully if you're transitioning from a three hole to the single hole requirement. The flow restrictor can be removed, giving you a 1.3gpm flow rate. Several flow restrictors can be installed for anything from 0.5 to 1.2 gpm. I always figure that if I want a slower rate, I'll just close down the faucet a bit, but if I want to fill the sink, I don't want to have to wait longer than necessary. Note that there are a few places where things may eventually clog if you live in an area with frequent lime deposits from your water, including at the stream straightener just inside the outlet for the spout. I usually find for those areas, I prefer older faucet assemblies without a lot of washers, grates, and other potential clog spots. But this is a particularly attractive modern faucet that was easy to install and should give excellent long-lasting service.

There's not doubt about it. This Delta faucet in an investment. The chrome 574-MPU-DST Zura Single Handle is an exceptionally engineered faucet. If you like the modern look, then this is worth checking out. The mechanism is smooth and and the "eco" stream of water is enough for most purposes. Heck there are even diamonds embedded in the valve for long-term durability.

It is larger than you might think from just looking at the pictures. Watch the video for better reference. If you have a traditionally styled bathroom, this not quite fit in, but my family likes it. I've installed a number of faucets and this Delta was one of the easier ones. If you have just a single hole in your countertop,  it provides a very clean look. The optional rectangular plate for sinks with 3 holes looks good too. That is what we used. Faucet installation was easy, but it took me a bit longer to swap out the old drain for the new one. No biggie - I know these projects are never without some hiccup. A professional plumber would likely have it in in no-time.

If you're on the market for a modern, efficient and durable bathroom fixture, be sure and consider the Zura if you have the budget.

~ Kort

Beautiful faucet, my plumber was here for twenty minutes and gone to install it. When it arrived I thought it felt a little light for a Delta Faucet because they usually have some weight too it. I was a little skeptical but once it was installed I was very pleased! I couldn't be happier. This sit a little higher off the sink which I like and enjoy. The finish is beautiful and it doesn't get all smudged from use, it looks beautiful with just a quick wipe. I really like the single handle, coming from a two knob system, very efficient when your hands are dirty you can easily use your arms or your wrist to turn it on! It is well worth the money!

We are a Delta house, we save up and invest in their quality so we only buy it once, my plumber recommends this company highly and he never has an issue installing Delta products in our house. Because it was installed by a pro, I am not able to tell you how easy it was to install, and if everything you need was in the box.

Overall, this is an excellent bathroom faucet. The installation took a little extra effort as my supply valve connections were 5/8" and the faucet is plumbed for 3/8". I took the opportunity to replace my supply valves with quarter turn cut-off valves of the appropriate size. Once that was done the installation instructions were fairly easy to follow (cold and hot hoses are clearly marked). I am very pleased with the look of the faucet, both angular and rounded at the same time. The single handle makes for a clean look and easy turn on / off.

The only negative I have for the faucet is the level of rigidity in the intake hoses. I mounted the faucet on a pedestal sink and it was next to impossible to position the intakes in a way that does not stick out to the side of the sink ( I eventually had to resort to a cable tie to keep things neat). This isn't a problem in a normal vanity mounted sink. P-)

We're remodeling our bathroom and replacing everything in it, even the tub and all the fixtures. First my husband did the tub with all Delta products. I have to say the Delta stuff is what makes the tub stand out as it's just a regular tub and nothing special. Ok, one Friday night my husband decides to remove the sink and vanity and since he has to work the next day he sends me to the hardware store to pick up another faucet set....he told me to get Delta. The woman there talked me into buying a cheaper brand and said all the inner parts were Delta anyway. By the time my husband got off work, the store was closed or else the cheaper brand would have been going back unopened. He put it on and fussed the whole time and told me that he didn't believe there were Delta parts in this one and he could assure me it would leak (before he even put it on!). Sure enough it leaked. He took it off and redid it again. It leaked again. Drip, drip, drip all night long and for two weeks now. I don't know which is harder to bear...the dripping or my husband saying he told me so.

Ok, I couldn't take it any longer and promised I would never buy anything except Delta brand again if he will just stop talking about it. My nerves are really frayed. I thought my problems were over when I got this faucet to review, but it's not the type for our bathroom, but it will fit in the sink downstairs, he said. I never said a word...I mean, this is awful fancy to go in a sink that only he sees!  It is really very nice and heavy and he installed it in just a few minutes (versus hours on the cheaper brand) and get this. No drips, no leaking. I have to admit that I felt like the drips and leaking from the other sink were the fault of well, the plumber (the husband)...and not from the faucet. I was wrong obviously and wish I hadn't rolled my eyes at him so many times while he was installing the imposter one. So none of the Delta faucets in the whole house are leaking or dripping, just the one imposter I brought home. Guess I will eat the cost of the loss and go get a Delta to replace it. I really wish my husband would let me go back in the store again, but he blames the sales clerk for talking me into getting a cheaper brand when I was specifically sent to get a Delta, so he says we wont' be going back there. I really don't know how I am supposed to explain all this to my uncle since he owns the store and really had nothing to do with it. Plus it's the only place around here that sells Porter Paint which is the only paint allowed in this house.

This is one heck of a beautiful faucet. For the do it yourselfers sometimes it is easier to take the sink top off, or take the sink out, do your install, and then place it back in again. That all depends on how your sink top, or sink is installed. Having to access the very back of a sink, and working around a sink that is hanging down in front of your work area dictates that a complete removal can be less work. Then you flip the top of the sink over onto a workhorse and do the faucet installation onto the sink top standing up. After that and you place the sink top back into position, all you have left are a couple of hookups and you are done. However some sinks are siliconed into place, or some sink tops have a lot of fasteners holding it down which means simply installing the faucet without removing it is less work.

I have quality faucets throughout my home with one exception; the downstairs’ bathroom. That was a cheapy faucet that had two separate handles. They say you get what you pay for and I now have a hot water side with a handle frozen, so that has to come apart in order to replace the internal valve. This Delta faucet has diamond seal technology featuring a valve embedded with diamonds to ensure like-new operation for the life of the faucet. Included in the box is an escutcheon to cover the holes in a 3 hole sink. Also included is a matching finish drain assembly.

The quality of the build from the faucet to the drain assembly is all top build quality. The chrome looks like it was dipped and then sanded and polished the way they do for the antique car shows. Just the design shape alone is a standout. The handle doesn't have anything flimsy about it. It's not hard to move but it is firm. It's not the least bit floppy so you can get the perfect setting on the first try. The firmness allows you to approach the setting without overshooting it.

This faucet is as much a contemporary statement as it is a functional tool. The nose on this extends out a little farther into the sink than my current Moen model does. The flow on this is a little better as well although it is still in keeping with the new modern water conservation standards.

One word of caution is that no matter how high grade this chrome is you DO NOT want to scrub it with a two sided sponge with a scotch brite pad on one side and softer sponge on the other. It is best to clean this with a soft cloth. You can use soap as long as it does not have abrasives in it. Nothing is more discouraging than to have a museum piece for a faucet only to scratch/scrub the surface and ruin the diamond gloss level to the shine. The scratch marks will show a mile away. I did that once before and it will never happen again.
Even though the price tag is up there, so is the faucet. Buy it once and you will never have to replace it again. Highly recommended.

This faucet is beautiful in its simplicity.  It’s quite tall, but the shape helps it to look less bulky than many of the other current (2019) Delta single handle faucet offerings.  The chrome finish is beautifully done, and it’s sturdy.  It should be pretty easy to clean with a minimal number of edges to catch dirt and water.  It’s very easy to install compared to most other faucets.  A couple of minor complaints:  1. It’s pretty expensive compared to most of the other current Delta single handle offerings, but I’m not sure the actual quality is that much greater.  I think you’re mostly paying for the styling here. 2. The water stream is very powerful even though it is a water saving faucet, and that seems to cause a lot of water to splash out of the sink, at least for me.  3. The pop up control on the back of the faucet is pretty elegant looking, but it’s just made of flimsy chrome colored plastic.  4. The drain pop up stopper is also just plastic, even though it’s an “MPU” model which I assumed would mean the stopper would be metal.  5. Because I was replacing an existing 3-hole 4” centerset faucet, I used the included base plate.  The plate looks nice and did a perfect job covering the outline of the old faucet, but it also is either just chrome color plastic or very thin metal (hard to tell) and not super sturdy to touch.  It anchors the faucet down solidly, though.  5. There is some rattling noise from the valve inside that seems to be common in other single handle Delta DST models when the handle is shut off quickly. It’s almost a water hammer noise.  Overall it’s a very nice looking faucet but I’m not sure of the quality is any different than some other less expensive Deltas. This was a warranty replacement by Delta for another faucet that failed, and they are good about standing behind their products.
So happy I found this faucet, it works great and really looks sharp in our bathroom.
Really great faucet that functions flawlessly!
Very contemporary just what I wanted to go with the bathroom perfect
These are so sharp! Beautiful in my Master bathroom! Had to buy other hoses to fit sinks! But the hoses were only like $8 a piece.
This faucet feels like it was laser cut from a solid piece of brass and dipped in satin nickel plating, then brushed to perfection. It feels great in hand

Much better looking than I expected (and I expected it to look good). The base is slightly triangular, with softer sides, so it looks less severe than the picture. Handle is well proportioned to the faucet. It's taller than I expected, which makes it perfect for my sink. Only drawback is that there is no bubbler, so if I'm not careful with the pressure, the faucet stream (which has an interesting twist in it) will splash droplets out of the sink.
Nice finish and reasonable instalation. Motion sense works great!

These are very very sharp looking faucets and have a smooth control valve.  They feel like a high quality high end device.  My two issues are this-the aerator screen is hard mounted and if it gets clogged by debris you have to destroy it to remove it and replace with a new one, unlike other faucets where it can be screwed off, cleaned and replaced.  also the outlet arm is not what carries the water, it's a very small plastic tube running through it which connects to the aerator so the volume of water coming out of the spigot is greatly reduced.  from a water saving standpoint this is a good thing, but it might not be what you are used to.

Beautiful color!  Not brassy but a gold sheen.
Not like a brushed nickle, the shine is not a mirror shine, very classy looking. I recommend this as I love the hands free function and modern look.
Love my Zura faucet! Works like a charm. Guests love it. Grandchildren love it. I love it! Modern look. Put into my new powder room, black & white decor. It pops! Pricey but worth it.
The faucet I received listed as "sold by Amazon" is not new. In fact it was loose in the box, no foam or plastic. Paint is scratched of course, probably why it was returned the first time.
Great Delta product. Seems more reliable than the older touch-2O products. Collects water spots pretty easily.
I love these faucets.  They are sleek and modern and work well with my black matte delta shower fixtures.  They were easy to install and are easy to keep clean.

We bought this faucet as part of our bathroom renovation project. Our bathroom looks like it was stuck in the 1930's and screaming to be taken to the 21st century. This faucet along with other delta zura line of bathroom products did the trick.

What I like most about this faucet asides the look is the touch and water sense features. Very easy to install and came with everything you need for the installation except for the tools of course.

The only downside to our bathroom upgrade is that folks now spend much time in the bathroom than usual.
Overall, its a great buy!

product_title: Spring Mill Cabinets Hali Bathroom Vanity with 1 Door Cabinet Base Drawer and White Single Sink Top 18 5 W x 16 75 D x 34 14 H
product_description: 18 5 W x 16 75 D x 34 14 H freestanding vanity adds style and storage to your bathroom or powder room White cabinet finish with cultured marble sink top in white for a fresh look 1 inset flat panel cabinet door with adjustable soft close hinges for easy door alignment Brushed gold door and drawer pulls add convenience and a touch of style Open cabinet space and full extension bottom drawer provide ample room for storage and plumbing Unattached white cultured marble vanity top with an integrated rectangular sink included Sink top is predrilled for a 4 centerset faucet faucet sold separately

reviews.review_body: Item is creaked and broken

product_title: SINGFORM 40 mil Thickness 6 x 7 Shower Pan Liner PVC Waterproofing Membrane Shower Pan Base Sheet for Bathroom and Kitchen Utra Durable Grey
product_description: Material PVC flexible type Size 6 x 7 shower pan liner sheet Color grey Ready to use waterproofing membrane Durable flexible PVC material has a 40 mil thickness and is marked in 6 increments for easy measuring and trimming Used under concrete floor of ceramic tile shower base or other concealed water proofing applications Very easy to handle it and installation Just follow our instruction stated Kit includes 1 6 ft x 7 ft PVC Shower Pan Liner Sheet

reviews.review_body: Thick liner arrives folded.  Works well for the application we needed.  We wanted additional water proofing under a shower pan.  40 mil is great durability for our needs.
Great quality liner, easy to use durable

The shower liner is as good as any and perhaps even probably better than we work before. It's very heavy and solid and installed very easily in our large shower. Our plumber indicated that it was as good as any other shower liner he has ever worked with and I'm sure it will last many years. I would definitely order again as would my plumber.

We got this for the price and the sizes available. This liner is very thick and just what we needed. You also can cut it if it's too big. The weight is a good size. I recommend if you are remodeling your bathroom shower.

For right now the product is a 5, time will tell if the liner holds, but what I can say is it is better quality than the liners I have looked at prior and one that I returned back due to clearly being of low quality.

Shipping was faster than anticipated, only a few days.
Very thick we'll keep the shower water proof. Flexible very tough, great product

You can feel how heavy-duty this shower liner is, when it arrives, and you ask yourself what you ordered that is so small, yet so heavy. The thick plastic is very sturdy and maliable and easy to install shower liner.

This is a heavy, thick all-purpose water barrier, light-grey in color.  There's a slight grip texturing on one side.  Includes detailed instructions on using this product as a secondary containment barrier in the construction of a residential shower.  However, this product can be used in any application where a thick, reliably-waterproof barrier is necessary.

Cuts best with a straight razor or strong scissors.  Instructions say to use silicone caulk to adhere this product to other materials.

I take "Made in Taiwan" as a step up in quality nowadays.  Language in instructions is natural, error-free English.  Recommended.

Although I got this for another type of waterproofing project, I have experience with shower pan liners many years ago. This looks better than all I've worked with before. Heavy duty liner. I'm confident it will do exactly what it's supposed to do.

If you have a need for this product, then you understand what it's used for and there isn't a lot to say other than it came quickly and was exactly what I expected.  I haven't built my shower pan yet, but I expect it will perform well too.
It does what it's supposed to do... it's a big rubber mat, and hence waterproof. However it seems a bit expensive for what it is. Would probably not have purchased if I had to pay full price.

This stuff is heavy-duty. I'm going to use it for an outdoor shower in the springtime. Much nicer than I had expected. I couldn't have asked for better. It's a little pricey, but it will do what I need. I'm not worried about the durability or if it works. I am very impressed.

Short and sweet...This is a good quality 40-mil PVC shower liner that is used in your traditional and time proven shower pan system used in tile showers.  The PVC liner serves as the backbone for the whole containment structure.

Corners can be an issue. Prior to installation get Oatey X-15 Shower Pan Liner Adhesive (or equivalent) to glue cuts made in corners.  Don't use the standard PVC glue. This step is too important.

I haven't actually used this liner yet but it is consistent with other 40-mill PVC liners I've installed.  I didn't see any weakness, cuts or deformities in this liner.  It is pliable and has the flexibility and feel of other quality PVC liners.

I have zero complaints about this liner. It feels just like the other brand you buy at the stores. It's heavy duty, conforms to the bed, and goes on easy. I would recommend this to anyone installing their own shower floor.

We have an old farmhouse that was built in 1929. The only bathroom was last remodeled in the early '60s. The tub had an awkward shelf built onto the back to take up the three inches between the tub and the wall. We have gutted our bathroom and are reconfiguring it. The new walls are up, and waterproofing is painted on the walls and floor. We are replacing the tub with a custom walk-in shower. This liner is 6' x 7' (72" x 84") and our new shower is 34" x 60". After talking with the company that is installing the single-piece, created stone shower walls, we have decided to run the liner 8" up the wall, for additional protection.

Several years ago, we had a toilet flange go bad in a house and do hundreds of dollars in damage, I am choosing to put the extra liner under the toilet.

If you are doing a custom shower, you need this product. It has just enough stretch to it to make it easy to work with but not so much that you could potentially stretch it too tight and weaken it. When we are ready to add a bathroom to the attic space we plan to finish next year, I will definitely order more of this for that space.

product_title: Kingston Brass KS3221PL Vintage Kitchen Faucet 8 1 2 in Spout Reach Polished Chrome
product_description: Solid Brass Construction Drip Free Ceramic Disc Cartridge Adjustable wall mount centers from 3 1 2 to 8 1 2 1 8 GPM 6 8 LPM Spout Flow Rate at 60 PSI 1 2 14 NPT Female Inlet Connections 12 1 16 Spout Reach Corrosion Resistant Finish

reviews.review_body: Paint chips off easily.  We used a cloth to protect the paint and did the initial tightening by hand and the paint chipped off with that easy pressure.  Shiny silver underneath.

Physically very attractive faucet in an almost impossible to find design and color. However, pretty much every warning you've heard about Kingston Brass faucets is likely true. Within two or three days after the professional installation of our faucet the screen in the actual faucet head started dripping. Within another day the water flow was quite limited. I called Kingston Brass, they said it sounded like the cartridges, which our plumber had already cautioned us about, and KB promised to send us new cartridges after we provided them with a copy of our Amazon invoice. If you contact KB be prepared to stay involved with the process utilizing multiple contact opportunities. While waiting for the cartridges to be delivered, my very frustrated housekeeper took matters into her own hands,  popped off the screen on the faucet head opening and found copious amounts of black gunk and apparent shavings clogging the screen. She removed the trash and further scrubbed out the faucet with a retired toothbrush and completely fixed the problem of low water flow. Our guess is the powder coating process on the oil rubbed bronze finish leaves quite a bit of interior residual trash. If you can afford a better faucet you probably should purchase it.
Loved it. Easy to install and looks great.
My wife had a vision for our master bath and these faucets helped bring it all together.  Heavy faucets and beautiful to look at.

product_title: T S Brass B 0231 CC B 0231 Cc Double Pantry Faucet Wall Mount 8 Inch Centers 12 Inch Swing Nozzle 062X 1 2 Inch Npt Male Inlets

reviews.review_body: Nice faucet....easy Install...Nice looking...fast delivery

product_description: This universal side splash is designed for 10 x14 deck mounted hand sinks Dimensions are 17 W x 9 1 2 H Mounts to Wall Sink holes may need to be drilled by installer Fits BK 10 x 14 Hand Sink BKHS W 1410 This after market side splash is made from durable stainless steel and is ideal for commercial settings

reviews.review_body: I bought this for a Vulcan fryer and it fits without issue.  Bought these so the grease doesn't splash everywhere.  Easy to put on, take off, and clean.
It’s the perfect height for what we needed
Fast shipping! Fits perfectly! Works as expected.
Fits perfect
Fits right on the fryer.
great
Fits great!
Excellent strong product thanks
Works like its suppose to
This piece was perfect for my cooking equipment.  Easy install and easy removal for cleaning.
Easy to setup and most of all I no longer have frying oil splashing everywhere.
Very well-made... Very durable... Fits perfectly
Fast shipping. Does exactly what it's made to do
Works great needed for fire Marshals inspection did it’s job using on a pitco deep fryer perfect fit
Excellent quality and it fits perfectly.
Great item as described it,.
Slip it on and make those inspectors go away!
Does its job
reasonably priced, easy to install, works as expected

reviews.review_body: Simple and nicely constructed. Nothing fancy, but a solid design and feel. Overall fit and finish is very good. Not a fan of the clear amazon basics branding on the front.

Our bathroom faucet started dripping a week ago. Queue the search for a new faucet. I loved the idea of this faucet and how tall the spout was. It makes cleaning things in the sink so much easier. Installation was easy with the use of this wrench (www.amazon.com/dp/B07C96H1GF). Didn't take more than 20 minutes to install. The brushed nickel is easy to keep clean.

This is probably the best basic type faucet that I've ever installed. It feels solidly made, it was easy to install and it complements my bathroom decor perfectly. This is in the upstairs guest bathroom so it isn't used in a daily basis. I wanted the higher arc spigit so I can get my watering under it to water the upstairs plants. AmazonBasics has become a great brand, quality products for a fair price. Highly recommended!

I really like this faucet.  It matches my decor very well.  It is made well and looks great.  I am a big fan of nickel finish and this one is a nice one.  easy to install and perfect for any bathroom.  I like the goose neck, it allows you to fill things in the sink and get them under the faucet.

Love the higher faucets and this was very easy to install in the spare bath.  I would have preferred one with a single handle or even slightly farther apart.  After installation I find it a bit of a pain to try and clean between the pieces but you live and learn these things.

I am so excited to stumble upon AmazonBasics for plumbing fixtures. It's so nice to have another entry level (& better) value in the home/garden category.  This brand of fixtures rivals any other brand that you can buy on the shelf in big box hardware stores. Excellent Value with the Shopping ease of Amazon.

1. A very simple faucet with nice detail & SN appearance.
2. A great price point for the value. Comes with everything needed to install. I have a plumber hired and will not be doing this myself but it could easily be a DIY job.
3. Mechanics work great and are very smooth.
4. Great height/arc and will be a great decor addition to any bathroom.

Simple to install, a good DIY project.  No plumber’s putty is required; everything is plastic with rubber gaskets, and the instructions are easy to follow. If you're replacing really old fixtures, expect to have to futz a bit, but should be very straightforward in a newer setting. The gooseneck is so handy, especially if you have shallow basins. It's a game-changer for everything from watering plants to washing small pets (or infants--wish I'd had one of these when my daugther was tiny!). The styling is clean and modern. Happy!
Installing was not the easiest but once it is installed it works great and the polish is perfect.

Love the style of the faucet but the constriction leaves a bit to be desired.  When I compare to a name brand it is definitely lighter in construction.  no where near the mass.  that means that the metal is thinner and will most likely not last as long as a name brand will.  that is a somewhat subjective observation but I think it has a logical foundation.

Ascetically this piece is really beautiful. The spout really does resemble a "goose" neck and adds such a nice detail to your bathroom space. Package does arrive with everything you need to install and was simple (believe me, I am a novice and completed the install - this is a DIY). This piece does have the Amazon brand on the base (and, it's very noticeable), so, if this is something you're not into, you may want to consider before you purchase.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of this AmazonBasics faucet. Materials, construction, fit and finish all seem as good as better known brands. The packaging is really exceptional in that it protects all of the pieces to make sure they arrive at your door in perfect condition while the box is still very easy to open.

I have a few "cheapest you can get me" type faucets that came with my house, and they're starting to look a little old. The style is very similar to this faucet, though the Amazon Basics goose spout is taller and a bit more pronounced.

Installation was pretty straightforward. Personally, I'd pick up some

I love the look of these faucets.  This one comes in a modern version and a traditional version.  I think this is a matter of personal style.  I like the traditional a little better but both look great.  The quality is very good and just as good as any of the majority of those you find at the home store.  The one thing I didn't like is the Amazon Basics brand stamp on it.  I'd prefer no brand stamp at all and it's not a high end stamp you want on there.  Everything else is great.  All you need is provided and it's a fantastic price for the quality.  If you don't mind the brand stamp then this is a definite recommend.

This AmazonBasics Modern Two Handle Goose Spout Basin Faucet installed without a hitch and looks great.  My house is 30 years old now, and the faucet on the small sink in the wet bar was looking a bit out of date.  This new faucet is nearly identical in height / shape as the one it's replacing, except that the handles on this unit look much more modern.  Wife is *very* pleased.

While the faucet is very nice, the drain is about the cheapest looking / feeling drain I've ever installed. It's all below the sink and out of sight, but I was not impressed with that.

I've changed more than a few sinks in my day, so knowing what to do wasn't a problem. But do be aware that my unit came without instructions.  Your package might be different, but if not, and you're doing this by yourself and you've never replaced a faucet before, I'd suggest looking for a "how to" video on YouTube.

For anyone who's replaced or installed a faucet before, installing this was easy.  Nice clean look, too.

Finally, do know there's a small "Amazon Basics" logo laser-etched into the front of the base.

This AmazonBasics Modern Two Handle Goose Spout Basin Faucet, 4", Satin Nickel, will never be mistaken for a high end faucet but it looks nice and is budget friendly.

At the current price of less than $44, it is comparable in price and quality to Glacier Bay brand found at Lowe's. I am not a faucet snob - there are times when budget hardware makes sense (or is a necessity) and this one functions well and looks attractive. We put it in a sink in the basement and I would expect to get maybe 10 years use from it since it isn't in a high use area.

This is for a 3 hole sink so make sure that's what you have. Installation was as easy as any other faucet installation, although we have installed a lot of faucets over the years. It can be accomplished by anyone who is reasonably handy with some basic plumbing tools although if you have old plumbing, you may well face issues like needing to replace rusty shut off valves, etc. If you have never installed a faucet before, I strongly suggest watching a few videos on YouTube to determine whether you want to try this yourself.

This faucet is made of a zinc alloy, although the spout is stainless steel so it doesn't have the heft of a brass fixture but it's reasonably weighty and solid feeling. The satin nickel finish is nice, especially for places with hard water as it doesn't show spots readily. The gooseneck spout is so convenient. It also includes a pop-up drain assembly (that is mostly plastic with a metal cap) and it functions properly so far.

If you are looking for a budget priced faucet and like the looks of this, you will likely be pleased with the quality.

Update:

After a few weeks, I noticed what looked like water spots on the face of the faucet under the spout. Unfortunately, they are not water spots and cannot be removed. The first one we got doesn’t have this problem. Unfortunately, we waited too long to return it. My advice: If you see this happening, return it pronto. These are not water spots but a defect which cannot be corrected and mar the appearance of the faucet.

We got this to replace a 25-yr old Delta faucet that was corroding away at the base.

What I like:
1. The price. This faucet costs about 1/4 what our old one did
2. The materials: plastic and stainless, so no corrosion.
3. The design: The spout is higher and hangs out about 2 inches further, making it easy to wash your arms. Compare pictures 2 and 3 which show where the water strikes the bowl.
4. Installation: No plumbers putty needed for a leak-free installation. The gasket provided for the base seals it to the sink. And, the washer under the sink flange seals perfectly.

What I Didn’t Like:
1. The white plastic bracket that holds the stopper pull rod wasn’t straight. You can see this in the first picture.
2. When I opened or closed the sink, my husband observed that it flexed. In contrast, the one from our old faucet was rigid and made out of aluminum. (We ended up reusing this piece from our old faucet).

We did have problems getting the sink plug mechanism to work smoothly. But, the causes were two: the angle of the existing hole in our counter didn’t match that required for this faucet and, the bracket that held the pull rod wasn’t straight and flexed excessively. We fixed the former by drilling out the hole in our countertop. We fixed the later by reusing the same part from our old faucet.

By the way, don’t throw away the hex head (Allen) wrench. Although not mentioned in the manual or even listed as an included item, it’s for removing the hot or cold knobs. Pull out the colored plug and you have access to the hex screw.

Bottom Line:
I very much like this faucet. It is attractive, the mechanics work smoothly, it is made from materials that will not corrode, the long neck projects much further into the sink making washing your arms easy and it doesn’t require the use of plumber’s putty. I bought a second one for our other sink.
