If you have a crappy regular sink strainer with the rubber ring around the bottom and narrow slots that clogs every 30 seconds get this. It will change your life. I have one in both sinks. It is easy to dump the crap out of it down the disposal, too.

So much better than my old steel sink strainer with the mesh! Our house was going through one of the mesh strainers evry other month. This is one is awesome and does not rust. The handle is a nice touch and makes it easier to take it out of the sink.

Heavy duty indeed. This product is much sturdier than previous strainers. The handle did disappear after months of use, but it is still fully functional. Will probably be the last strainer I need to buy.

I have purchased--and donated--every sink strainer out there.  This is the best. bar none! Cleaning a sink strainer is always a nasty job, but most of the gunk is easily removed by tapping it on the edge of the garbage container--the handle helps, too.  This strainer is truly dishwasher safe, unlike the rest. I have 4 now, so I can have 2 in the dishwasher and 2 in the double sink.  Highly recommend.

I did not like it at all.  Water builds up in the sink.  For some reason, even if there is nothing in the sink and you just run the water, the sink fills up.  It some how makes the drainage of the water very very slow.  I just ordered  another type that I used in the past.  The only reason that I got rid of the original one is that after 5 years, the paint started to chip on it.  I do not recommend the LSW heavy duty sink strainer.
Don't waste your money buying this one. Water does not flow into the drain and it is making noise when the water flows. The material is flimsy and it is not worth the price.

I paid for this myself. I like it. I had to replace my garbage disposal because my old one broke. I ran out and bought one from Lowes. But the darn thing came without a sink strainer. Seriously?! Anyway! I couldn't reuse the old one because the new one was about a quarter, maybe a half inch bigger so the old one kinda fell into the hole. I ordered this one and it fits perfectly. I only have two issues, which is why I took off one star. The drain holes are represented in the description as being large. While they may be larger than others, they aren't that large. If you are running water to wash your hands for example, the water tends to pool up for a bit and will drain off after you close the faucet. It's not bad, but it is noticeable. The second is the product description says it's heavy duty. No it's not. It's pretty thin stainless steel. But it looks nice. My mom complimented me on it. And it fits perfectly. It drains OK. It wasn't too expensive. Not too bad, all things considering.
I bought these because it said "Heavy Duty" but they're not. I should have known because of the price. They work though and I like the little handle.

This is a great example of a simple yet well made product that performs its function perfectly.  My previous strainer was a rubber-net reversible type that would get entangled with sink detritus and begin to turn disconcerting colors with some sort of growth.  Not so with the LSW strainer.  The drain holes are numerous enough to let water through yet small enough not to become clogged with food stuff.  To empty, just knock out the strainer into the disposal.  Run it through the dishwasher and it comes out gleaming and sterile.  I think of this strainer as a sink upgrade.

Highly recommend, I've used for 3 years and am ordering more for our new home.  Best features include:
1) easy to clean, no groves, rubber seals, or little knobs that stay gooey and gross
2) does not rust or corrode
3)  forms tight seal to trap food particles but easily lets the water pass through
4)  I've tried several other types of strainers before this one, and this is the best in my opinion.
A small thing in life but brings me much satisfaction!

I'm really glad I bought this.  I've had it many months now.  Its sturdy and doesn't get rusty, yucky.  It has a little handle so I don't have to dig it out of the sink with a spoon.  It fits right down in the drain and doesn't stretch out like screens.  Seems like a lot of money for a little thing, but its worth it.

I purchased all Danze units for both of my showers. A Thermostatic Control D155000BT, 3 On/Off/Volume Controllers D135300BT, an Overhead Shower drop, a Wall Mounted Shower connector for a hand held shower wand, and 4 of these Body Sprayers. Both the pressure and the flow rate are fantastic, if you remove the little plastic flow regulator just inside the mounting flange. It will come out with a small pair of needle nose pliers, and you can always put it back in, if you think you a wasting too much water. After 6 months of use, my water bill has not gone up 1 penny. My water bill gets charged in 1000 gallon increments, 1000 being the minimum that you pay for, even if you only use 1 gallon. I have never gone over 1000 gallons, so I pay the same exact amount every month. If I want more pressure and flow, I am in control of that now, not some control monger politician, who has no business telling me how to use my water.

If you do remove the filters and flow controls from these units, you want to make sure that there are fine screen filters in both your hot and cold water lines just before your shower heads, otherwise you will eventually have clogged Body Sprayers that you probably won't get unclogged. If shower heads get  clogged from hard water, they can always be unclogged using CLR, but if fine chunks a debris, like small rocks, sand, and silt, get into your shower heads, they are toast. If you purchase the Danze Thermostatic Controller D155000BT it already has removable and easily cleanable fine filters on the supply side of the unit. You also want to be sure and use a minimum of 3 Body Sprayers on one circuit to distribute the total pressure across all 3 heads, otherwise the excess pressure can cause a separation between the front and back side of the body sprayer.

I purchased all 3/4 inch high flow rate units for the Thermostatic Control and Volume Controls. I also intentionally chose to use 3 separate Volume controls, instead of a Diverter Valve, because I wanted to be able to turn on all of the shower heads and body sprayers at the same time. It's a little bit more plumbing work, but it was worth it. With this setup, when I turn on all 3 volume controls to maximum flow, I still get good pressure and flow from all 3 at the same time, and I get completely drenched with water from all sides. The pressure drops down to about 60% compared to the pressure when only one valve is open at full flow.

These little units look great and the massage function feels great at high pressure and flow.

So basically, I LOVE all of the Danze products that I have purchased, and I will more than likely never buy anything else. I am now a Danze fanatic and loyal customer.

  All of the Danze Shower products are made with good quality brass, with good quality ceramic valves in the Volume control valves. I spent many months researching the best quality for the price, before I made my purchase. I found that nobody else came close to Danze for the price for their claims of good quality shower and bath components, but when I finally got these units in my hands and installed them and tested them for myself, it put a big huge smile on my face. They really are top quality, and the price is much better than than any other brands with the same quality.

reviews.review_body:
I was trying to upgrade the trim since I had to replace the mixer valve and balancer. I wanted a new look so I really like this. I was kind of disappointed when I opened it. At first, I was like "wow" but then as I unraveled the square trim piece, I frowned to find out it was shiny chromed plastic. Yes.....plastic.

My old one was the round basic - clean design but the general workhorse. I specifically did not want plastic because even though the old valve eventually leaked, the metal trim and handle was still solid. A little tarnished but solid. If anybody knows chromed plastic, you know eventually the chrome will flake off. So beware.....this has a metal base to attach to and a metal handle, BUT the square trim piece that has the hot/cold lettering and lever line is PLASTIC. I guess for now, I won't install it but I will see if I can find something metal everything in the meantime.

reviews.review_body: My return window closed by 2 days, couldn’t get my plumber to install with covid. Faucet does not work, when you divert it, most of the water continues to go through the faucet,  yes, I had to install and uninstall - I would not buy from this seller again. I think I was duped.

The spout and lever are heavy and appear to be durable and are aesthetically perfect.
I cannot say if it's durable because the spout was only installed for 1 day.  After one use by the kids, the second day the spout would not divert to the shower.  I took the two torx screws out and could see the little orange, plastic diverter gate was broken.  It has two tiny little legs that are supposed to hold onto the metal lever.  One of the plastic legs was broken off so the lever would go up but the gate would stay down in the position that allows water to flow through the spout.
I'll order a replacement and I wish I had more confidence that the next one will last longer.  This diverter will be used on a daily basis (or multiple times per day) as you have to use it every time you take a shower.
Very disappointing design.  A 10 cent plastic piece ruins an otherwise nice metal (stainless colored but probably zinc) spout.

Part 2, I sent it back and got a brand new one (Nice job Amazon).  I was eager to see if maybe the diverter was simply a freak manufacturing defect.  It was not.
Additionally, this faucet leaks internally.  When you pull the diverter lever, water gets past the internal plastic plumbing and runs back along the inside of the spout and exits through a little hole on the under side of the spout where it meets the tile wall.  The trouble is if the little hole gets plugged, then water will back up past the supply nipple and into the wall cavity where it will lead to rot.

Also, the diverter gate (see picture) is prone to breakage, if you try to pull it up while water is running, it gets stuck halfway.  Then half the water comes out of the shower head and the other half comes out of the spout.  If you (or your kids) try to pull it up to completely stop the partial flow from the spout and get more water pressure out of the shower, the little plastic legs will break off the diverter gate (see above)

If you fall in love with this spout, you need to be sure to
a) turn off the water before moving the diverter lever
b) make sure the little drain hole stays clear

if you or other users of the bathroom do not follow these tips, you will have trouble.  I sent the second one back.  Thinking more, I cannot rule out that the first one leaked.  It might have leaked too and I didn't notice.

reviews.review_body: I love my new kitchen faucet. The pull down sprayer is really great. It has the buttons to go from stream to spray. I like having the 2 handles, one for cold and one for hot. I highly recommend this faucet to anyone considering buying a new one.

The faucet is very pretty. Love the pull-down sprayer and the ability to pause the flow of the water with a button on the sprayer. I am concerned about it's long-term use since it is plastic.

I ordered this faucet without there being any reviews to guide me, so I guess I got to be the lab rat. I can't speak to the function of the faucet because it's not yet installed (and probably won't be for a while; a one-man whole-home electrical, plumbing, and flooring re-do while also replacing some wall coverings and building all kitchen & bath cabinets/countertops isn't a quick process) but here's what prospective buyers should know:

The escutcheon, body, handles, and spray wand are plastic. The only exterior part that is metal is the spout. The faucet doesn't necessarily look like it's made of plastic but it definitely feels like it's plastic and it obviously weighs much less than an all-metal faucet does. Also, the product photos make the sprayer face/nozzles appear grey but it's black. On the underside of the sprayer, which isn't shown in the product photo, there is a black plastic button which I assume is a pause feature (the instructions are sparse) and a black plastic rocker which I assume changes the water flow from stream to spray.

I'll be back to add to my review once this is installed, which will inevitably be way past the return window. The only reason I'm not returning this right now is because my wife insisted that the kitchen remodel include a two-handle pull-down faucet in brushed metal that isn't too sleek or industrial and this was the only design that she found that cost less than, like, $700.
This faucet is not made very sturdy. The valve in the middle failed and flooded my house.
Beautiful

I used this faucet in a normal household kitchen for two years.

This is a very nice looking product. The design is great, and having the sprayer be one piece with the faucet instead of on the side is super convenient, especially if you only have three holes available in your sink. The body and the sprayer are well made and the finish holds well.

However.

The faucet is made of plastic. That includes valves and handles. The valves are a bit on the tight side, and that makes the handles snap off at the thread where they are threaded into the vertical part.  I have gone through three sets of handles in two years of normal use.

I have to credit the Belanger company for being nice enough to supply me with replacement handles under warranty, but this really should not have been necessary.

These aren't perfect.  They do clog up and require regular cleaning.  However, if leaves and debris form a clog in the downspout, you'll have a more difficult problem to deal with. That's why I use these.  Unfortunately, gutter systems surrounded by a lot of trees are high maintenance.  I haven't found the perfect solution.  I'd rather clean these occasionally than take apart the downspout to remove a clog.  Been there. Done that.

If you're looking for a sure way to clog your downspouts, you've found it with this device. I just removed a dozen of them from my gutters. The beauty of this design is that it catches all of the small pieces of debris that would normally flow out of the gutter without creating a problem (see attached photo). At least they're aluminum so they are recyclable. Or they might make cute hats for small animals.

08/25/'16 Here's a link to a YouTube video by The Home Depot warning homeowners to not use these things; [...]

There is no perfect, maintenance-free solution to debris in rain gutters. But if you stay on top of it, all will go well. Make sure your gutters and downspouts are very clean before installing (use a gas or battery-powered blower to clean out the gutters (you can buy a universal gutter attachment on Amazon for your blower so you can blow from the ground); run water from a hose down the downspouts). Then install the strainer. Periodically, go up on your roof and blow out the gutters, especially during summer and fall. Do it again after all the leaves have fallen for the year and before the first rain. I do this and clogged downspouts are a thing of the very distant past.
Lowe's has these for just under $3.00 each for the 5" size.  The 3" size is even cheaper.

My gutter downspouts are attached to large drainage tubes that are buried under the ground and they run for 30 to 100 feet away from the house.  If I don't use something to catch the leaves and flower petals then the tube gets blocked deep underground and 30 feet away from anywhere I can reach the plug.  I had to run a 50 foot drain cleaning auger and then a 100 foot water hose to clear out the plugs.

I installed these gutter strainers and they trap the leaves and let the water flow over the top and down the drain.  A couple times a year I have to clean around the strainers but that is a lot easier than cleaning out hundreds of feet of buried pipe and trying to locate and remove the plug.

These have worked well for our home and it has made keeping the gutters clean and working a lot easier.  Just make sure that when you install the strainers that you collapse them and insert about an inch or more into the downspout to keep them in place.  Make sure that they open back up and provide a good fit in the downspout.  My downspouts had one screw going into them to hold them into place and I just made sure that the screw went into the mesh to hold the strainer into place.

These are not the solution to all of your gutter issues but for me they are the lesser of two evils and I would rather clean these than find a plug I can't see!

The only thing missing from this product is the ability to buy a 10-pack.

Easy to install and works great. I had my gutters cleaned after hurricane Irma came through and the guy who cleaned them commented on how well it works. It's pretty easy to clean gutters but cleaning out a downspout can prove to be difficult. This keeps you from having to go through that headache.

This is a very simple solution to clogged downspouts, whether they are in a gutter or (as in my case) on a flat roof. The strainer is roughly six inches tall (two to four of which will be inserted into the downspout), and is slightly tapered so that the top is wider than the bottom.

The screen material is not welded together at the ends (you can see it in the picture above if you look at the back side). This allows you to "roll up" the strainer a little bit to make the bottom narrow enough to fit in the downspout's opening; when you let it go, it will expand on its own to hold it in place.

Note that this will only fit in a circular opening, which is what many people have. This will not work if you have a rectangular opening, as it will leave a gap. Also note that you will still have to remove debris if it piles up around the strainer, as this will still cause water to back up, but at least you won't have a clog you'll have to roto-rooter.

If you don't have some kind of anti-debris covering on your gutters, or if you have a flat rook with a simple hole for drainage, this is a low-cost, low-maintenance option I recommend.

Use it for bath tube setup and love it
Wasn’t what I thought it was.  It was going to cost to return so it wasn’t worth the loss has made me read all details closely.
Quick delivery  as described!!!
Perfect for my hundred year old house
Kitchen Sink

Purchased to use in a 1959 canned ham camper. Looked good upon install, seemed sturdy. Problem was as someone else mentioned the threads are faulty. No way will connect to 1/2"  connector. The first one got damaged in the mail and we were very happy with the speed of the replacement, however now of no use to us.
Replaced very similar items.
Well made ,great quality
Easy installation and looks great on my Grand Banks 32 trawler.  Better than the originals that came with the boat and look great.  Came with everything one needs.
The Aqua Plumb is not a high end faucet but it is a well made faucet at a great price
Easy installation
Good craftmanship.
Got these to replace a couple of older handles on a wall-hung sink.  These look good, were easy to install, and seem good quality.  Only time will tell...
These are getting harder and harder to find,  This item seems to be good quality, and worked just fine after I installed it.
just what I needed

The quality is pretty good.  My complaint is with the description.  These faucets do not use a cartridge as stated.  They are the old style faucets with "rubber" washers.  I asked the question about this but no one knew the answer so I relied on the product description.  It was incorrect.  (as of 9-12-16)
Nice looking faucet.
Went on easy, working great so far.
I wish the break was longer.
It's what we wanted, it fit our needs perfectly. Works well.
It serve the purpose ...no enough treads on the stern .,,,,,
Very nicely made, perfect for my application, and a great value!

This had a very cheap handle that I had to personally cut off sharp metal on the bottom to make it safe to use. Plus this is for our fountain water for drinking and now it has a very odd taste that it never had before.
Good product, quick shipping
These installed perfectly, they were a breeze to put in.  They also work great.
easy replacement of faucet on my vintage sink! matches the original
works good

Love these!! My cousin was able to install them easily, and I'm saved from having to modernize when I do not want to, nor do I have the funds for such a thing. The price is a steal, the local hardware store here had them priced double!
Putting on old sinks. Needed a certain look. These are EXPENSIVE our there. Same set for $80 other places. Great price, great look, fast delivery.

A little smaller then I th they would be but very nice. one down side was the bolts to tighten it to the sink where hard to grip and get it tight enough not to move. I Had to use the bolts off my old faucet.
This was as described. A cinch to install and worked just the way it should. I'm happy!!
works great for old sinks.  However, finding washer replacements is almost impossible for some reason.
Wish these came with an installation sheet.
I bought this product for my 1927 bathroom. Exactly what I was looking for. Seriously old school! No ceramic discs. No aerator. Fit in perfectly with the vintage bath.
The hardware is solid and it was very easy to install. It does what I expected it to. My only complaint is that the handles are thin and feel cheap.
Sink only has cold water. These faucets worked great
Used it for my daughter's playhouse and love it! Gave option to chose if I wanted it to display H or C for hot or cold on the top of the faucet
Handle is thin.

Even though these are old fashion faucets.  They're great.  At the only hardware store I could find them in my area they wanted $35 a piece and they weren't exactly the same.  This came in 2 days  and very easy to put on.
Looks good
Decent for 20 bucks, utility faucet nothing special.
The product was reasonably priced but the on and off Handle quality is Definitely on the cheaper side of manufacturing
Great replacement for the old style fawcets. Not the heft of the original, but great look and function for the price.

This is my second time purchasing this faucet--I literally just reordered this item.  It was about five years ago that I ordered the last one so the five year life another review noted is about right (five years of daily use for my household).

I'm satisfied with the faucet and will buy it again in five years, if needed.  It looks great, especially at the price.

This is the second one I installed in the same sink. The flange base is small for the hole in the sink.  The corrugated washer doesn't fit well. The handle is sloppy, even with the screw.
The first valve failed on the stem. I corrected the handle sloppiness by filling the gap with epoxy.  I fixed the corrugated washer by using the old plus new one together.
These valves are unique and hard to find. They are used in children day-care bathroom sinks.

These were installed on an old sink in a 50's vintage wall mounted sink. They fit as expected, however, they are much lighter made than the originals. The handles are thin and cheaply made. I change the handles to a more robust white ceramic just for looks and feel as these are in a church bathroom. Overall a bit pricey for the quality but can't complain as they work as they should.
Very easy to install. They were perfect for my vintage sink!

This faucet is simply garbage. I ordered two. One arrived with a broken handle. The vendor credited the cost. I ordered another. The handles on both faucets come loose every day. I keep a screwdriver next to the sink to tighten the screws every day. I am going to try some locktite. It takes a lot of effort to change the faucets on an old sink. I'm sorry I used such an inferior product

These fit perfectly in my 1905 two faucet sink, replacing the originals which have been out of service for a few decades now, and which look very nearly identical (the handles ARE identical, as is the base, but the spout has been slightly simplified). These are old-fashioned faucets, down to the rubber washers within and the lack of any grille, water-saving feature, or anything other than spout design to control water flow. That is precisely what I wanted, since cartridges and water saving bits of plastic all succumb to lime within a few years in my area. The fewer obstacles there are, the longer a faucet lasts. In any case, these are perfect for a vintage restoration.

I got this as a replacement for an identical faucet that was failing (dripping) after only a few years. I am used to replacing the rubber washers at the bottom of the splined shaft when they wear out & the faucets begin to drip, and occasionally one has to replace the valve seat in a faucet too. This one, though, does not seem to have a removable valve seat, so when it begins to drip you have to replace the whole unit.

The up side for me is that this shape actually does fit into the holes in my odd-shaped two-faucet 1915 porcelain corner sink, and it matches the HW faucet. Two buttons (H & C) are included so that the faucet can be used for either the hot or cold side.

In my experience, this model of faucet lasts around 5 years before they have to be replaced. Not long enough for something that costs $25, but I have not been able to find anything else that fits the sink.
Works great an almost matches our other one, they are hard to find, glad we found one.

I am pleased to have found this product, as I couldn't find any even close to this cheap in stores. The faucet itself is great. As others have noted, the handle is quite flimsy. Sadly, my old handle, which was better, didn't fit.
Looks great and easy to install. I had been searching for these faucets and was thrilled to find them on Amazon and for a great price! Great pressure as well!
Fast shipping and good product

product_title: Kohler K T72768 4 BN T72768 4 BN Artifacts RITE Temp VLV TRM W DIV LVR Brushed Nickel
product_description: Single lever handle allows for simultaneous on off activation and temperature setting Ergonomic handle is ADA compliant Includes push button diverter Trim only requires K 11748 K or K 11748 KS Rite Temp pressure balancing valve with push button diverter sold separately Single lever handle allows for simultaneous on off activation and temperature setting

reviews.review_body: Beautiful, heavy. Wonderful finish. Easy to install yourself.

A year ago I was in the final phase of designing my basement build out. As the contractor started framing, he suggested we flip the planned power room with the laundry room. The end result is thrilling especially the Kohler products installed. We carved out just enough space for an oversized shower.

product_title: Wells CMU3318 99 Craftsmen Series Kitchen Sink 33 50 50 9 Deep Brushed Matte Finish
product_description: Premium 18 gauge Type 304 stainless steel body Equal double bowls 9 inches deep Traditional Brushed Matte Finish providing a durable scratch resistant surface Mirror highlighted rim adds sophistication to the minimalist appearance Sound and condensation absorbent coating and padding Mounting hardware included Drain openings 3 1 2 inches diameter Drain placement centered

reviews.review_body: Very nice sink and very deep. The only problem is the drain insert. It turns and stops the draining without me turning it so I'm constantly having to adjust it

product_title: Kohler K 31615 95 Cimarron Toilet Tank Ice Grey
product_description: 1 28 gpf 4 8 lpf Left hand Polished Chrome trip lever Combines with the K 31588 bowl to create a complete K 31621 Cimarron elongated toilet Single flush gravity uses the force of gravity and a precision engineered tank bowl and trapway to create a strong siphon during flushing

reviews.review_body: The color matched perfect to what already had

product_title: KOHLER 6139 ST Octave Sponge Caddy for Octave K 3842 K 3843 K 3844 and K 3845 Kitchen Sinks Stainless Steel 4 00 x 3 00 x 2 50 inches
product_description: Comes included with K 3842 K 3843 K 3844 and K 3845 Octave kitchen sinks Fits securely over sink divider Provides easy access to sponges brushes and other dishwashing tools Durable stainless steel construction Dishwasher safe

reviews.review_body: Nice sponge caddie a liitle pricey being from Kohler but looks great
Love this
Fits perfectly on our new Kohler staccato sink
Good sponge caddy
Excellent quality.  First saw the product at the Kohler design center.  Very happy with product
2 months and still looks new.  No mold.
sponge caddy! works great!
Good finish, matches other Kohler SS finishes
This sponge holder is awesome . I bought a few with suction cups that did not work. You can bend it to fit your sink.
I have a few of  these.  They work great on my Kohler double sink.
This is the most sanitary storage I have found for kitchen sink sponge storage. Keeps the sink looking organized too.
Nice accessory for kitchen sink.
It looks very stylish and fits snugly over my middle divider.

Worked perfectly for our non-Kohler sink. We have a quartz double sink in white and this fits perfectly. The suction cup sponge holders do not work because the material is not as smooth as steel and so they release after a while.
I did measure the gap between sinks to make sure I got the right one.
Using it as a retrofit on a corian sink. Had to bend it out a little to fit.

I've been searching for a new sponge caddy for months now. We had an Umbra saddle sink caddy for several years that eventually got stretched out and gross. I loved how that one went over the middle of our sink instead of having suction cups, but didn't love how gross it got from having the wet sponge sit in it. We also didn't need two compartments. This one seems to fit well on our sink. I love how minimal it is, and don't expect to have the same issue with drainage. I just got it, so I can't say how it will hold up, but so far I'm happy.
It works but for what it is it was way over priced.

I love this caddy. It serves very well. I have a MOEN double sink near the window in my kitchen and there is very little space available to have a standing sponge holder. I had to put sponge on the edge of sink and it was always a wet spot there. This bothered me so much and now I don't have to worry about it because sponge is sitting on this caddy and can drip onto the sink.
I am very much satisfied with this purchase. Thank you Amazon!

Great item for holding a sponge. Perfect size. My husband does't like it though because it only fits our sink in the exact middle of the double sink divider - right where the faucet runs water over when swiveling it from one side to the other, which drenches the sponge. When we try to move the holder to the far end of the sink divider (which is slightly wider on our sink) it puts tension on the holder which makes it slowly slide back to the center.

I was tired of having my sponge caddy with the suction cups slide down or fall off the side of the sink.  This is "low profile" and works well. There are silicone "buttons" that keep it from sliding along the sink divider.  Make sure that you measure the divider between your double sink before ordering if you don't have this sink model.

I don't like the design on this. It fits on my Kohler sink alright but because it can only be attached right in the middle, the sponge gets wet every time you turn the faucet on. If you don't wring the sponge out, even if you aren't using it, you will end up with a soggy, stinky sponge.

Bought this to hold our sink sponge in the center between our two stainless steel sinks. Works great and rubber nubs help keep it in place without scratching the stainless. Looks good there and is very convenient.  Very happy with purchase.
3rd one I've bought. Very happy.
