reviews.review_body: It looks good and works well.  My biggest complaint is that there is really no guidance on how to make the electrical connections inside the leg; the steps are there but even my smallest wire nuts would not fit three.  Warmly Yours should have a video showing that part of the installation.  Otherwise the installation went fairly smoothly.
The towel warmer is fantastic!  The warm towel out of the shower is so comforting!  I wouldn’t want to be without it now that we have it!

product_title: WBM Home Faucet Filter Highly Efficient Filtration Performance Reduces Lead Chlorine Bad Taste BPA Free Water Purifier 1 ct Replacement 2 Count

reviews.review_body:
These work really great with my WBM faucet filter, definitely a great buy and a great find.
Water taste is much better.
I like the convenience of switching from tap water to filtered water.

Needed new filtration for my kitchen.
Follow installation direction and was able to install it myself. Also, very good product for the price.
Great system for improving the quality of your water.  Greatly improved the taste of mine.

This was a great option for us in our new house. The water tasted high in fluoride and phosphor so I was happy with the ability to drink water from the faucet that didn't taste bad. Super easy to install and use!

I liked that I can switch between filtered water and regular water depending on what I’m doing it wasn’t easy for me to put together I had someone do it for I guess I’m not as smart as I thought but it’s great it made me decide to get one for the whole home now

My family drinks alpt of water so having this provide clean fresh water is so great. Very easy to assemble and set up and so far it's working good. Water comes out cold and tasting fresh. Definitely recommend

This filter works properly... I have used it in my India trip, the water in my house looks clear but it has chlorine taste. So, to remove the chlorine taste I made use of this filter and amusingly it got clogged in 2 days. But it is very easy to clean, you can either use the sand paper provided or a tooth brush. It definitely filters particles in the water.
Now I can have unlimited filtered water without hassle.  Easy to transfer between regular and filtering.
This is a great little water filter! It was easy to install, comes with three fitting options, and the water taste great! I recommend it, it has taken the place of our water filter pitcher.

Filtered water flavor is good.product comes in small pieces and it took  me about 30 minutes to put it together.
The part that attaches to the tap head needs to be screwed with screw driver.water pressure can push the filter to fall off.
Make sure the filter is compatible with your kitchen faucet head .

The directions were not the easiest to understand, it would be very helpful if the pieces were numbered. The filter portion was easy to figure out, but pieces that hook it up to the faucet, not so much. I’m still not sure why it came with sandpaper.

Once we got it installed, it worked as described. No more bad tasting water. My son is super picky and even he likes it. I can stop contributing to the disposable plastic water bottle problem!

This is the third water filtration system that I have received.  this works well but it has the same design flaw as the others.  To go from tap water to filtered water you turn a lever.  Since the casing is plastic it will eventually break with using the lever over time.
The one test i use to test the purity of the filtered water is to freeze it (impurities make it cloudy).  The clearer the ice the purer the water (freeze Arrowhead water to see almost perfect clarity).  This ice is somewhat cloudy.
Took forever to install to my faucet. Not my favorite purchase.

Unfortunately, my sink faucet is apparently so old that this unit doesn't work with it. Overall construction appears solid. Instructions are a little vague and the line drawings aren't especially clear, though you can figure it out.

Frustrating to install in general. The sizes weren't quite right and the other pieces constantly came loose and caused leaks randomly. You never knew when you would get hosed down. The bubbler held too much water for too long and eventually the whole thing just looked more gross than just drinking the terrible water here.

When the time came I couldn't take it anymore, I was glad to replace it and throw it out entirely. Not a great job.

As most of us know, drinking water is traveling to our faucets through very very old pipes, which have accumulated residue and toxins, not to mention pipes made out of lead, harmful to kids especially.
Years ago I discovered how bad the residue is when I rinsed out a plain clear plastic bowl and left it over night to dry. The next day I found the inside of this bowl covered with little specks which seemed to be metal. I bought a water filter immediately.
I no longer live in that house but keep a water filter for all drinking/cooking water on the faucet in my kitchen.
The WBM Home Faucet Water Filtration System is rather difficult to install in part due to the garbled instructions.  Since I had problems installing other filter systems before (needed to be able to connect a watering hose to same faucet ????????? ??), I knew what to do and got it done in no time.
The lever on the side is clear and the water tastes great.
Plus: water tastes great, switch mode on faucet easy, unit looks great!
Minus: instructions garbled, no indicator light to show water is ready to consume (others blink until water is ok), no indicator for filter change/must do so manually.
Price for replacement filter rather high.

Unlike the two major brands of faucet filters where you can immediately taste the difference in the water, I couldn't tell with this one.  The water from the regular part of the faucet doesn't look different or taste better.  In order for me to tell if any real difference is being made, I will have to test the water.  Not what I signed up for.  I will however monitor this over a few days of use to see if something changes after the filter has been in use for a few days or by freezing to see if it freezes clear which is usually a good test.

I didn't install this myself.  As soon as I opened the box, I bucked.  There were too many pieces for me and just so you know, you won't need all of them.  I hate puttingnything together so if it's not easy and if I actually have to read and pay attention to the instructions, I don't want to do it myself.  A friend did it for me and he is an engineer so it was easy for him.  Hadn't he done it, it would have cost me a visit by the plumber so until the water gets tested it's a 3.4 for me.

I am very happy with this water purifier system.  I am not a fan of tap water because I can taste the metals and impurities in it.  This little device does the trick!  It eliminates  that taste altogether.  It tastes like bottled spring water to me. I like the look of the device too. It isn't too bulky and it doesn't get in the way when I'm washing larger dishes.  It has 2 settings on it which are very easy to switch on and off.  One setting is for washing dishes and the second setting is for purified drinking water.  It is very convenient to use.  The installation of this device was pretty simple but to be fair I am moderately mechanically inclined.  I  was able to install it without too much trouble.  DO read the instruction pamphlet before diving in to the installation part. It comes with several faucet pieces for you to use depending on the type and size of faucet head that you have.  You will NOT need all of the parts.  One of the the pictures posted in this review show the parts that I DID NOT use.  I still kept the pieces though incase I ever change out my kitchen faucet to a different type.  There are 3 different types of faucet heads that this device will fit.  Determine which type you that have in your kitchen and then read the installation instructions for that particular type.  This is why it is best to read the pamphlet beforehand or you may find yourself feeling unnecessarily overwhelmed.  It doesn't look like it is compatible with a pull down faucet head/ all in one sprayer.  I would double check this piece of information  before purchasing IF you have that type of kitchen faucet.  Also, do not throw away the little turning tool that it comes with or the piece of sandpaper.  The tool is helpful for the installation and the sand paper is used for the occasional cleaning/maintenance of the device.  Another thing to keep in mind is that you can use this water filtration system on your outdoor faucet spigot!  This would come in handy for easily filling up your dogs/cats water bowls when they are outside and providing them with purified water.  I love this versatile option because I have pets.  Last but never least, I noticed that the when the water filtration setting is on, the water tends to have a light back spray effect.  This happened when I was washing fruits and berries.  It wasn't much of an issue for me though.  I simply just turned the water down some and that did the trick.  There was no back spray at all when I turned the water filtration setting off to wash dishes.  I don't have a very deep sink though so perhaps that was the issue.  Note that the pamphlet says the filter will last you anywhere from 3 - 6 months depending on your water pressure and the quality of your city's water.  Yes you heard right!  The filters are replaceable AND they are easy to swap out!  It makes sense to me that I will be able to tell by the quality of my drinking water when I need to replace the filter.  I am going to purchase some extras filters to keep on hand.  Overall all, this water purifying system is efficient, economical AND affordable. I would purchase again!

This filter will not last a year, but for the price, it is a value. Replacement filters are less expensive than other brands. You can buy a new filter assembly for less than the cost of a replacement Brita filter.

I have been wanting one of these for awhile! I have fairly good water out of the tap, but am glad for the extra filtration. It was fairly simple to install. The water is very clean tasting. A good to have item to help reduce the bad stuff!

It is easy to install and the water tastes better than before. I used to buy water bottles now I got this faucet a filtered pitcher with a spout. It works great for an affordable price. But by installing this the gap between the tap and sink has decreased. It became a big problem to wash the dishes.

I had a faucet-mount, bypass water filter a very long time ago. I've been using a name brand counter-top 'pitcher' for many years recently. I change my filters every 3-4 weeks, so when I saw this faucet mounted system, with a filter that lasts up to 90 days, I thought it made sense to try it! Having installed the previous faucet-mounted one I had, and assembled rooms full of Swedish and particle board furniture over the decades, I was pretty confident this would be no problem to install. I was mistaken. It took a bit to make sense of which type of mounting I would be doing (think innie vs. outie belly buttons and then an alien third option) and which pieces-parts I would need for that process. I separated out the parts I wouldn't need (it's great that they include everything so you don't have to pick when ordering, before you've even figured out what you have, or so you have the option to move it at some point in the future to another location). I removed my existing sprayer first, so I knew my sink had an outie. I put the ring on first, put the included washer in the main body of the unit, put that up to the faucet and tightened the white plastic ring. Well, I turned it... it sort of tightened, but then just before feeling really secure, it loosened again like the threads were stripped, but they aren't. I re-'tightened' it. I turned on the water slowly and the filter worked. The water tasted good. I wanted more so I turned the faucet on more and the unit shot off the faucet into the sink. I removed it, took out the washer, put it back on and turned the water on. I got water shooting out of the faucet, where the unit is mounted. Nope. Gotta have a washer. I happen to have one in my tool box that is half the thickness of the one the manufacturer provided. Unfortunately, it was a fraction smaller in diameter, but I tried it anyway. The mount tightened so I was very hopeful. Unfortunately, when I turned on the faucet, the whole rig flew off the faucet again. I'm keeping it because it's possible that the 'outie' portion of my faucet is removable, but since doing so will damage it and likely make it unusable, I am not going to try that route and the 'innie' mount parts/process until I have a replacement sprayer ready to go if it still doesn't work. The filtered water did taste very good, so I recommend giving it a try. At this price, if you can get it installed securely, and the filters really do last closer to 90 days... it's well worth it.

Well packaged filter that came with everything you need in the box. The instructions included didn't have the best english, but the pictures helped me figure out what to do. Took about 15 minutes to install and the water pressure is still pretty good. I also had to adjust the rubber washer in the connector between the filter and the main faucet so you may need a pair of needle-nose pliers to get the job done.
I couldn’t put this in my faucet, I have the extended sink faucet and could not put it on, make sure this is compatible with your faucet
It works great and it was easy to install. It does leak a little. I just wish the replacement filter didn't cost more than the actual system.

product_title: KOHLER K 4662 0 Lustra Round front Toilet Seat White
product_description: Round closed front toilet seat with cover Sturdy chip resistant polypropylene with a finish that won t stain or peel Includes a cover and plastic hinges

reviews.review_body: I ordered this product and had it within a few days.  It was exactly what i needed.  Would definitely order again.

I'd gone through a lot of Home Depot Bemis wooden seats.  Wood chips easily.  Although the Bemis seats are comfortable and come in many decorations, they're not worth throwing away the money.  Although one reviewer remarks that a cold plastic seat is cold in the middle of the night, I'd put up with that instead of the throw-away wooden seats.

I just ordered this product on PlumberSurplus for $47.44.  Free shipping.  Plus tax, the whole order came to 51.35.  Cheaper than Amazon! Although it hasn't arrived yet, am giving it lots of stars because ANYTHING is 100% better than Bemis wooden toilet seats.  If I have any problems with it, will give another review.

UPDATE:  (7/24/13 - four years later.)  The toilet seat is still in "new-like" conditions with NO scratches -- easy to clean.
I had to cancel this order almost immediately. The dimensions is for elongated one. See for yourself![...]

Full disclosure. I got this seat, as new in a repackaged condition by Amazon. It was brand new and still had plastic on it, in the original Kohler box.

It cost me 6 dollars. I think they possibly made a mistake with the pricing, but.. I'm not complaining.

Even at that price, this is a garbage seat.. Look elsewhere if possible.

I'm  not sure what happened to their quality.
The seat this replaced was much sturdier and felt a lot more comfortable.
This one is bendy, and thinner, and sits recessed in and down into the toilet very slightly. This means you won't be able to add a bidet addition if you had a mind to.

For the price of the seat, you can buy a different toilet that will fit any seat you want..

I'm actually looking for a regular straight hinged replacement if anyone has one they can recommend. It's a mystery to me how anyone rated this one so highly.
Perfect!!!!
Perfect match
Met expectations
everything was fine
excellent  product
Perfect color-perfect size-perfect fit.
Exactly what I was looking for.
matched my existing toilet and hope it lasts the one I replaced
Quality toilet seat.
Nice
It's a perfect fit and color match!  I'm glad to have found a source for this discontinued Kohler toilet seat.
Nice to  have a replacement that really matches the original  - even after 10 years.
Great price with fast shipping...I only wish they offered the 2 different size screws that you can get for seat...had to order those separate to fit toilet securely
Product was missing screws and nuts.  It came in a box that was duct taped shut. It had obviously been opened and reprocessed as New.

I bought cheap toilet seats before and know what to look for and this Kohler toilet seat was not one of them. Very well made and sturdy and looks retro cool with my white toilet and black and white checkerboard bathroom floor.
Exactly what I needed, but pricey for a toilet seat.  This color is hard to find so I was happy to find it on Amazon.
the main problem is the color does not match up with the toilet.
Not to good. Seat does not sit flush on toilet and had some minor scratches.

I WAS TERRIBLY DISAPPOINTED WHEN I RECEIVED THIS MODERATELY EXPENSIVE KOHLER TOILET SEAT AS IT IS MADE OF SUCH A THIN, CHEAP LOOKING PLASTIC.  THIS IS NOT WHAT I INTENDED AT ALL.  I LIKE THE SLEEK DESIGN, BUT THE MATERIAL USED IS NOT OF THE QUALITY I WAS EXPECTING.

The hard wear that came with it did not work. I had to go to Home Depot to buy the proper hardwear to secure the toilet seat to the toilet.
From what I understand this is a redesigned toilet seat by Koehler. Unfortunately they did not do a good job.
This was to replace my 17 years old seats.  Fits great but not exact match to the old seats.

Doesn't stay in place keeps on o
Coming out if it's place

We were replacing the toilet seat for one of our Kohler toilets.
We had already used the same product for another toilet a year ago.
Best price was through Amazon.com
If I fits, I sits.
Good
Loved that it made my toilet look new again, but way too expensive. The cover does not go all the way back but it fits.

We needed to replace a 10-year-old seat of the same color/model and this was the best price and availability we could find.  The seat arrived when expected and is a perfect match to the original.  I would use this purchase method/site again for such purchases.

The inside edges of the seat, where you sit, are too sharp.  Need to be careful when you sit down.
Also, the plastic nuts which are provided to fasten the seat to the bowl do not work.  They are a strange design which do not grab the bolt securely.  I had to use the bolt & nut from the seat which I replaced.
As described and easy to install.  Enough said.

The color matched my Kohler Seafoam One Piece perfectly but after installation you'll realize that you've made a huge mistake.  The seat isn't very sturdy and moves around a lot.  The design of the seat makes sitting on it quite uncomfortable and you will start losing feelings in your legs after maybe 5-7 minutes.  Really just a terrible terrible seat.  I can't wait for this one to break so I can replace it already.
As advertised.

i have a bathroom from the 1940s and needed a new toilet seat to match our pink and blue bathroom.  this is exactly the same brand and color as our toilet and it matches perfectly.  i will it had been cheaper, but i'm thankful to have found it!
color matched, easy to install
The replacement seat is OEM but isn't exactly like original.  Seat is thinner and buttons that hold it off ceramic bowl are smaller.
Very nice comfortable with a sleek look, in a pleasant grey color that is not too dark.  Seems very well made and was so easy to install on matching commode.
Love this smooth, comfortable and well built toilet seat. It was well worth the price. Looks great in my new bathroom.

Spent a little more for a seat that was a perfect style and color match to our original Kohler toilet.
It sure beats looking at mismatched/coordinating colors or the expense of all new bathroom fixtures.
wanted innocent blush color, but this looks like a light beige.  otherwise like the seat.
This replacement toilet seat is the perfect match for my Kohler toilet. I have been searching everywhere for this color.  It fits perfectly and was easy to install.

15 years of looking every once in a while, but color matching was a problem with less expensive seats Kohler seats: biscuit too light, almond too green, sand too dark. Innocent blush matched the existing toilet. Nice. Oh, it fits perfectly.

We bought this replacement toilet seat for our Kohler Rialto toilet.  Yes, it costs about 3 times more than a generic replacement from Home Depot, but I figured this would be the best match and an easy install.  Well, after one week of use, the seat hinge pins fell out and the seat came off in my hand!  The seat also strikes me as far less sturdy than the original it replaced.

I am sending this back. It is impossible to install and tighten. This is the second one we are buying. Even with the first one, I had to call a handy man to install it and it never tightened either. I contacted Kohler to MAKE sure that this was the correct replacement model. I told them that the original seat cover was heavy duty enough to sit on. Their response was, why would anyone sit on the toilet? Obviously no one has children there and they do not sit while their children are taking baths. I've had it with Kohler. We are going to replace ALL our kohler toilets.

The seat is fine with perfect matching black color however, the mounting kit doesn't work. I received the tapered plastic nut which came with the seat. I tried different tricks to keep the seat in place but to no avail. I tried to install the old seat hardware but don’t fit.  Needs bigger hole size.  I called Kholer, now I am waiting for the new hardware to arrive. Alternatively, I found on Amazon, several options to buy a sturdy mounting hardware but I will wait for Kholer first.  What amazes me Is that a big Corp of Kholer size couldn’t provide the correct hardware for mounting.  Why????

I have had this style Kohler toilet seat before, but have been disappointed with this batch.  I ordered seat replacements for 2 toilets and one seems to be satisfactory and the other is problematic. For some unknown reason, Kohler designers felt compelled to change the attaching "hardware" to a sub-standard design using plastic bolts and plastic wing nuts.  One of the bolts will not tighten properly and the seat loosens constantly. In this case, spending this kind of money on a Kohler product was not worth it at all. I am very frustrated with this change of design.
This seat works very well and fits.

This product has been redesigned by Kohler.  It is not the same as the original toilet seat.  Called Kohler because there was a defective nut and they are sending a replacement.  However, I told them we were not happy with the seat as the ring surface is more rounded (original was more flat), but more importantly the lid can not open far enough to rest on the toilet back, therefore it will likely snap, if someone leans back too far.  Kohler apologized, admitted they redesigned the seat, and gave me two suppliers to call, to see if they have any "old stock".  Seriously, this toilet seat cost a fortune, Kohler needs to do better, particularly when they make a toilet that has a proprietary seat.
Purchased  these to replace seats on 2 Kohler Rialto toilets; toilets were installed in 1991 and was pleased to find these fit perfectly.

Unless you are very patient, somewhat clever at MacGyvering parts to make work, don't bother. Replacement Kohler toilet seat itself is a decent part, with a shape and color that matches the old (discontinued toilet in 1995) but the hardware mount is lame, insufficient and simply does not hold the seat down to the unit. The washer has an option for long or short fit to ensure that this seat would work with multiple similar units. The problem is the the reversible washer does not work and renders the moulded bracket unstable. The only way to make secure is to bore out a larger hole in the washer and then use a nylon bolt and locking washer (from original toilet) and a trip to Home Depot, in order to create a pressure fit. Once that was complete, the seat will remain somewhat stable, but overall this is a design fail. I give it a D- Kohler.

The seat fits ok, but it is obvious this is not built like the original seat.  It does not bolt to the toilet frame giving it a good strong support.  Plastic clamps slide around each side of the bolts and can come of just as easily.  The seat itself is more bowl shaped.  It's definitely a step or two down from the original.

My first time actually buying a new seat. At first it was a little weird since it is different from my old one. A few weeks later and haven't even noticed the differences. The plastic seems a little cheap at first, but it is definitely better than my old one.

I am impressed by the fact that a toilet seat can have so many opinions. This seat works, supports the body, and is simple to install. The price on Amazon is better than from Kohler.

It's not padded, it's not warm, it isn't slow to close, but it covers the bowel and this one isn't cracked like the one it replaced.

Toilet seat was fine.  The mounting hardware did not fit our Kohler toilet. We returned the seat.  I called Kohler to voice the problem.  I was told they could send us the old mounting hardware for a small extra sum.  I reordered the toilet seat, then tried to order the old mounting hardware.  I was told they only had the new hardware.  Rather than return the seat a second time We went to Lowe's and rigged up our own screw/nut mounting hardware.  I called Kohler again to tell of the problem and was told that , yes, they did have old mounting hardware- which they then sent at no charge- too late.

I used this to replace a seat on a Kohler Rialto. It is the perfect size and shape and is recommended by Kohler as the correct replacement for the Rialto. The quick release system is a good idea for ease of cleaning, but it keeps the seat from being really firmly attached to the bowl. Worse, the plastic "nut" was designed for a tapered hole, apparently something Kohler began using in later designs. The tapered nut contacts the straight hole in the Rialto in such a way that, when you tighten it, it does not "cinch up" on the bolt but just strips and turns. I ended up replacing the included hardware with a brass tank bolt set from the local hardware store, which finally got the seat hardware firmly attached to the bowl. Sheesh. For nearly $80, you'd think Kohler could have done a better job than this.

I have a designer single piece Kohler toilet with "almost round" front and with toilet seat bolts going into the built-inside nuts.  Original seat had some kind of film over plastic that was partially ripped, so it was time for the replacement.
Since the toilet shape was a little more-round-than-most, and due to the bolt-only / no nut design, went with the top of the line Kohler (master bedroom / buy the best thing once, etc.).

It is good, but not great.  IMHO since it is the ONLY ADA-compliant model, they have added $20 for those who have to be compliant.  All you get is an additional pair of radial support feet under the seat.

It is not thicker or heavier or better looking than their $30 models from Home Depot that I have perused and decided to get a "better" seat.
It has a regular slightly elongated shape, so the front fit is not that close to the shape of "my" bowl.
It has a regular hinge so the cover slams eagerly.
Unlike similarely proced American Standard 5320.110.020 it has no hinge adjustment, so I could not move the seat forward to compensate for the out of the ordinary shape. Nor does it have quick release attachment.

Do not take me wrong - it is an all-plastic (Polypropilene) seat that is sturdy and shiny and with good looks.  It's just not worth the money they ask for it.
Kohler needs to make the instructions more viewer friendly.  A simple task of replacing my toilet seat was a hastle due to poor instructions.
Cheap light weight plastic. Easy to install, but definitely not worth the price.

I like the seat but I do not like the way it fits the Memoirs toilet. I think the toilet needs to be redesigned and not have such a bulky rim at the top below the seat. All the seats look awkward on this toilet.
Matched the color of the 1980's toilet exactly.  Pricey but necessary

I am an architect and a specifyer and for years I have specifed Kohler.  NEVER AGAIN!!!  This seat is the biggest piece of junk I have ever tried to install.  First, most toilet seats are soft closing and made of solid wood or heavy plastic. and run around $39-$49.  This one does not and isn't either and costs $120.  Next, I have installed probably 30+ toilet seats in my several homes over the course of my life and have never had this kind of difficulty.  The plastic receivers that the bolt screws into, cannot be tightened all the way.  Then you put he clamp on to make it fixed and all is good until someone sits on it and the bolt strips and the seat gets completely loose again.  I ultimately had to find the right size stainless steel Nuts and bolts and install them.  I need to also install a lock nut as they get loose also over time.  Bottom line, the seat is horrible quality and the installation is a joke.  Do not ever waste your money on this "garbage".

Item supplied with wrong mounting kit. Apparently they used two styles of mounting kits and my seat was shipped with the kit that wasn’t correct for my bowl. Had to wait 5 days for Kohler to ship me the correct kit.

Matches my Kohler Innocent Blush toilet perfectly.  However the metal and rubber hardware you're supposed to put in the holes does not fit.  I had to hammer them in, and doing so cut the rubber and made it so screws don't have anything to which to screw in.  Holes in toilet are too small, buy just a millimeter or 2.  So I have a seat that is new,  but not secure.

The toilet seat fit well and was absolutely the right color....which I worried may be wrong. The price was more than I expected to pay and I can see a seam in one side where it was molded together but otherwise, everything is o.k. I was glad to still be able to get the Wild Rose color after 27 yrs. in my home.

I had to replace the seat on a Rialto toilet.  The item was shipped promptly, but upon inspection I found the seat to be heavily scratched.  The item was supposed to be new, so I assume that Kohler's inspection and quality control is somewhat substandard.  Given the $90 cost, I would expect a bit more care in checking the quality of items that are shipped.  After receiving a replacement, the seat installed quickly although I had the same problem as many others in removing the old seat from the toilet.  The seat is attached via anchors on the top surface of the seat area and the bolts tend to rust making them almost impossible to remove.  I was luckier than most people as one of the bolts actually unscrewed; however, the other one required a couple of hours trial and error before I resorted to using a crowbar and prying it and the anchor out.  The first anchor was reused, but the second required another couple of hours to find some sort of anchoring system to hold the seat in place.  The seat is fine but I am a bit disappointed in Kohler overall.

This fit perfectly and the color matched exactly from a toilet twenty years ago. Our porcelain toilet color is a perfect color match of Rose mauve. We now don't have to replace the whole toilet. A big plus.

product_title: KOHLER 10590 AK BN Showerhead One Size Vibrant Brushed Nickel
product_description: Katalyst air induction technology maximizes the air water mix for a powerful even flow Optimized sprayface with 66 nozzles delivers a more focused coverage of large water droplets Minimizes wasteful overspray and increases cleaning and hair rinsing performance 2 5 gpm gallons per minute flow rate Showerarm and flange not included

reviews.review_body: What arrived was not as described - the Amazon Kohler store needs to review the materials it has posted
A little loud, but overall Great replacement really good coverage
Provides a strong water stream.

great shower head-looks good but basically made of plastic can not determine how long it will hold up further to my review after 6 months we observed a leak from the ball joint which got worse and worse and found a crack in the gasket which rides on top of the ball, a stream of water shoots out above the shower enclosure and out on the floor of the bathroom, we lived with this for 6 months and had to purchase a new shower head I thought kohler put out better product especially for 70 dollars.
I have purchased this twice now. Works great.
we put this shower head in our rental/vacation home (master bathroom) , making for nice relaxing showers for us & our renters.
Great shower head, there were some complaints about noise but i like the sound, plenty water.

Didn't want to spend a fortune on a shower head.  Found this simple one in polished nickel to match the finish of the rest of the bathroom.  Can't adjust the spray but that doesn't matter to me.  Works fine.  Let's see how long it lasts.

product_title: Home Master HMF2SdgC Whole House Water Filter 4 layer sediment filter 25 to 1 micron Radial Flow Carbon 20gpm 1 NPT ports Patented heavy steel bracket fits 16 wall studs Pressure Performance
product_description: Massive filter housings with 1 ports for the strongest water pressure possible up to 20 gallons per minute Multi gradient density sediment filter has 4 layers to maximize dirt holding capacity while delivering fine filtration down to 1 micron nominal 100 000 gallon capacity replaceable coconut shell carbon filter provides a full year of clean water for a family of four Excellent purification removes up to 95 percent of sediment chlorine chemicals microplastics tastes and odors and 1000s of other contaminants Save time and money Oversize filters improve flow rate to maximize available pressure in the shower and to appliances and reduces maintenance frequency

reviews.review_body: It’s probably easier to install on newer homes. Our home was built in ‘68. We had a plumber come out, he had to replace 90’ of galvanized pipe. And it took him, almost all day. But, I noticed a difference immediately. I have eczema, and I had a good sized spot on my finger, that wouldn’t clear up, with anything. Within two weeks, it was completely healed!!!

Water taste great removed the chlorine. Mounted to the cement basement wall with Hilty bolts but the filters filled with water are heavy and do flex the heavy duty bracket so I decide to install threaded Rod towards the outside utilizing the slots already in the bracket up to some Unistrut that I attached to the floor joist. Doubled nutted the Rods to keep it in place after I adjusted to support the weight. I also made a frame to support the pipe to keep it from moving around and causing leaks. I suggest that you wrap the 1” male pipe going into the head with 14 wraps of Teflon tape. Tighten them down all the way until tight but don’t over tighten. Then back the fittings out completely and rewrap them with 14 more turns of Teflon tape. Tighten them back down . Use a good amount of grease that they supplied to BOTH sides of the “O” ring and to the plastic threads on the filter housing. Tighten by hand only. After you energize the system then use the wrench to tighten to stop any leaks.

I have not actually owned this product, but I own the Tap Master Artesian from this company, and the water is fantastic. I am in a condo so this really isn't an option, but if I owned a house I would probably buy this item.
I really like this filter.  It was not very difficult installation for a DIY.  I installed it on a weekend afternoon.  I love the crystal clear water!

I have owned this whole house water system for about 7 month now and I love it. I have a very big family so I have to replace the filters sooner than recommended. I originally bought it as a pre filtered for my water softener and got moor than i expected. Its a very good investment on all my appliances as well as really great tasting water. The filter are easy to change and long lasting (depending on your family size).I Will buy one for my aunt and try it with out a water softener and see how she will like it.  She is not big on water softener but loves great tasting whter!

This water filer has literally saved my house. We already had a water softener company's filter system in place but it wasn't enough. The water still had a heavy iron content that was staining my appliances and plumbing. It was suggested that we put this filter in after the softener system and it has made a huge impact. We now have perfectly clear water and NO iron stains!!
In addition, the customer service is exemplary.

I have owned the 2-stage filter since March 2014 and I am very happy with the performance. Installation was very straight forward and easy with some basic plumbing knowledge. Changing filters is also a home owner task that can be completed in about 10 minutes. The customer service at Perfect Water Technologies has always been extremely helpful and knowledgeable.I replaced an outdated whole house water filtration system with this unit and have experienced no issues with its operation and water quality is excellent.If you are looking for a filtration system that won't break the bank and preform as advertised this one should be considered!

Super easy to install.  1 inch nipples are not easy to find at Home Depot or Lowes.  I used 1 inch galvanized nipples, Teflon tape and pipe dope and not leaks.  Install on concrete wall.  Water pressure is nice and strong.  So far, best filter I've had and I have had 2 previous whole house filters, one from Sears and the other from a brand on EBAY.  These both were the 4 foot tanks.  Big and hard to move.  This Home Master is SUPER.

I am VERY pleased that I made the decision to purchase this product.  The staff at Advanced Water Filters has always been helpful and friendly when I call with questions and the quality of the construction, ease of use, ease of filter changing and compact design are just a few reasons why I chose this product over other competitors.  Our water has noticeably improved, no longer has a chemical smell and, thankfully, tastes like nothing :)  We receive water from Cary, North Carolina water system, which passes all government requirements for safe drinking water.  However, it amazes me what gets filtered out of the water with this system!  I have recommended this products to my neighbors and I would definitely recommend it to any other concerned homeowner - especially if you have children.  I recently changed the filter after 11 months of use and could not believe what was filtered out even on a seemingly healthy municipal water system. It pays for itself easily by not having to buy bottled water or pitcher type filters.  Fresh clean water from any tap in the house. Even the ice cubes from the fridge taste better  without a stale taste.

This system works exactly as described.  After moving into a new house we found a strong chlorine taste and odor in our water along with significant sediment deposits from dried water droplets.  I spent some time researching systems and decided to order the Home Master, installing the system in June 2014.  It was very easy to install and has worked wonderfully.  We have no chlorine taste or smell, until it is time to replace the carbon filter, and the sediment remnants have been nearly eliminated.  My only regret is that I didn't buy the 3 stage system!

I waited a year when I replaced the two filters before I gave this system a review. Our Texas water comes from a lake so I figured the filter would be really dirty. It was dirty but not to bad. Our town seems to be doing a good job of keeping our water clean. So anyway this system works for me. Only complaint is high cost of the carbon filter but if it's made in the USA and works it is what it is.

Our water tasted terrible and was somewhat corrosive to copper pipe due to city water additives.  After fixing several pinhole leaks in our copper piping and paying to have a slab leak repaired, I decided to install a whole house water filtration system.  I decided on the Home Master 2 stage whole house system because it had good reviews, was affordable, and seemed to be relatively easy to install as a DIY project.

I was restricted to a small area of free space for the installation and wanted to keep extra plumbing to a minimum.  I soon discovered that the direction of flow was opposite of what I needed.  In order to maintain the proper flow direction, I was able rotate the housing within the mounting bracket.

The next problem I encountered was mounting the unit.  For some reason, my wall studs were 14" on center instead of 16" so I had to install a horizontal mounting board.

I used Pex to tie into my existing copper and added the necessary shut off valves as well as a bypass valve.  Using Pex made the job so much easier.  As others have noted, I had to use plenty of Teflon tape to get a water tight connection on the inlet and output ports.  I used 1" to 3/4" Pex male reducers which bottomed out at the shoulder. The instructions recommend using 3" pipe nipples.  If I had to do it again, I would use the recommended nipples and female adapters which would have prevented the fittings bottoming out.

One minor complaint is that they give you a marginal amount of silicon grease to properly install the filters.  I used every bit and had to buy more in order to get a good seal.

Overall, I am very pleased with the final installation and the much improved taste of our water.  Time will tell if this helps solve the corrosive issues I have with our city water.

Installed this filter purchased on Amazon bout two weeks ago myself with bypass loop and its working nicely. If you're handy with basic plumbing, you'll have no problems at all.. Only issue with install was leakage where the 1" npt fitting went into the filter assembly. Twice I used proper thread sealant and got leaking. Finally tried teflon tape which EVERY article you read will tell you not to do and no leaks. two layers of tape wrapped in the proper direction did the job...  clockwise starting at the front of the fitting and winding back just like the threading. The Chloramine/chlorine smell was gone immediately and water seems to taste better too. Little bit of black carbon dust for the first couple gallons but ran clear after that. I purged the filters after install only using the utility sink in bsmt to keep it out of the other lines in the house. Once before when doing plumbing work I had to remove diffusers on kitchen and bath faucet cause of reduced water flow...  sediment from cpvc plumbing install so thats why I purged through the bsmt sink. Installation was very easy and the filters popped in without an issue. There are potential chloramine health issues beyond regular chlorine that could affect health but of course, "official" sources say its no problem. Showers are the main concern as hot water on the scalp and skin is a clearer pathway for absorbtion but I'm guessing that gut flora could be affected too. We'll see how long the filters last, they are rated at 1 year but its only two of us so I'm guessing longer. I'm also an organic gardener and didnt want the chloramine gettin into the beautiful, live soil I've worked so hard to build up with compost and compost tea to enhance the micro biodiversity that creates healthier, tastier vegetables. I did alot of research on filter systems and for the price,  this is the best deal out there for municipal water. Check you water companys comprehensive test report to see what potential contaminants to target. This will last a lifetime and we'll never have to worry bout health issues from contaminants that arent "supposed" to be there.
Very Pleased!
Good product
excellent, made a huge difference in my well water quality
simply the best whole house filter for the money.. BEST we owned
We will see...so far so good
I love my water, this system is worth every penny.
After two months of use, no complaints.  The house water looks and tastes much better which is all I wanted.
Got this installed, so far been 1 month, pressure not dropping yet. Make sure you put water pressure regulator before the filter.
Works great at filtering out iron and sediment.  Well constructed.  Recommend that it is professionally installed.
Quality is good. Functions well. Needs a sturdy mount to handle the weight.
Our water is amazing after installing this filter - love it!!
i have only had for a couple of weeks, we our on a well system and you can taste the difference already as of now it is preforming great.

After installation,  the water was turned on and the included carbon filter ruptured (incoming pressure was 50 psi).  The carbon sediment went through out the house water pipes and plugged toilet float valves, faucet aerators, and shower head valves.  The plumbers bill was more than $200. We are in the process of getting the plumbers bill compensated by Amazon.
It took the chlorine taste away from our water and made the coffee even taste better. I need to order a new set of filters. The do last as advertised.
Easy to install and seems to work well....  Time will tell if it's a good purchases or not.
Decided to buy over a water softener.  Very happy with the buying decision.  Water taste better will most all chemicals removed

I like it. My water is clear and doesn't smell like chlorine. It's built well, I have no more water complaints.  I don't know that I would install it myself again though. Could be worth it to have a pro do it.
I did not notice any significant difference in the water.  Taste is maybe a little better, but the rotten egg smell is still there.  Maybe a little less, but not by much.
I had this system installed about 5 months ago by a plumber. As far as I can tell its performing as the manufacturer advertised it.

No more burning eyes in the shower. The white residue our water used to leave is gone. The chlorine smell is gone. This is what we wanted. Don't care if our water is soft so the filters are doing what we were hoping they would do.

Simply amazing!  Moved into a new home and the water had a hint of chlorine.  Installed this unit and the spots on the shower, sink, granite are gone!  The water smells and tastes great.  I installed it including a bypass for easy changing of the filters.

So far it is reducing the mineral we see in our well water, however I think it is just the system continuing to clean out the old sediment as it seems to be reducing the amount of particles we see. I'll update in a few months.

This workes great. This thing is huge. It is nice to have something that may actually only need filters replaced once per year. I have well water and so far no sulfur smell and looks great. Still need to get it tested and will be using an RO from the same company for drinking water.
My water had strong chlorine order and this was the product to remove a large percentage of it  knowing I'm not breathing it and absorbing the chlorine  when I shower is a plus.

Fantastic customer service!

After the initial installation, there was a small drip - between the tube and the plastic cap.
I contacted the seller and they walked me through the process of fixing the issue (lubing the tube a bit more and removing the side o-ring).
No problems whatsoever afterwards. Thank you.

I originally had a missing piece that connected the two filters. Incomplete product. But, the company  reached out to me and made everything good. Because of their extraordinary customer service, they rate nothing less than a 5!
We had a plumber install. All connections worked out with no problems.  We have only used the unit for a short time, but are very happy with it so far.

We love it. Our water no longer smells like chlorine and taste sooo much better. We were buying bottled water by the cases, which I felt bad about, and now we don't have to. We had a plumber install it because we had to do some extra legwork as our main water pipe was in the basement ceiling.

Bought this for chlorine in the water, both taste and smell.  Reduces it somewhat, but refrigerator filter works better..  Update, company sent replacement filter, and now works awesome!  Great customer service!!

This has made all the difference in the world in the water in our house.  We no longer get build-up around our faucets, our washing machine and dishwasher do not have to be cleaned any more, and our dishes come out spotless.  Before installing this water filter, if water was on the countertop and dried, it would leave a white circle.  Not anymore!  I can't rave enough about how happy I am with this system.

My water still tastes pretty terrible.  It was really bad to start with and I thought this would make a difference.  It's slightly better but no where near "good".  This did make a difference in the water in my shower though.  I used to feel like my hair was dry and rough after I washed it but it that has improved.
The mount was up for a week before it started to rust and we had a dirt smell in our water that the filter did nothing for.

Great product overall. Initially had a pin leak between the two cylinders (which can only be a defect and not due to install), but went away after hard water deposits blocked water from leaking lol. Also, replacement sediment filter seems a bit pricey.

Had been dealing with that god awful rotten egg smell for too long but didn't want to spend the thousands of $$$ for a super wiz bang system. I installed this myself in a couple hours( not a pro plumber, but enough knowledge to glue PVC together) smell is gone, rust spots are fading and everything seems cleaner. I'll be curious to see how long the filter lasts with just a 3 person houshold. Overall we are super happy so far.

We have had this for over a year, and it makes all of the water in the house drinkable.  Fantastic filters.  I had a plumber install under the house on the main water line.  No perceptible loss of water pressure or flow.  No leakage.  Easy to change filters, even under a house.

Our reverse osmosis for drinking water died and while looking for a replacement I discovered whole house filters.  It turns out that I could get a whole house filters for less than a reverse osmosis systems, and because we have city water I decided to try this filter a try.  It works GREAT!  While I suspect the water isn't as pure as the water provided by a reverse osmosis system, we cannot tell the difference in taste; and as a side benefit, the chlorine is not there to dry out your skin when showering.

We have had the system for a long time and we truly love it, the company is also very knowledgeable and helpful if you have any questions related to your water quality. We found out we have dioxane 1-4 in our drinking water and the company was very knowledgeable in helping us find a proper filter to clean our water as best as it can.  I would absolutely recommend them

I've had this unit installed for over three years and it works great. I'm on a community water system but wanted this to remove the chlorine and other contaminants coming in from the water system. Be sure to order extra O-rings (ORing 122) from the manufacturer so when you change the filters every 12 months you'll have them on hand.

Just got it installed , wanted to share that this require a professional plumber to install as pipes have to be cut and re-piping is required. My cost to install it was $510 which included labor and parts. Make sure to add that in when you buy this unless you are a plumber, even than cost of copper pipes.

While I did not get this installed, I did want to write a review.  Just note this is a large system.  The other thing to note is where your main water line comes into your home.  Installation may require water pipes to be diverted into your garage.  So depending the installation could be reasonable or very expensive.

We live in Flint Mi and this filters water fine. Very heavy when filled with water, so make sure mounting is very secure. Need to retest water in future and see how well it really does filter. We also use a Pur filter at sink tap and a Pur Pitcher for lead before using for drinking. Our water tested below National standards for lead level before the filter was installed, but Veterans Home Loan required whole house filter to qualify for VA loan.

Not an easy install for the regular joe but water tasted significantly better right away. Got this to prevent our kid from being exposed too many chemicals. Does not filter out fluoride.

See pic for install. Father who is experienced with plumbing built a frame for filter which is safer because it supports the extremely heavy filters and makes filters easier to change.

I am giving it 5 stars because of ease to install.  I put it in our well house.  I have had problems with that well house for years.  I paid $1400 for a fiberglass tank that cracked.  I really did not want to pay that much again for a new filter system.  This was the alternative.  It was easy to install  did not lose any pressure.  Water still taste like well water but it is clean.  I would recommend it to friends.

This product is fantastic.  I did a lot of research before settling on the Perfect Water system and as advertised, it does not reduce water pressure at all. The filters last well over a year in my house so that makes the total cost of ownership pretty low once installed. Everything from my clothes to my dishes are much cleaner now.  I'd have smaller systems before but with these gigantic filters it lasts much longer.

I no longer need to buy bottled water because my home water is better.

We installed this ourselves, but it required some plumbing knowledge and a few hours. We immediately noticed the difference it made in softening the water. Our water is hard and has a toilet smell, and the whole house filter helped with both of those issues, but it does not make our water fit for drinking. Since our water supply is starting out poor, we also have a reverse osmosis unit for drinking from Perfect Water, which does an excellent job.

I can only give it four stars due to the poor tolerances of the threaded ports. i had to over wrap the fitting with plumbers tape to get a good seal. I have noticed others have had the same experience. When I called the manufacturer, they said it was the first they have heard of the problem. I don't suppose they read the reviews of their vendors! other than that it seems to be a sturdy product.

This system was very easy to install. We were downsizing and moved to a new house. My wife did not want to mess with lugging salt from the store for soft water nor did she want an RO system under the sink using up space. This system was the answer to getting soft water and clean drinking water in the new house. I installed it right in to the soft water loop painted the copper pipes white and it looks great in the garage. P.S. saved a lot of money too! I have a friend who installed this same system many years ago and loves it.

We purchased & installed this in June, 2018. The filters are rated at 100,000 gallons of water. My wife and I go through about 2,500 gallons per month (some months as low as 2,100), so we're still looking at least another year or so before replacing them. That's a great value.

Our water is much cleaner and not cloudy since we installed this filter. We haven't seen any reduction in pressure. This thing just sits and does its job. I would buy this again in a heartbeat.

I have searched and searched for water filtration system until I saw this one. I am glad I purchased it. Though it's quite expensive compared to the other ones, this one does it's job. We had it for about a month now. The water flow is still good. The installation took about 5 hours as we did install 3 shut off valves.  It is pretty heavy so you have to secure the unit good. We had lime scale  build up on all our faucets before we installed the water system. I cleaned them up and since the water system has been installed which is a month ago, we haven't seen any lime scale build up on any of our faucets.. The water taste good and best of all I like the idea of replacing the filter just once a year.

I installed this on the well at our cabin in the Cascade mountains of Washington state where we get the occasional build up of silt from the nearby river.  The filter was very easy to install as there was room on the well house wall and the filter uses standard pipe fittings.  Our water is now completely clear of silt even after storms turn the river brown.  The extra large size means that we don't have to change the filter as often to maintain water pressure.

A word of warning: these filters are big!  Be sure you have the room to mount them before ordering.  The filters come with a mounting bracket that must be attached to the wall as they are too big and heavy to simply mount like the common whole house filters.

My wife and I replaced our single stage sediment filter for this fantastic unit. We live on a well and have serious problems with sediment and a mild taste. The installation was very easy for any DIY-er and went by in a flash. We have had this installed now for a month and the difference between filters is night and day! After installing the water pressure is strong and consistent and even the taste is completely gone thanks to the carbon stage. For the price I think it makes a fantastic addition to you water system if you are on a well.

I've had this system installed for about 9 months now and I believe it's one of the top five best purchases I've made. This has helped the taste of our Florida water immensely and given my family peace of mind about water quality. Our town had two EPA-mandated notices about our water quality (too many bleaches detected in quarterly testing, but not to dangerous levels) concerning which I didn't loose any sleep over, due in-part, to the new filters.
There are no moving, delicate or electronic parts; and the materials are substantial enough that I suspect they will last for many years to come. The installation instructions are clear and complete; It took me about 30 minutes to install it. I've had zero issues with the unit, and my interaction with their customer service department concerning the purchase was pleasant.

Not for the average home owner to do the installation.  The inlet and outlet valves are made of plastic where they should have been made of metal so cross-threading is a real possibility and ruins the whole installation and now you don't have water for the house.

The water quality has definitely improved.

The water clarity is excellent now.

I spoke to a septic inspector who said that when you install a whole-house filter you not only increase the life of your water heater but also the life of the septic.

So it is a win-win-win IF you know what you're doing.

You definitely should install this with a bypass..

Monster size filters that work great. Take care with install as these do get very heavy in use. Water is about 9lbs a gallon so I put these just off the floor 3.5 inches so I could deal with changing the filters in a reasonable way. Be sure to have a quality cut off valve on each end of the run and do use Teflon tape with the piping. The threads take a load of weight and could easily be damaged with cross threading. Consider the bracket wall mount location and give some thought to reinforcement of the wall. A good product for sure.

I want to mention a good customer support interaction, I accidentally stripped the discharge threads and left a message on the site's "contact us" page. Within an hour I received a call from a very friendly tech. We went through some ideas and realized I needed a replacement part. As I caused the problem, I did pay for it, but they made sure I bought ONLY what I needed. I called a  second time, and he followed up patiently and made sure it was all working out.
Lesson: I used brass fittings - the threads are sharp! use a lot of plumbers tape (at least 10 wraps) and make sure you thread straight!

I like it a lot.  Water tastes better.  Mine leaked between filters 1 and 2 (manufacturing defect) but they sent me a replacement top part right away.  I installed the second one and it has been leak-free.  Use an abundant amount of plumbers tape (12 turns is good) and install 1” threaded male fittings until there are almost no threads left to make it leak-free.  I installed three valves - inlet, outlet and bypass.

I have chlorinated city water and have thought about a filter for a long time. This filter is basic and includes sediment and charcoal which is probably all you need for city water. The inlet and outlet are 1”’NPT and made of plastic so don’t go crazy tight. I used 1” by 3/4” bushing reducers and sweat copper with bypass and pressure gauge on inlet side. I already have another gauge further down so I can check pressure drop. The bracket that holds the filters is heavy steel and ridgid. I used concrete wedge anchors to mount it. I immediately noticed my water now has no smell which is nice. You do have to flush the filter for a bit for the charcoal filter. See my pic. I am not a plumber, but I think it turned out ok.

Like everyone says, well built filter system that does the job. Just keep in mind that replacement filters are not cheap. About $150 every year or so. Plus, the filter changing requires ten steps. Step 5 is A) Pour 2 cups of bleach in the filter housings. B) Drain your hot water heater C) Open the main water supply D) Open a faucet at the furthest point from the system until you smell chlorine. Flush the toilet. Do this at every point in your house. E) Close the water supply F) Open the housing. The other steps proceeding this, and after this are easy. But holy #)&!, I'm a reasonably handy guy and I'm ready to call a plumber.

UPDATE: Did it myself. Including time spent bandaging a small wound, it took almost two hours. Instructions are not as complete as you'd think, even with ten steps. Instead of simply saying "drain the water heater", it should say, "follow the manufacturers instructions for draining your water heater". Those instructions include things like turning off the gas and how to relight the pilot when you are finished. Other details not included are, after draining the water heater, I assume you'd close the drain faucet before (C) opening the main water supply. Or all the water will run out of the water heater drain.  And before (F) I assume you need to open a nearby faucet to relieve the pressure so the housing can be opened again.

I had a professional install the system for me, and he did so quickly and with no problems. The system has not noticeably reduced the water pressure at any faucet in the house, including the shower. I have City water that is softened by the City. The quality of the water is excellent with this filter system. I had the system installed about 2 years ago, and I've pretty much ignored it since, which is a good indication of its working perfectly. The customer service of Perfect Water Technologies is also very good, in that they recently contacted me on their own about my satisfaction with the filter system and whether I have had any problems with it. That's real attention to the customer's needs in my opinion.
I would recommend this product to anyone.

This is an excellent whole house filter. I am very pleased with how clear, odorless, and tasteful our Village's water is after adding this filter to my residence. I would purchase this filter again in a heart beat.

I added the filter in my basement so that all of the water in our house is filtered. I live in an area that has hard water. Before adding this filter my wife would not drink the water from the fridge, but now that is the only water we drink. We do not purchase bottled water any longer.

I have now had the filter on for over a year and it is working great.

I will update this review with photos and again after the two year mark.

Pros:
- 1” Inlet/Outlet ports won't restrict water pressure
- High quality water from 2 Stage Sediment & Carbon Composite Filters
- Filters only need replaced once a year up to 100,000 gallons (saves money)
- Ease of installation
- Sturdy metal wall mount bracket
- Overall construction is very solid

Cons:
Inlet/Outlet port threads are plastic & not metal. The company said these female threaded ports take standard 1” male tapered (NPT) fittings, but I think their tolerance is to loose for plastic threads.  I had trouble getting tight seal with no drips around my 1” to 3/4” Adapters (1” male tapered on outside & 3/4” female on inside).  To these Adapters I connected Sharkbites with 3/4” male pipe thread x 3/4” push-to-connect on the other side for my water line. I used 3 wraps of Teflon tape on my Adapters and they still had a slow drip around the housing. I took them out, re-wrapped them with Teflon tape, and then coated with Oatey Pipe Joint Compound that is safe for drinking water. This finally stopped my slow leak after 1 week. I think they need to double check the tolerance and depth of these threaded ports.

My Adapters were completely tight & the nut went all the way down to the Port housing (even with the Teflon tape & Pipe Joint Compound), but they did not bottom out on the inside of the threaded port. Sharkbite does make a 3/4” push-to-connect x 1” Male Pipe Thread Adapter that can be purchased online through Home Depot but they were not available when I did this project. However, none of the stores in my area carry this specialty item (they want you to order a box of 25). This would have made the job a lot easier and probably would Not have had any leaks, but I'm not buying a whole box when I only need 2!  For this price maybe the company could have provided the correct 1” to 3/4” Adapters since a majority of Homes have 3/4” lines. I took off 1 Star because of this frustration, but it does Not take away from the High Quality water this unit makes.

Comments:
I installed this in July 2015 and have been using for 6 months now. Overall this is a quality product with high quality water.  I would definitely recommend this to any Home owner wanting to improve the quality of their water while keeping the total cost around $500 (this kit plus additional plumbing supplies). This has removed all odors & bad tastes which is good since our water is high in sediment, minerals, & chlorine. We have noticed better lather from shampoo & body wash, and our laundry detergent seems to work better. I only took off 1 star due to the initial leaks I had with their 1” ports as described in my Cons.

For DIY'ers I recommend using Sharkbite T's, Elbows, & Quarter-turn Valves to avoid having to sweat pipe with torch & solder. They cost more but reduce the work time. I have used them for many plumbing projects and never had one leak. I configured mine with 3 Quarter-turn Valves: 1 on the Input side, 1 on the Output side, and 1 as a Bypass above the unit. The Bypass Valve allows water to the house while the Input/Output Valves are closed to do annual maintenance (cleaning the Canisters & replacing Filters).

My main water line comes in my basement so this unit is mounted on the cement wall. Instead of Tapcon masonry bolts I used 3/8” x 3” Red Head Wall Anchor w/Hex Nuts. These mount securely in the cement wall and leave a threaded bolt sticking out of the wall about 1/2”. Just hang the Filter Housing Wall Mount Bracket onto the Red Head bolts, add washers, and tighten down the Hex Nuts. The Red Heads and Sharkbites make it easy to remove if it ever needs to be taken down or the re-positioned.

This filter is phenomenal. I had mine installed by a plumber, as the filter is not easy to install. It also takes us room near the hot water heater, so before ordering be sure you have the wall space.
I do not use this filter for drinking water but for my shower. My hair stays cleaner for days longer! Also, my jewelry stays cleaner when rinsed in the filtered water.
Well worth the money and it is a high quality product!

This all started with a kitchen remodel.  The old sink had an under the counter filter attached to a separate faucet.  I decided I did not want to have 2 faucets on the new sink and began exploring alternatives.  Then I thought about the in-line filters on the refrigerator, showers etc.  A whole house system seemed to make sense.  I checked and found our city water is treated with chorine so I ordered the DGC model.
 I decided this was beyond my DIY skills and hired a professional do to the installation.  The unit is installed in the garage and per the plumber's recommendation is installed ahead of the water softener.  The install cost more that the unit but it was money well spent as it was quite a project.
 So far so good: clean filtered water throughout the house with no loss of pressure or flow rate.  I now only have to worry about replacing 2 filters once a year instead of all the old separate ones.

I've owned this product for over three years now. Up until recently, it has performed magnificently. Our tap water felt great and made a noticable improvement in skin and hair health.

Which was great. Emphasis on "was."

Because, you see, the socket/unit, into which the filter housing is screwed, cracked. This happened overnight and, according to my water bill, dumped something like 7000 gallons of water into my garage, an adjoining interior room, and the great outdoors. Destroyed drywall, soaked, ruined carpet and pads, a gigantic water bill... Not fun.

The fault lies entirely with the unit. I meticulously followed instructions so as to not over torque the filter housings. My PSI is under 80 - I know because I installed the pressure reducer myself, years ago.

And of course, this happens at about the three year mark. Outside the meagre 2 year warranty.

We have city water with lots of chlorine. Water smelled bad, tasted bad, and was bad for the skin. After doing some Internet research nan reading reviews, we purchased this unit. We had our local handy man install the unit. It was installed in our garage after the cold water shut off and pressure valve. he installed the shut off valve on each side of unit as directions encouraged. The unit is a good three feet by three feet in size and fairly heavy. So we mounted it on a wall, making sure to add appropriate support board behind it. Probably took the handy man about two hours total. Its very important to make sure you hoo the plumbing up to flow from left to right. There are arrows on the unit.

This is a two stage unit. First filter is for sediment and the second filter if for chlorine.

We have soft water, but due to the water coming from a small river that usually is muddy, the water although clean did have sediment (you could see particles in glass of water when held up to light) and tons of chlorine. We flushed the filters prior to hooking up to house lines. When some water and was surprised that almost instantly the water was clearly and better tasting. I was expecting that it might take a day or two. Nope, water smelled better, looked better, tasted better within two hours.

Its been about two weeks. This purchase was worth every dime!!

If you've been thinking of a whole house unit, then don't look any further then Home Master. Now please verify what you have in your water Chlorine or Chloramines. Home Master makes different models based upon what you need to filter. If you have a well, then you probably should consider the three stage unit.

Installing the filter could not have been easier and it is a quality product; we bought ours in 2015 and one of the filter container developed a small crack, called the manufacturer, told him the problem and had a new one in 3 days it’s now 2023 and system is still doing great

product_title: Kohler 1085211 CP Protect The Part Polished Chrome
product_description: Protect the on KOHLER products always look for the KOHLER GENUINE PARTS logo Replacement side spray assembly Engineered to promote product longevity Made with premium materials for enhanced durability

reviews.review_body: This hose is compatible with quick disconnect -- I struggled to find a replacement for my side sprayer with that connection but was glad I found this!
Video Player is loading.

I had a bad o-ring in my existing external spray unit and since it was always under pressure I had a continuous leak.  Seems the o-ring is not available to purchase separately for repairs.  This spray nozzle was the exact replacement for my existing (although it was hard to confirm on-line).  R and R'd and fixed my leak in about five minutes.

product_title: Elkay SEHS 17X 20 Gauge Stainless Steel Hand Sink with Faucet
product_description: High quality 18 gauge type 300 series stainless steel Lead free faucet and strainer included with product NSF Certified

reviews.review_body: Sturdy sink; worked perfectly as a utility sink. Easy to clean and keep in like-new condition. Faucets works well. Needed professional plumber to install.

This is a compact sink which was installed in a space where room was limited.  It is stainless steel, easy to install and gets the job done.  I do recommend buying the right angle fittings for the sink for easier installation.

product_title: hansgrohe Croma Select S 7 inch Showerhead Premium Modern 2 Spray Rain IntenseRain Easy Clean with QuickClean in Brushed Nickel 26523821
product_description: GENEROUS WATER COVERAGE The 8 inch showerhead diameter mimics the feeling of a natural rain shower creating a spa like shower experience WATER FLOW The 2 0 GPM flow rate provides thorough water flow STYLE VERSATILITY Compatible with a wide variety of shower trim styles to fit your existing bathroom decor EASY INSTALLATION hansgrohe showerheads are easy to install simply take your old showerhead off and replace it with your new one

reviews.review_body: Like the design, size, how it looks and performs. Easy to clean nozzles simply wiping by finger or sponge.
Large fixed showerhead great for a rain shower

We really like this shower head.  It looks great  and was easy to install.  It comes with two settings. A rain setting which is nice to relax in and a harder setting for the person who likes the pressure. Would definitely get it again.

product_title: Pfister LG529 NECC Neera Commercial Style Pull Down Kitchen Faucet with Spring Spout Polished Chrome

reviews.review_body: As a former Pfister employee, I got this faucet from the company store. Even with softened water, the faucet corroded rapidly and water pressure dropped to zero even after disassembling and cleaning. Very disappointed, thought these products were quality. Recommendation to purchase higher quality all brass valve body faucet instead... Unless you enjoy frequently replacing your faucets.

I’ve been a Pfister devotee since my first remodel (a million years ago now…), and this latest addition, the Neera Commercial Pulldown, is characteristically delightful.  Straightforward installation, solid hardware, and incredible ease of function.  It’s beautiful, doesn’t drip, and the pulldown feature is very smooth.  All this at a decent price, too!

product_title: Kingston Brass VPB33227 Edwardian Brass Console Sink Legs Brushed Brass 22 31 x 19 x 33
product_description: Solid brass construction for durability Overall dimensions L 22 5 16 x W 18 15 16 x H 33 Set includes 2 legs Available in various finishes

reviews.review_body: I am more than thrilled with the console legs.  The product is beautiful and just what I was looking for.  My space is small so I needed to buy separate pieces, sink , legs to accommodate our space and also put together exactly what style I wanted for our powder room.

product_title: Rainfall Shower System Matte Black with High Pressure 8 inch Shower Head Hand Held Shower Head Bathroom Luxury Rain Mixer Shower Complete Combo Set Wall Mounted Valve Included
product_description: 1 75 GPM for efficient cleaning 360 swivel full coverage rain shower head features a 8 inch spray face The shower valve and trim kit with solid brass valve body quality is essential recognized industry wide as the best and most durable material Rainfall shower head with handheld feature premium finishes to resist corrosion tarnishing and discoloration Matte black finish is a beautiful look that works with any decorating style Adjustable handheld shower head holder and anti skid handle The rain shower head with handheld spray equipped with the pressure balancing control valve to help maintain water temperature in the shower keeps water temperature within a safe 3 6 degree Fahrenheit

reviews.review_body: I absolutely love this. Classy looking, it‘s a focal point on my shower wall. Safe packaged - all pieces individually wrapped. I love this valve - made by brass, looks sturdy and functions well. And I really love the rain shower head and its water pressure. No leaks, all is well.

Our contractor installed this for us. So pretty, we love the look. Love the rain head and the option of the handheld shower head. The hose is very flexible. The valve is skillful manufactured. Overall very happy with the quality of this set.
The double flower shower head design can well meet my diverse shower needs. The two shower modes are adjustable and very convenient.

I've used several shower heads before, but this one impresses me the most. It has held up very well as always, no leaks, water pressure failures, etc. and everything is working as it should. It's been a pleasure to use and I feel like this one was worth the price of admission.
The style and quality is what I was looking for my remodeled bathroom. All three pieces are independent so you can place them where you want in the shower. The packaging kept it safe, Great product.

I had some problems with the installation and customer service was able to give me professional guidance the first time, which allowed me to finalize the installation and saved me an installation fee.

Out of the many showers available, I picked this one. Its clean look design attracted me, and after I received the package and installed it in my bathroom, I felt that this shower set was made for my bathroom and matched especially well.

product_title: Insinkerator 13620 Disposer Throat Guard

reviews.review_body: Easy to install on my ss-500 commercial disposal. Just make sure the holes all line up before you start putting screws back in.

product_title: T S Brass B 0316 Wall Mount Swivel Gooseneck Vertical Double Pantry Faucet with Stream Regulator

reviews.review_body: A bit pricey, but works with the Kohler Brockway, or in our case, the original Kohler 6' (antique) cast iron high back wall mount sink. I would recommend using T&S brass's wall mount adapters to make installing these easier.
