reviews.review_body: I love it.
good quality and very good price, love it.
Love this bowl and looks fabulous in my bathroom. It is good and solid and easy to install.packaging was great and I had no issues!
This is a lovely sink and goes great with our granite counter top in the guest bathroom.

This sink is absolutely gorgeous.  The colours matched exactly as hoped based on the online photos and descriptions.  The pattern looks elegant and classy, not cheap.  The quality of the bowl is excellent, very thick, heavy, quality material and smooth finish.  I have this in my guest bathroom and almost everyone who comes out of there says something about how much they love the sink. My mother even asked for the link on Amazon and is planning to get one for her bathroom renovation.  This sink also came with very good packaging (we had to have it shipped all the way to the Bahamas with a freight forwarding company and there was no damage at all). The instructions were easy to follow and the assembly was very basic and simple. Definitely you can buy this sink with no hesitation at all.

reviews.review_body: Great product, easy to install matches perfectly.

product_title: Bi Max High Efficiency Adjustable Showerhead 1 0 1 5 Gpm Chrome
product_description: Needle spray with a large spray diameter Compact Modern design Corrosion resistant high impact abs thermoplastic body Large pom swivel adjustment Made in china

reviews.review_body: Works as advertised.  Pressure and flow are good.

I purchased this product at a local hardware store. I had read good reviews about Niagara's other showerheads, and thought I'd give this one a try as my family needed to cut back on our water usage, and showers were a major portion of our water bill.

We use this primarily at the 1 gpm setting. It provides an unbelievably good shower and the water is definitely warmer than what came out of our old spray showerhead. Desipte the low-flow, it is comfortable and refreshing. Very impressive! I'm sold on this brand. I'm going to replace our second showerhead with another one of Niagara Conservation's showerheads.

One caveat is that we currently have a fairly small shower stall, not a full-size shower nor a bath/shower combination. The ability of this shower head to give you a comfortably warm shower may depend on the temperature of your bathroom and size of your shower stall. Less hot water and steam coming from the shower head will effectively reduce how much it heats the bathroom. However, here in temperate California in a small shower, it works wonderfully.
Having a bit of a water shortage here in calif. so I thought this might help in keeping water usage down.  It does what it's suppose to do.
like it

I have 4 boys who shower a lot since becoming teenagers, the water bill was crazy.. I had gotten a different Niagara shower head that used 1.25 galoons per min, and everyone was complaining. I got this one which can be 1 or 1.5 and even the 1 gallon per minute gets an ok from the kids and the 1.5 gets a better review than the old 2.5 gallon shower head! everyone wins!!

This is a Nice Shower head, We like the ability to change between the water settings, I wish i would have bought the model that also had the lower .5 gal/min.

It mounts like any other shower head and works great. It has a quick turn with a click indication between 1.0 and 1.5 gallon modes.

The shower head is of fair quality. It's mostly plastic as far as I can tell, but it is a reduced flow and the flow selector does work properly. Personally, I can shower with the 1.5 GPM flow, but not the 1.0 GPM flow. The water seems to cool off before it hits me at teh 1.0 GPM flow and I think I am going to feeze if I leave it in the 1.0 GPM setting.  I bought this to reduce my water bill - I live in California. I will be monitoring the water bill over the next year to see how it is affected.

I like this shower head, and for less than $10 it is certainly worth trying out. It's not perfect though. Coming from a 2.5 GPM shower head the 1.5 GPM leaves nothing to be desired in terms of flow. It is satisfying and quickly wets and rinses my thick, long hair. I do find the 1 GPM setting generally unsatisfying for showering, the pressure is too low to effectively shampoo and there is not enough steam generated to keep warm in a full sized shower (this may become more of an issue in winter). The water is definitely aerated, but the stream temperature is not perceptibly decreased. It is best used for soaping up, rinsing off, or when you feel like relaxing for a few minutes.

My main issue with this shower head is the spray pattern. It is a single circle. While this is not terrible, a second concentric circle would have been good. It would provide better water coverage (increasing warmth) and for those of us who are not vertically inclined make it easier to comfortably wash our faces. Unless you can put your face right against the shower head you receive a single strong arc of water which effectively demonstrates why the feel of raindrops on your face is relaxing and a firehose is not.

The adjustable flow is nice.  My wife was concerned about washing her hair (her hair is thick and comes down to just between her shoulder blades) with the lower flow shower heads.  We have since both discovered that the 1.0 Gal/Min setting (which is probably really lower since our water pressure is 41 psi) is fine for all our needs.  However, the higher flow setting is nice as it gets colder because we do not have a tankless water heater so the low flow setting requires us to wait several minutes for the water to get warm.

I would recommend this for anyone taking their first steps into water conservation or for anyone who has a large shower.  Below 1 GPM, shower heads tend to aerate the water to give the water flow pressure which means the water looses its heat faster, thus requiring you set the water to a warmer setting which uses more energy to get your water hotter so it's warm enough.

I bought this with the Evolve "Showerheads SS-1002CP-US Ladybug Water-Saving Shower-Head Adapter" which lets you know the water is warm by bringing the flow down to a trickle and I honestly couldn't be happier.  The combo works well, and prevents us from wasting water as we set about doing other things while waiting for the water to warm up.

You have two  settings (1 gallon / minute or 1 1/2 gallon / minute) which eliminate standing water in bathtub or shower stall. Good powerful spray on both settings. Water in time will be as expensive as oil. I recommend when taking a shower, get all wet, shut the water off, suds up with body wash and shampoo for your hair, then restart the water and rinse off. This procedure will greatly save your water consumption and you will also save on  body wash and shampoo.
Performs exactly as advertised.  1.0 GPM is sufficient for a shower and 1.5 is great for a fast rinse.  Easy to change settings during the shower.

I bought this showerhead as part of our water-saving efforts here in California and put it in the shower in our guest bath.  We also have the Niagra Tri-max showerhead in the shower we use daily.  (The Tri-max at 0.5 gpm is the way to go to really save water.)  The Bi-max provides a great shower on the 1 gpm setting; I can't see a need to raise it to the 1.5 gpm, even for hair washing.  This showerhead also has a very comfortable and sufficiently broad spray pattern on both settings, more comfortable in fact than the Tri-max.  I also measured the flow on the 1 gpm setting and it is dead accurate.  It would have been nice if Niagara included a washer with the showerhead, since it takes a lot of Teflon tape and torque to seal it on the shower arm, but that's a very minor complaint.

I was not impressed with this. The pressure was good for being low flow but the stream was in a circle and it was very wide (separate) once it hit my head (I hope this makes sense). It was not a direct stream. So trying to rinse my hair takes twice as long, which defeats the purpose of having a water efficiency shower head. Don’t even get me started on trying to rinse a razor while shaving

The shower head was as described, and the spray pattern is better than many of the other low flow shower heads I've tried out. My only complaint is that the part that connects to the shower pipe is plastic, and seems marginally too thin for the task. Tightening it "just right" seems a balance between too loose (which is what I elected to do) and too tight, which seems like it will strip the plastic threads. When adjusting the shower head from higher to lower flow rate while taking a hot shower there is a pronounced tendency for the shower head to unscrew.  If it were made with a metal fitting it would be easier to tighten properly and less likely to come loose. (And yes, if that added to the cost of it I would pay it, because the shower head is otherwise well made and worth it.)

This is my 2nd purchase for my house to replace the showerhead.  My kids take long showers and I had to find a solution to reduce the water. I purchased the above showerhead and it uses 1 GPM, my past shower head was not water efficient.  My water bill has gone down.  Install was very easy to take the pliers and remove the old showerhead and fit the new showerhead, took less than 10 min to install.  Also, the showerhead does not look bad. This is a win-win for me.

We have had other brands of low flow shower heads in the past with mixed results. We even tracked down a special commercial low flow shower head we loved in a couple Vegas Casinos and purchased them. Problem is we have lower pressure than what is ideal and some of those other units need good strong pressure to function properly. This head on the 1 gpm setting or 1.5 gpm setting works well and has a good stream. The 1 gpm setting takes a little getting use to but does the job and rinses adequately. I would recommend it.

product_title: hansgrohe Talis S Modern Premium Easy Clean 1 Handle 1 9 inch Tall Bathroom Sink Faucet in Brushed Nickel 72020821
product_description: German design and engineering delivers optimal performance for all of your bath faucet needs Single hole faucet can also be installed over existing 3 hole counter configuration baseplate sold separately Solid brass construction ceramic cartridge ensures long term leak free operation Boltic lever lock prevents handle from becoming loose during repeated operation to ensure optimal long term performance 3 8 inch connection hoses and pop up assembly included for quick and easy DIY installation Flow 1 2 GPM

reviews.review_body: This product came without diffuser at spout end.  Further, you could see into the guts of the faucet when lifting the handle for water, so I suspect there was some "cover" part missing there as well.  I returned it.

product_title: Delta Faucet D5618W Wall Mounted 18 x 1 1 2 ADA Concealed Screw Bath Safety Grab Bar in White
product_description: Constructed with a rust resistant stainless steel with incredible strength and durability Leverage support and stability for up to 500 pounds double ADA requirements Clean brilliant white finish matches beautifully with standard tubs showers and toilets 18 grab bar is a popular choice for installation versatility perfect for getting in and out of the tub or on and off the commode 1 1 2 bar diameter for a firm grip

reviews.review_body:
I'm a disabled amputee, a sturdy, reliable shower/tub grab bar is important.
I bought this not only for the excellent price, reliable manufacturer name Delta, but more important, the quality. Very pleased.
Like very much

product_title: Kingston Brass DR314160 Restoration 16 Inch Decorative 1 1 4 Inch OD Grab Bar Matte Black
product_description: Solid brass construction Mounting hardware included Corrosion resistant finish 16 center to center length 1 1 4 bar diameter Compliant with ADA Standard

reviews.review_body: this product came dented!

product_title: Elkay Gourmet Single Hole Kitchen Faucet with Pull down Spray and Forward Only Lever Handle Chrome
product_description: PULL DOWN SPRAY HEAD Provides extra reach for additional cleaning and rinsing coverage ERGONOMIC SWIVEL SPRAY Spray head rotates a full 360 for ease of use DURABLE AND FLEXIBLE NYLON BRAIDED HOSE Premium material provides smooth operation when extending and retracting the spray head TWO FUNCTION WATER DELIVERY Steady stream for everyday use powerful spray for heavy duty cleaning SINGLE HANDLE OPERATION Handle rotates 90 forward only so there is no interference with the backsplash

reviews.review_body:
This sink is great! It looks awesome and works as expected. My husband has ZERO plumbing experience, and with a few videos on YouTube to "see" what to do, along with using the provided instructions, he installed it quite easily.

Simple, elegant, and great! Recommended.

We love the sleek/modern look & design of this faucet. Was grateful to find a quality brand like Elkay on Amazon, especially given it's competitive price. My handyman said it was an easy install, taking him less than an hour total. I also really like that the handle can be placed in a couple of different ways, allowing ours to be in front of the faucet itself. Lastly, the hose extends plenty long, and the trigger on the nozzle is in a spot that makes it easily accessible.

I love this faucet. It's one of the few I've seen (from Elkay and otherwise) in which the pulldown element is disguised well as part of the unit itself, and it's very, very nice.

The chrome has the Elkay beauty but also the tendency towards fingerprinting and water spotting; it's pretty, but requires some special TLC to keep it spotless (pun intended).

Quality-wise, the craftsmanship leaves nothing to be desired; all of the components are well-made and have no particular problems at all.

Would recommend for a traditional aesthetic with a slightly modern twist.

This is a beautifully simple faucet that functions perfectly! I love the simple and clean lines of the faucet. I find many faucets nowadays either have too many bells and whistles or look big and bulky but this one was exactly what I wanted. It's super simple to use and our plumber said installation was a breeze. I LOVE how clean it looks with our white quartz countertops and undermount sink. It's easy to wipe down and clean up and I'll never be able to go back to a separate side sprayer now that I've gotten used to the pull down faucet!! Love this product!!
I Love this faucet! It is made with high quality material, comes with great instructions and was pretty easy to install. Highly Recommend.

Elkay makes faucets that are made to work as hard as you do. This one has a pull-down sprayer that has full mobility. It also has two pressure settings depending to suit your needs. The forward-only lever is great for when you can only use one hand or your hands are dirty. It's a great overall faucet. I highly recommend it.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

I am very pleased with the faucet overall. It's expensive but I've gone through a number of lower priced faucets here so sometimes paying a little extra means you won't have to buy a new faucet every 18 months.

Installation was easy as I was replacing an existing faucet in a similar configuration. They do include a deck plate in case you need it. I've seen a few other faucet manufacturers charge extra for that accessory.

Installation was simple and pretty straight forward even for me the guy who tends to make a disaster out of home improvement projects. I really like how seamless the faucet appears yet it has the ability to turn itself into a hose for tasks that require it.

All in I am quite pleased with the faucet and it feels as though I'll get many years out of it.
Video Player is loading.

I recently built an outdoor sink and used this excellent faucet. I need a high faucet like this but only had a 19" clearance from the counter to the area above. This one fit, had 360 degree swivel capability and a pull out hose. It fit every criteria I needed.

Very very easy to install. If you're installing to an outside tap (you probably aren't), you will want to purchase a dishwasher installation kit which has everything you need since the fixture from the tap outside are the same as the dishwasher's fittings.

Installed very easily-- looks great, works perfectly-- I love having the sink out there. Great item.
Nice quality, easy installation for the most part.  You will need hose fittings to install this unit with standard 1/2” shut off valves as the hoses are the smaller size fittings 3/8”.

I am glad to see Elkay enter into the plumbing fixtures market as I have had several of their sinks and found them to be top quality.
This semi-professional style spring neck faucet is a nice match to their sinks line.
The lever operates from straight up to a 90 forward tilt. This allows it to function even within close proximity to a backsplash behind the faucet.
The lever operates very smoothly due to the ceramic valves. It has a very nice feel to it.
The spring coiled neck and spray head give a nice amount of flexibility and reach. It isn't as much compared to pull down versions that have longer hoses, but it can be left in the free moving position during heavy use with the arm bar rotated to the side. This is a different approach compared to pull down spray heads which don't function well when left in the pulled out position.
5 stars for a quality fixture.

Got this Elkay Gourmet Single Hole Kitchen Faucet installed finally! My mom always wanted one and when her old faucet died it was time to look for another one. Didn’t want to get a cheap one that would only last a couple years. Found this on Amazon and she couldn’t be happier with it.

It took me forever to install this but it wasn’t the Elkays fault. I couldn’t get the old sink out. every time I would turn the old plastic locking rings they would break. Long story short I got a friends help and once the old one was out the new one was a breeze to install.

This Elkay was simple to install. The directions are step by step on how to install it.

One thing I really like about this pull out faucet is simplicity. I thought it would be on a Wind up thing to pull it in and out but nope! It literally has a weight that when you pull it down the weight comes with it and when you release it that weight goes back up. It’s super easy and it works flawlessly even tho it’s so simple. I guess you would want that tho because less moving parts means less things to break.

All of the parts with this Faucet are quality well made items.
From the lines to the locking rings, they are not the cheap stuff like what I took off.
Video Player is loading.
Wonderful quality. Good looking. Very functional. Easy to use. Fantastic water pressure.

Other retailers charge much more for this excellent faucet than I paid here.

The faucet is very well made, looks good and functions very smoothly.

product_title: Sprite Showers HF2 BN 2 Shower Hose Filter Brushed Nickel
product_description: Chlorgon filtration system helps to remove free chlorine dirt and odors from water Includes replaceable HHC filter cartridge rated for 3 months or 5 000 gallons whichever comes first High strength ABS plastic housing with finger grips for ease of opening Certified to NSF ANSI Standard No 177 for Shower Water Filtration Free Sprite Showers mobile app available to track filter life and register warranty

reviews.review_body: Our community water system has way too much chlorine in it sometimes. The description of this filter says it filters chlorine. It  actually filters very little chlorine out, if any at all. All it really did was slow my water pressure to a drip.

I only bought this for the shower handle because I have hard water and my white shower floor turns orange. I put a filter on the shower head and this on the handheld. It works but it leaks. It has significantly reduced the orange in my shower. However, it does not seal completely using a rubber washer that's supplied and Teflon tape it still has a small trickle out of where it connects. I gave it 2 stars across the board.
It's easy to install but it doesn't seal.
It's not great value for the money if it doesn't seal.
Its easy to use except it doesn't seal.

It really messed up my water pressure, I wanted to believe that maybe it would be different as it would have worked perfectly for my shower. But this product isn’t great, maybe for something else it could work better but I’m not happy with the product

reviews.review_body: Nice product.

product_title: DELTA FAUCET 2123LF 6 25 x 6 00 x 6 25 inches Chrome
product_description: Easy to operate blade handles Built in stream straightener controls water flow Solid brass construction ensures quality and reliability Spout swings 360 Degree for added convenience Classic Sensible styling that complements any home Brass

reviews.review_body: This is the high-quality choice. Well made and has 1/4 turn on valves with ceramic elements. . . . .
This is the third time using these faucets at our tavern.  (Three different sinks.)  Work well, install is quick and easy.
Arrived promptly in as advertised condition.  Perfect for my application.  Great product and excellent seller.

Very nice faucet at a reasonable price. I use it for my basement workshop laundry tub.  High quality and nice finish.  The valve body is brass, but it has a chrome plated plastic cover.  The handles turn nice and smooth.  This has a flow straightener, not an aerator that most faucets have.  Therefore it has a nice straight forceful flow, but splashes a little.  It's perfect for my needs.  Will not fit a garden hose.

product_title: KINGSTON BRASS KS8102ZX Millennium Pot Filler Polished Brass
product_description: Solid brass construction for durability Wall mount single hole installation Drip free ceramic disc cartridge 1 2 14 NPT connection 3 8 GPM 14 4 LPM spout flow rate at 60 PSI Swivel double jointed spout extend up to 20 5 1 16 spout clearance

reviews.review_body: Returned. Wrong item lisred.

We love the look of this pot filler but the first one we ordered did not have the right size screws to attach the handles. We contacted Kingston Brass and they sent replacement screws that were still the wrong size. We cut them down ourselves to fit. Once we got it working, there was a leak. They agreed to send us a replacement but it was back ordered. We did eventually get a replacement and the new one also had the wrong size screws. We were able to reuse the screws that we had already cut so it is working now. I don’t think I would recommend buying this particular model but Kingston customer service was good to work with and it was eventually resolved.

Loved design but too many issues. Similar problem as other review, we received pot filler with incorrect screws and leaky valves. Called Kingston Brass and after sending in video they sent us a replacement pot filler (after waiting for back order to come in). Opened box and same screw package with wrong size screws! How can this not be fixed by now?? My husband installed second pot filler and this too leaks at both joints. Called company and they are sending us a third pot filler. Last chance for this brand and then we move to another brand. Again love the design but very poor manufacturing and incorrect screws packaged with product. Never had issues with brands like Delta, Moen or Signature Hardware.
Good looking pot filler, works good and not leaks.

product_title: Hydronix LF EC32 CP Modern Ceramic RO Reverse Osmosis or Filtered Water Faucet Chrome
product_description: Hydronix lf Series Lead free faucets NSF ANSI standard 61 section 9 certified High durability elegant chrome finish Non Air Gap Made in Taiwan

reviews.review_body: Used many times good piece

Taiwan makes pretty good products.  I have found them to be reliable and with very good build quality.  This faucet is the fourth replacement of faucets produced in another country nearby Taiwan.  I am certain this one will last a good number of years.  It is smooth to operate, as a drinking faucet should be, and its appearance is appealing to us.  Very nicely made - I used plumber's silicone in the base, around the faucet mechanism (open / close handle), and inside the swivel - plumber's silicon is food safe and simply helps.  The flow rate is quite improved over the other three aforementioned faucets.  It just feels nice to use.  Cannot go wrong with this faucet!  Good quality to cost ratio!

product_title: DELTA FAUCET RP90158BL Pivotal Diverter Tub Spout Matte Black
product_description: Perfectly coordinates with the pivotal bath collection Extends 9 in From wall Pull up to divert water from tub spout to shower head Matte Black finish Metal construction Brass

reviews.review_body: This product failed after a year. The diverter or handle knob became weak and when I turned on the faucet, the handle popped up and water started splashing all over from it. Poor design and quality.
You sold me a used spigot at a new price! I paid for brand new and it's not. If there is a problem with it I expect a exchange for a brand new one, which is what I paid for the first time. NOT HAPPY
Works great
Delta puts out some top quality products and this is one of them. It's well constructed out of real metal and looks great in my remodeled bathroom

Horrible design and no way to adjust so the faucet is straight and square. No instructions, the online instructions say to have the threads stick out 1/2 inch from the finished wall, but that only leaves you one turn which will not get the faucet tight enough to not leak.  There is no way to install or fix or adjust if you have already tiled the tub wall.
Do not buy this, and don’t cut your pipe and solder on threads because you can’t return this and and use a normal spout after you cut and solder the threads on. Unbelievable!!!
Just the reach I needed for my bathtub. The threaded part is not deep enough. Have a quarter gap between the wall and the faucet.

I love the look of this, but twice now the diverter has broken! When you pull it up, it can pull all the way out, and then water flashes everywhere! And there seems to be no way to fix it. I am now ordering a different spout because I don’t wanna deal with this again. Would not recommend.
Finish is nice for matching other brushed nickel fixtures but this Delta finish DOES NOT match their stainless finishes

product_title: Delta Faucet 51386 SS PR Contemporary Shower Head Lumicoat Stainless
product_description: Lumicoat Finishes easily wipe clean without cleaners and chemicals Soft rubber Touch Clean spray holes allow you to easily wipe away calcium and lime build up from the spray face of your shower head and hand shower with the touch of a finger Installs in minutes Spray settings include Full Body spray Soft Waterfall spray and Pause Pause feature reduces water to a trickle giving you space for shaving lathering and other shower tasks while maintaining your temperature settings WaterSense labeled showers use at least 20 less water than the industry standard saving you money without compromising performance Certified dual neoperl check valves for backflow protection 60 82 in 1524 mm 2083 mm stretchable metal hose

reviews.review_body: This was a good looking shower head but unfortunately I had to return due to missing parts.

Very disappointed. Ended up not using it, even though the return window closed. I  purchased one from a different national brand and was very pleased with their product and value. Plastic everything on the delta
Beautiful faucet

product_title: LASCO 04 3675 Toilet Tank to Bowl Solid Brass 3 8 Inch by 3 1 8 Inch Heavy Duty Bolts with Rubber and Brass Washers and Hex Nuts
product_description: 3 8 Inch x 3 1 8 Inch Heavy Duty Toilet Tank To Bowl Kit Includes Each Brass Heavy Duty Bolts and Each Brass Washers Rubber Washers And Hex Nuts 3 8 Inch X 3 Inch heavy duty bolts Country of Origin China Use to attach toilet tank to bowl Easy DIY project fits most

reviews.review_body: High quality and these should be only sold for tank attachments.

Went with "solid" brass even though a little more expensive.  Growing tired of replacing brass coated and steel bolts due to rusting.  Last straw is when leaking tank on second floor bathroom stained first floor kitchen ceiling
Quality Product!
The quality was great! Perfect for our needs.
Nice replacement part. Fit perfectly.
Great heavy duty stuff.
Easy to install, and works great!!
Nuts do not fit bolts
Supplied nuts too big for the supplies bolts.
These are the real deal !!  NO more rusted bolts.
Worked great.
The nuts included were too large for the bolts. They would not thread onto the bolts due to there larger diameter.
Excellent! Pure brass, and fit perfectly. Just what I was looking for.
Just as advertised. They work well.
The best toilet bowl fasteners I could find, they cost a little more but they are all brass so they won't corrode.
Used for ground on window pass though. Ham radio. Working great!
I bought 2 kits.  Both had 5/16" bolts.  The hex-nuts were 3/8".

If you're re-doing a toilet and the fixture will take a 3/8" bolt, get these instead of the cheap ones from the big box hardware stores.  The tank will align correctly without slipping and they won't corrode into a rusted mess in a year. Old toilets can last forever, get these and fix it once right.
Good quality parts and easy to install but the price is high.

My toilets came with brass colored steel bolts in water tank from OSH via Mexico. Both rusted out in 3 years. Leaking. These brass bolts make toilets bombproof!!!! Plumbing products love to keep plumbers working...these stop it!
Work fine, won't have to ever worry about them rusting out.
I did a lot of research to pick the best bolts to replace the bolts on all 4 of my toilets.  I really appreciate the order of placement provided on the back of the package.
Great quality!!!  Thank you!!

Great design; bolts are tightened beneath the tank prior to placing tank onto bottom section of toilet.

I previously had leaks through the bolts in the tank.

I'm pretty sure the extra rubber washer, metal washer and nut below the tank will avoid any leak in the future.

These are the real deal. I was surprised that I couldn't find solid brass bolts with solid brass nuts and washers in my local big box hardware stores. These are hefty and solid, and should last much longer than the ones that are simply brass coated.

They arrived with a few dark tarnish spots on them, but I believe that is typical of brass.

I'm back to buy my second set.
The washers and the nuts are not 100% solid brass. They are blended a strong magnet will hold them. The bolts are 100% brass

The product is very good quality. I ordered 2 set but one set is missing 2 washers and 2 rubber washers. The package is not sealed and very easy to open. I think the part missing was during the handling process.

I just received my Bolts the day Prime stated, however they were delivered late it the day. I started to install the bolts to the tank and discovered the package had the incorrect size nuts. The nuts just slid up and down the bolt. Thankfully this was a replacement and I had not thrown the old bolt set. I used the old nuts and got the tank mounted. How hard is it to get the correct nuts in the package. There is no excuse; just not quality control. I would go to a local plumbing supply house in the future where you can look things over before purchasing.  I would have sent back but I needed to get the toilet installed.

Solid brass finally…  hopefully no more corrosion leaks and rust stains underneath the tank on the floor. The only positive/negative would be to provide wing nuts in lieu of bolts to complete installation tightening, as they are not subjected to water or corrosion outside of the tank. Will order additional sets for the other bathrooms.

Update: I got a replacement - STILL wrong sized bolts. I have some bolts from an older order to compare to, so I've uploaded some photos of them beside each other. As you can see, the correct bolts are noticeably thicker and beefier. Even the head is considerably thicker, not just wider. And in the second photo you can see that the nuts that come with the incorrect, smaller bolts are still the nuts for the thicker bolts, so they don't fit the smaller ones at all - you can clearly see light between the nut and the bolt. The nuts can slide freely down the bolt, so the bolts and nuts you'll receive can't be used together - probably rendering them worthless like the ones I've received.

I just received the wrong-sized bolts. I have three others I've ordered and they are all correctly 3/8" by 3 1/8". However, exactly like another reviewer, the bolts don't fit the nuts. The other reviewer mistakenly thought the nuts were the wrong size, but it's the bolts that are the wrong size - they're much too small. It wouldn't have been obvious to me if I hadn't been ordering these to be able to compare them. I believe the fault lies with Lasco since the package label, nuts, and rubber washers are all correct - someone just put in the wrong bolts. So until this bad inventory is cleared out, you may want to hold off - or be prepared to send them back and roll the dice again.

Aside from this one mix up, the bolts are fantastic compared with typical toilet hardware. Solid brass and *very* beefy!
That the bolts were 5/16 and the nuts were 3/8.Nuts were to big for a smaller 5/16 bolt.Could not use.
Thicker bolt, worked awesome to fix my toilet, hoping they last longer then other bolts

I ordered two sets of these.  If they are Lasco parts, who can say. - They were loose, not carded as described.  One set contained 2 brass bolts, 6 rubber washers, 6 brass washers, and 4 brass nuts.  (Short 2 brass nuts.)  The other set contained 2 brass bolts, 6 rubber washers, 4 not-brass washers, and 4 not-brass nuts.  (Short two nuts and two washers.)  The bolts are all 3" x 5/16", not 3/8" diameter as described.  The metal washers and nuts are non-magnetic, but definitely not brass.  In fact, these pieces look like they're from an uncarded Fluidmaster 6102 set.  Of the pieces that were shipped, I will say the brass parts and rubber washers are sturdy.  I have to get the old, completely corroded, brass-plated parts out of my tanks so I will have to go with these.
Good product, good price. Will recommend to anyone with rusty bolts.  I tried to buy local, but couldn't buy brass bolts.  Much better buy with this product

Good quality.  The extra pieces allow you to put rubber washers on both sides of the toilet tank, and to crank them down.

Suggestion:  if your toilet is in a corner, get a  stubby 9/16ths box wrench.  My smallest adjustable wrench was too long to tighten the bottom nut effectively.
Great price and works well

I've ordered this product before and never had any problems. I just recently reordered and the first package arrived with mismatched nuts and bolts (Nuts were larger than the bolts). I figured it was just a fluke and notified amazon. Amazon responded and informed me not to worry about returning the defective kit, another one would be sent at no charge.  Unbelievably, the next kit arrives with the same issue (nuts are too big for the bolts).  I emailed the manufacturer about the issue.

I had previously tried stainless steel bolts to counter what appears to be corrosive tap water, but the heads were too small, and the rubber washers squished out of place, causing serious leakage.

THESE, on the other hand, have a bigger diameter (though they still fit easily through the tank boltholes), so they don't cause leaks.  And since they're solid brass (unlike the brass-plated ones which corrode heavily here north of Houston), I'm confident they'll be leak-free for years.

product_title: Delta Faucet B2512LF Chrome Pack of 1
product_description: WaterSense certification promotes water conservation Includes matching finish drain assembly 1 50 gpm at 60 psi 5 7 L min at 414 kPa 3 hole 4 in installation 4 5 16 Inch long 3 3 4 Inch high spout 4 5 16 Inch long 3 3 4 Inch high spout 2 3 8 Inch from deck to aerator

reviews.review_body: Very poor quality, plastic valves, not what you expect from delta name.  I would not recommend this item to anyone.

Great faucet
would suggest this model or any other one from delta. it is dependable and functions well and was easy to install
I love it so much I replaced all my faucets in both bathrooms with them. They look and operate great .
looks good, thought it be just a tad larger.
VALUE AND REPAIR PARTS AVAILABILITY  IN ANY HARDWARE STORE
Very satisfied.

I was skeptical buying this faucet for the price that it was...until I got it and compared it to the old $20 Menards faucet (all plastic garbage) I was replacing. This faucet is worth every penny since it has all brass fittings to connect the hoses. You will break the hose before you break this faucet connecting the hoses. Buy it if you have any doubt and are replacing a bathroom faucet!
box was open and parts loose in manufacturers box, did not come in amazon box, does not appear anything was missing
Beautiful and simple design, easy to install!
Works great.
I replaced a leaky faucet in the bathroom. Looks great and works well. I like that the base is not plastic. That is what caused the last one to leak.

I'm a big fan of this faucet.  We have over 200 faucets at the camp where I work and as we have need to change out old ones we've replaced them with these.  The price is reasonable and the Delta seats are easy to get and replace.  We keep 3 on the shelf and use them to replace as needed.  Life will be much easier when all the sinks have the same faucet with the same seats instead of the mix we have now.  When we build a new cabin, I always spec these for the new.  Otherwise we end up with the contractor special.
I left the old drain mechanism in place, only replacing the faucet. It wasn’t very difficult. I works well, just make sure you really tighten it, so it doesn’t leak.
While I have only used for about two months, I highly recommend this faucet for a small sink, it is well designed, has great flow and works well.

product_title: Westbrass 14 Brass Twist Close Bath Waste Overflow with 2 Hole Faceplate Matte Black D321 62
product_description: 1 1 2 in brass tubular bath waste assembly with 14 in maximum make up with 17 gauge brass tubes Twist close bath tub drain plug Two hole faceplate with two 2 1 4 in 20 x 1 1 2 in plated brass screws Two hole elbow shoe and tee with half ferrules included Finished trim unfinished rough in

reviews.review_body: This is a heavy, quality piece. Exactly what we were looking for.

reviews.review_body: I replaced a 15 year old mediocre faucet with this one--thinking it would be an upgrade. Many pieces in this faucet are plastic and wherever there was a chance to put a thinner, cheaper part in place--it was there. The nuts and hardware are thin and lightweight. The supply lines are "modernized" and no longer metal. The handle feels cheap as well as the buttons. I thought Meon was comparable to the other big faucet brands, but I'm disappointed. The installation was mostly straightforward with the exception of getting the faucet to line up with the escutcheon and the plastic insert.
Replaced old standard faucet with this beautiful and functional pull down.  So pretty!

reviews.review_body: it is a Delta

Nice replacement for the old Delta Classic crystal knobs. Faucet relatively easy to install as far as faucets go. I do wish Delta would have used longer flexible supply lines instead of shorter copper. That's my only real complaint.  For an inexpensive faucet this one works well.

I bought this faucet in June2021 to replace the more-than 25 year old Delta faucet in our bathroom than finally wore out.  Now, less than two years later, this probably-made-in-China sad excuse of a faucet is already dripping with a steady stream of water unless we play with the lever until it stops dripping.  The handle movement is no longer smooth either, but binds up as one attempts to turn the faucet off or attempts to manipulate the lever to change the temperature of the water.

reviews.review_body: Beautiful

I had a hard time finding just the right faucet for our 1925 bath, but this one fits in perfectly!  I am especially impressed with the quality of the faucet and parts.  The ease of operation (yes, there is a difference) makes it a pleasure to use.  Thanks!

The faucet itself is solid, that’s about it for the positives. The valve stem assembly connects the old way, and that’s not a compliment. When other manufacturers have innovated and made supply lines that literally click in place and connect from the T and snap in place, there’s NO excuse for Kingston still using the teflon tape and threaded nut approach. Plus both valve stems seem to be the same valve, meaning the supply ports face the same direction when attached. According to the (horrible and incomplete) instruction sheet diagram both valve stem supply outlets should be facing outward, in opposite directions, not possible with the valve stems I have in the box. Also, they provided braided water supply hoses, but I don’t see any flexible tubes for the supply T to valve stem connection. If you want to be frustrated like it’s 1990 all over again, but this, otherwise go with Price Pfister or other more up to date brand. They install in a fraction of the time, I should know I have installed many many faucets.
This faucet looks classy and elegant. I am happy to have it!
Good quality, very nice.
A beautiful bathroom faucet!  Love the handles and overall look… very elegant.
Finally, an ACTUAL solid brass faucet and not the plasticized junk from big-box stores.

The representative said it should last many years but evidently it did not. Stay away from this item unless you want to replace parts every 14 months or so.

Great looking toilet and super easy to install.  The touchless feature is awesome since you can do a courtesy flush without having to find the lever behind you.  Just wave your hand on top of the tank and voila.  Seat and cover, as opposed to other comments, feel fine to me.

I feel like a Kardashian!! I'm sure they have awesome toilets too. soft easy close lid. two choices to flush, one for #1 and one for #2. gorgeous upgrade to my bathroom. I love my new toilet!

Awesome product

We used this faucet for a play kitchen for our granddaughter and it was the perfect size for her to use.  Of course, we didn't hook it up to any water source.  Its tiny, easy for her to use and perfect for her little kitchen!  I wouldn't buy it for an actual bathroom or kitchen faucet, its just way too small.

This product is junk.  For some reason, I didn't read the reviews prior to buying it, so that's my fault!  And, since they are in Hong Kong, you have to pay if you want to return it and international shipping is more than the product itself.  Like the other reviewers said, don't buy this unless you're planning on using it for a "play" sink.

Product discretion is incorrect. This will not work as a bathroom faucet. As the other reviews state it does only have one hook up for hot or cold and is a very small faucet. However, it is a good product for the price if you understand it is just for one or the other. It is PERFECT for the application that I am purchasing it for, which is to make a PLAY kitchen for my daughter.
Bought this when making a play kitchen for my daughter...has held up to play beautifully and does the job. Can't say how it would fare with actual water running through it, lol!

Also purchased this faucet for my portable dishwasher.  It's the perfect size for this purpose.  I mounted it to an extra knockout on the soap ledge of a composite granite sink.  This faucet does have a few drawbacks.  First, my sink is about 5/8" thick at this location and is about the maximum sink thickness allowed.  I could not use a supply line with a plastic end, only a metal end which is a little shallower.  I could not use the included rubber washers either.  Another potential problem was the base of the faucet being about 1.5" and the knockout holes of my sink being 1.5" also and no extra space to add washers.  The attached aerator is plastic and had to be destroyed to be removed.  This faucet requires a male threaded aerator (or a male-male adapter in my case because I only had a female dishwasher adapter).  Inside the aerator, I felt the flow was a little restricted, so I cleaned up the rough edges with a Dremel, but this isn't necessary.  Once everything was connected and seemed okay, it sat for a few hours before running the dishwasher.  After this first use, the faucet started leaking about 3 drops per second.  I had to remove the handle (screw under the red dot) and the chrome spacer ring, then using a pair of channel-lock pliers, tighten the valve body to stop the leak.  So, I had a couple problems and shortcomings with this faucet, but I bought it specifically for it's small size and single water inlet and removable aerator, and it serves those purposes well.  Keep in mind that this is a really cheap faucet, and if I had known nothing about how valves work, my review could have easily been negative if I couldn't stop the leak.

Perfect for my needs. I bought it for a play kitchen I was building and it is great for that! Small, light, cute, and easy to "use". I'm not sure what else it could be used for though as it is quite small and the handle just turns it on or off. Also, mine came with a blue "button" (screw cover), not the red on in the photos so maybe it is randomly chosen? In any case, it is exactly what I was expecting and needed so five stars for that!

reviews.review_body: I'm a 20 year licensed plumber that has purchased and installed hundreds of shower valves and faucets. This line is an exceptional value and very well built. The valve action is smooth and has a high quality feel. You would typically have to pay much more for this level of quality and style. There are some plastic finish parts (shower heads and hand sprays) that go with the valve but that's common these days. The only reason I gave 4 stars is the first valve trim sent had scratches that appeared to be from previously opened packaging. Amazon was quick to send replacements. Highly recommended.
The parts came with multiples  noticeable  scratches . Super disappointed .

reviews.review_body: I've had this faucet for 5+ years and it still looks and works amazing.  One annoyance I had though was that the arc always wants to pull back toward center whenever you swivel it.  So if I want to push it all the way to the left or right, I'd have to hold it in place.  I like the faucet so much I just dealt with this.  After 5 years, the pull out spray hose started to fail, so I called Hansgrohe support for a replacement.  It's a proprietary part, so you can't just go to the hardware store.  It did take a while to get someone on the phone, but when I did they sent one under the lifetime warranty 2nd day air no problem.  Since I was already on the phone with support, I mentioned the arc pulling issue.  She said we'll include new glide rings which will fix that problem.  Received them, took about 3 minutes to install, and no more pulling back to center!  If you have this issue, it's an easy fix, and I love my faucet even more now.

The Hansgrohe Axor Citterio is a very well made faucet that looks great in minimal modern kitchens or even older 20's era bungalows like ours. The plating is flawless and looks like it will take years of abuse without a sweat. The handle and valve work smoothly, with little effort, and shut the faucet off without dripping. I also like that it doesn't have one of those dinky little rod handles that you see on "fancy" faucets—the blade on the Axor is much better looking and is much more of a wrist-blade handle for people who actually cook in their kitchen.

The install was pretty easy (maybe an hour including removal of the previous?). This is a high-class fixture that does not put looks over function. It has been a workhorse for us that just happens to look great.

My only issue was the aerator that ships with the Axor doesn't aerate. It literally adds no air so you get this incredibly focused stream of water that splashes all over, even in a very deep sink, making dish-washing and rinsing like a trip to a water park. I solved this by purchasing a 1.5 GPM Aerator for $3 from Home Depot online. I had it shipped to the store for free and it solves this stream issue. Look for the "Neoperl 1.5 GPM Tom Thumb PCA Aerator".

*Update*
I added photos to show how the aerator key works.

I saw this faucet at my interior designer's store and it looked so great that I ordered one right away.  I read the online reviews here and saw the comments about how the aerator doesn't mix in air and therefore the water splashes everywhere, but hoped that this was an isolated problem and that my faucet would be fine.  But I had the same problem as everyone else.  The water comes down in a beautiful and strong glass-like stream, but when you wash dishes, the water would splash everywhere.  Every time I washed dishes, the front of my shirt would get splattered.  Very annoying.  But J Lear's review is awesome.  I ordered the Tom Thumb aerator from Amazon - I ordered the 2.2 GPM version (because I like the strong water flow).  My plumber had thrown away the Hansgrohe key to unscrew the end of the faucet, but I called Hansgrohe and they sent me another one for free.  It was easy to unscrew the end, pop out the old aerator and put in the new one.  And problem solved!  No more splashing.  I am not a handy person but this was a very easy switch-out.  Thank you J Lear!

The faucet itself is beautiful, the lever is very easy and smooth to operate, and the water flow is strong (even with new aerator).  I would recommend this faucet (after switching out the aerator).
Hands down the nicest, heaviest, most satisfying faucet I've ever had.
Top quality, heavy and solid. Working great so far after 1 year use.
Beautiful. Well constructed. Easy install.
Love the design!
The sleek product with the real quality material and mechanics design.
Beautifully designed kitchen faucet. We replaced our previous faucet so as to get more clearance.

Just installed it last night.  Great quality.  Expensive, but we will use it every day.  The in-laws have one which gave me the idea.

Update - Having used it for a few weeks now, I am liking it more and more each day.  Really worth the price.

We  finally just open the box to install our Faucet in our new kitchen and it is missing parts. Fortunately we have a Fergusons nearby and hopefully they will have the parts. No way to get ahold of seller and return window is closed so now we have to wait to find the part to be able to use our sink. :(

For my kitchen redux I bought this very handsome Handsgrohe. I had installed by a plumber because I'm not a plumber. It works perfectly and looks great. However, it is not in anyway small. And full on the water stream will splash against anything that is in my very deep sink, causing the counter and me, to get wet. I compensate for this by not turning the water on full. A slower stream splashes significantly less.

Amazon's price was nearly half of what a local boutique faucet store was charging so I jumped.  The quality is apparent as soon as you pull the unit out of the box.  Heavy with quality components.  One thing that attracted me to the unit was the all metal sprayer.  Most units have a plastic sprayer which really bugs you.

Only issue I have is the spray pattern which is essentially none.  It's a heavy stream of water that flows out of the unit.  Depending on what it hits, it splashes everywhere.  Not sure if there is a way to change the pattern to more of a normal spray vs. stream but I'm still investigating.

To be fair I haven't installed it yet so I can't report on it's funcionality yet. The unit arrived when promised but the package looked like it had been opened a couple of times, all parts are in it though.
The most annoying thing is the picture you see here has a tulip shape to the pull out nozzle which I really liked but the one that was shipped to me is straight with no flare on the end.

Beautiful faucet.  It was an easy installation and love the final results. Operates smoothly and love the laminar like water flow.  I have a more traditional kitchen and this looks great - very sleek.

Amazing build quality, fantastic look, and great price. It's also easy to install and I'm sure will last a long time.

The only downside is the spray section is too strong due to being quite narrow. Hence, I'd go for the version that has a larger head for better spray section otherwise it would be 5-star.

I am VERY disappointed with this faucet and with Hansgrohe.  We bought and installed this faucet just recently.  The faucet is very attractive and our only complaint at this time is that the water comes out like a jet and splashes EVERYWHERE in our deep sink as reported by others here.  There is no aerator in the faucet so it does not mix ANY air in with the water when it is in the non-stream mode.  I called Hansgrohe figuring they would take care of the problem for me.  I am totally shocked by their response.  They told me to buy a $10 part online to fix the problem.  Seriously?  I just spent $500 on a kitchen faucet and you're not going to send me a part that costs you $1 to make sure i'm a happy customer.  I am very disappointed.  Stay away.

Had it for a few months now.  Works and looks fantastic.  There are two issues:  1)  As others have mentioned, you'll want the Tom Thumb (or your choice) of aerator.  It's a few bucks and a few minutes, even if you're not mechanically inclined.  2)  You need to dry-fit the unit and test out the range of motion to ensure you aren't bumping into your backsplash or other immovable objects when you go for hot or cold water.  As shown in the picture, (when the handle is making a 90 degree angle) the unit is off.  Moving the handle further to the right, away from the spout, increases water flow.  Moving the handle towards you and away from you (think pulling a slot machine handle) changes the temp.

This hasn't been installed very long in our new kitchen remodel, but so far, love it!  No drips, moves easily, pull-out works smooth, great contemporary look.  Wouldn't recommend for a smaller kitchen, may overwhelm it because it's tall.  Time will tell, but so far so good.  I would expect nothing less from an Axor.

Finally got sick of the heavy side sprayer of my faucet, it was hard to press the lever. Decided on a pull down faucet and wanted one that didn't have plastic for the sprayer. This faucet is sleek and works very smoothly. Didn't think I would like the side lever design but it's brilliant. Easy enough to install after pulling out the prior faucet. The spray is very easy to switch on and coverage in my 15"x28"x10" sink is good. The stream/spray isn't as powerful as my old faucet but that's due to the restrictor they have in it. I didn't bother to replace it as my husband likes to leave the water running when he does dishes. My only quibble is that the sprayer doesn't reseat fully when retracted but it's only 1/8" and I haven't bothered figuring it out because it's not really that big a deal. It's been 9 months since install and working great. I replaced the side sprayer hole with a reverse osmosis system and that's been great, too.

We were looking for an all-metal build, and this is worth the cost.  Other models have plastic pieces that fail early and often.  I may re-configure my shower to eliminate a rain-shower and opt for more, smaller heads.  But as far as rain showers go this is the best we could find and worth the extra price.
