Cartridge arrived but directions are a joke.  Called customer service for additional help.  Another joke. Was advised to call my plumber and I may or may not get reimbursed for trip charge.  This was not the only failed part by American Standard.  Previously had a valve that was faulty and they were no help.  I will not be using anything from this company again.  I previously purchased bath faucet, shower diverter and shower parts, sink and more.  My business will now be going to a different manufacturer.

This is probably my fault, but I had expected a larger faucet with thicker features.  This faucet is small and thin.  I am disappointed and it was expensive, but my contractor already installed it -so I am probably stuck with it.

product_title: hansgrohe Raindance S 12 inch Showerhead Premium Modern 1 Spray RainAir Air Infusion with Airpower with QuickClean in Chrome 27493001
product_description: 11 3 4 inch Raindance showerhead provides generous coverage creating a spa like shower experience 2 5 GPM flow rate provides thorough water flow Easy DIY installation ½ inch pipe connection recommend 9 inch Raindance showerarm 27422001 Easy to clean anti limescale silicone spray nozzles optimize water flow performance and can be quickly wiped clean Airpower technology mixes water with air to make lighter and softer water droplets that mimic the feel of natural rain

reviews.review_body:
We’ve had many different shower heads over the years. Water falls to steamers and everything imaginable in between. A little about me:  I love to be pampered.  This shower head excels in the realm of “take me away” relaxation.

If you want a true rain shower head; one which sounds, looks and feels like standing under a light to medium rain, than your search has ended on this piece of nirvana luxury.

Unlike most pseudo rain shower heads which stream down narrow bands of water, this shower head produces tiny droplets of water. I believe the addition of air integrated into the head allows for It to mimic rain falling.

Yes it’s an expensive indulgence, however it’s built very well and with occasional cleaning of hard water build up - I expect this to last for many years. It was also very easy to install. No extra or proprietary pipes needed. A little plumbers tape and screw the head on.

This product receives my highest rating and one of the best purchases I’ve made on Amazon of all time.
A FRIEKING FIVE HUNDRED & 20 DOLLAR SHOWER HEAD AND HE'S DISAPPOINTED..WHATS THIS WORLD COMING TO, CAN'T EVEN GET A GOOD 500 DOLLAR SHOW HEAD..THATS JUST NOT RIGHT LOL
Looks great.  Easy to install.  I highly recommend something this large….or perhaps larger.  It does exactly what we hoped…. makes it rain!

I have been looking for a shower head like this since visiting New Orleans and using one in a boutique hotel.  We installed over $30,000 of Kohler products in our new home.  Our previous Kohler overhead shower head just emitted a steady stream of water that covered a six inch area when standing underneath it.  The Hansgrohe pours a steady soothing cascade of raindrops over a foot wide.  I enjoy the light feeling of the rain drop-like water much more than the hard stream of the Kohler.  While the construction of this fixture is just a step below that of the Kohler it is certainly attractive and I will have to wait to judge it's durability.  Our Kohler products are extremely well made and have held up great over the last ten years. I used the Grohe chrome extension to mount it and it matches perfectly.

As for the other review here I would suggest you check your water pressure because there is certainly no shortage of flow resulting from the fixture itself.  If you are considering this 12" fixture I would suggest you read the reviews of the similar 10" fixture here on Amazon to get a more accurate opinion of this fixture when properly installed with sufficient water supply and pressure.
Does what it says.
Love it!!!!
it is really good..
Looks so nice!!
Makes shower feel fuller and much more enjoyable
Fantastic product at a great price from an awesome seller.
This is the BEST head possible. While it flows a lot of water, there is nothing like a raindance shower to wake you in the morning.
Excelente producto muy buena calidad
OUTSTANDING !!!  The only problem is, after a while you have to get out of the shower.
Very happy with our purchase
This showerhead is wonderful.  Feels just like standing in the rain.  It is a heavy piece and is made well.
I bought this Raindance shower head to replace another brand.  I am VERY impressed!  Buy with confidence!
Love it's raining affect

Package include a white glove to handle this shower head. It is beautiful and gives open shower feeling. This is first time I had shower comes directly above my head, not from angled front, and I love it.  The shower head can be tilted slightly 360 degree. Good finish as I expect from Hansgrohe.
Best shower head I have ever used. It’s huge and feels like rain. I replaced a $60 “rain head” with this and there is NO COMPARISON. Just buy it!

Excellent shower head.  I have very hard water and have had no issues with the nozzles clogging.  The fact that this head pulls air from the center means that it really does produce an authentic "rain-like" experience.  Quality of the material is top-notch.  I paired this with a Hansgrohe 90 degree shower arm for additional height.  Installation was super simple.  I've never purchased a bathroom fixture this expensive before, but it was well worth it.

Love the rain shower head...works fantastic.  Plumber had issues installing and it leaked and when I called Hansgrohe they worked with me and told me what the issue was and sent me all parts needed and it works terrific.  Hansgrohe has GREAT customer service and they will work with you to get everything right...at no cost to you.

This shower head looks great but very disappointed with water flow. My building has great water pressure and I even removed the flow restrictor but water flow effect is light and airy. It has airflow intake at center and with this covered the hissing from air flow stops (quiet is better) but no improvement on increasing water flow. Contacted HansGrohe asking if green nipples could be removed and they advised not possible.

If your looking for very light water this one is perfect. If your after stronger rain or light water-fall feel keep looking. Fortunantly we have handheld shower which works well but wasted so much money on this and not able to return once used. Looks great but would be happy if flow rate was adjustable. If considering a rain shower head it would be best to stop in good plumbing store where they have working units on display....wish I did.

In the past 10 years, we've tried 7 (yes SEVEN) different rain showerheads.  We purchased this one 4 years ago and it's still in our shower.  Simply one of (if not the) best rain shower head on the market.  Not much else to say, except what it provides is a real rain shower experience. Great flow, great droplets, and looks great too. Of course being from Hansgrohe it's extremely well built too.

Anytime I use my rain shower head it takes my whole stress level down. The water has volume yet feels so soft coming out of this shower head . I love it.  It's the perfect rain shower to get caught in.
This shower head is great. Does a good job in terms of wide / total coverage. More of a consistent rain shower, as opposed to a higher pressure blast. (And yes, we have good pressure)
My wife likes it but I think water pressure is bit to small.

Awesome shower head! The first one was defective and water was leaking around the adjustable neck. Amazon sent out a replacement right away and it became in two days. It took me about 5 minutes to install it. As others have stated, it has a very substantial mass to it. I mated it to a Kohler shower pipe and it looked great. I left the flow restrictor in and tested the showerhead. With the restrictor in, it feels like a gentle rainfall over my head and I love it. I have always been impressed by the Hansgrohe fixtures and this one is another winner.

May I please reqorder and request for discount.  it is weird that it is broken.  We flew the itme to the philippines and not feasible to return back to amazon.  what should we do? i plan to order but this is already a loss.  how can i get discount....

The rain dance air shower is good.
It is suitable for me.
However, it is a little expensive for this kind of product.

This showerhead really justifies the investment-grade price:

--Design, materials, construction and finish are impeccable.
--In use, it feels absolutely like you are showering in the rain. We attribute this to the combination of very effective aeration, which creates soft droplets, and the large area covered by the showerhead. A smaller head with the same aeration might have the soft droplets, but the total effect would not be the same.
--The showerhead feels like it delivers a high volume of water, even though it's limited to 2.5 gpm. We thought flow would feel lower due to the large surface area yet have been pleasantly surprised by the sensation that we're getting a large volume of water. Again, likely a function of the aeration. We use a Grohe showerpipe system with adjustable flow and do not need to turn it to the max to get a satisfying volume of water.

A couple of caveats:
--If you prefer the feeling of a stream of water, this showerhead is likely not a good choice.
--If you have ceiling lighting already in your shower, the showerhead may block some or all of the light. It's that large. Also, the mirror-like finish of the top surface will reflect light back on to your ceiling.  If you are building a shower with lighting and plan to use this head, double-check the positioning of your light(s) relative to position of the showerhead before you rough in the wiring.
Looks beautiful.  Works great.  Only small issue is that it drips for a few minutes after being turned off.

This product is wonderful, so far.
Ordered this 6/2016 for a small washroom project.
I was originally using a cheapy plastic Waterpik rainshower head from home depot.
It's a little high end but you get what you pay for.
The chrome look is very nice as well.

Pros:
- If you are looking for a waterfall / rain shower effect, this is the one you need.
- Feeling of standing right underneath a rainshower.
- Feeling of freshness after bathing.
- Large diameter covers a large area.
- Ideally can be used as a ceiling mount, I've used this with a the Hansgrohe 27413001 Shower Arm, 15-Inch in Polished Chrome (a bit expensive, but strong enough to ear the weight of this shower head).
- Very sturdy design.

Cons:
- Pricey
- No adjustable shower spray modes
- Needs adequate water pressure to work effectively.

reviews.review_body: Love the square look. We searched everywhere for brushed silver in square to match all our fittings in the master bathroom. This was the perfect fit.

Love the design, it looks really modern and pretty once it's installed.  The reason for one star off is that the finish seems a little porous so spots show really easily.  I was given a tip by the plumber who installed it to use WD-40 to remove spots, shine it up and repel the water.  I will give it a try.
Arrived with a nice chip out of the front of the handle. Also, if you don’t have plumber adjust the location of valve, the handle will stick out at least an inch if not more.
The trim looks good and was a significant appearance upgrade for our dated shower.
Beautiful. top quality.
Love the handle and how smooth it works. Brushed nickel finish doesn't show water spots!

I installed the mixing valve that works entirely with pex tubing and this was one of the few trim kits that works with that mixing valve. I knocked it down a star for the following reasons:
1. Pricey: this is a nice looking item but overpriced.
2. I don’t know if this is true with all mixing valves and trim kits (as opposed to two separate hot/cold controls) but there is no way to control the water volume once you find the temperature you want. It’s all or nothing at that temperature.
I purchased this shower fixture as part of my bathroom redecoration project. It is well made, looks good and I am very pleased with it.
We recently remodeled our bathroom and went with the entire Voss collection. I couldn’t be happier with our choice, it looks beautiful

I liked the style of the square plate, not a plain boxey looking thing, but this one has dimension to it. It looks very expensive. The handle also adds style too, again nit being uniformly shaped. I receive lots of compliments on my fixtures from Kohler.

reviews.review_body: The washer in the tub spout was not and could not be put at a proper place.  When our plumber installed it,  water just gushed out.  He tried all he could, but could not make it work.  We have reported and asked for a replacement.  But after a week, up to now, we have not received one yet.

I am remodeling my bathroom with all Moen Glyde fixtures and was being quoted a high price and long lead time for the shower/tub trim. I found the same trim pieces on Amazon for a much cheaper price and they arrived within 2 days with prime.  I will say the item arrived without an exterior amazon box and was just the Moen box which could easily be opened. I was concerned items might be missing or something but all was fine.  Glyde is a sleek modern clean look in chrome. Highly recommend!

product_title: KOHLER 7129 A BL Sink Drain Matte Black
product_description: Solid brass construction ensures durability and reliability KOHLER finishes resist corrosion and tarnishing exceeding industry durability standards over two times With overflow For use in overflow applications

reviews.review_body: We have a 20 year old sink so when replaced faucet wanted the drain to match. Drain included with faucet was way too thick and wide and water pooled vs draining completely. Found this and works perfect. Thanks Kohler!

product_title: Kingston Brass KB1975AL Heritage Widespread Lavatory Faucet with Metal Lever Handle Oil Rubbed Bronze 8 Inch Adjustable Center Oil Rubbed Bronze
product_description: Solid brass construction Durable washerless cartridge Deck mount 8 to 16 widespread 3 hole installation 1 2 GPM 4 5 LPM water flow rate at 60 PSI Standard 1 2 IPS connection 5 7 16 spout clearance 6 7 16 spout reach

reviews.review_body:
This is a great looking faucet.
The pictures do not do it justice.

Kingston Brass is one of the worst companys I've ever had the displeasure of working with!!!! I purchased one of their very high end, almost $400, kitchen faucets about a year ago. It arrived and I was very pleased. It seemed well made, heavy duty, excellent. It worked well until the hot water side started to leak. Ok, no problem, I'll replace the hot water cartridge. Simple enough. I ordered a new cartridge. Weeks later it arrived. Unfortunately they delivered the wrong one. No problem, annoying but mistakes happen. After finally getting someone to wake up in their warranty dept., I got the return authorization, and returned the cartridge. Now, instead of them automatically shipping the correct one, was told I had to go back on line and order a new one. I did. Days later they called to inform me that the one I needed was one backorder and, instead of them putting me on their backorder list, I would have to check with them periodically to see if they had received them. That was in early Feb. They weren't expecting any until mid-March. March turned into late April. In late April they had new stock and I was able to order my new cartridge. Finally it arrived. We'll have hot water in the kitchen again. I'm excited. Installed the new cartridge, turned on the water and........it drips worse than the one it was to replace. To make matters worse, they all but laughed when I finally reached them (it's almost impossible to get them to answer their phone). I was told to take a picture of the cartridge and email the warranty dept. That was week ago, and still no response. If you're still reading this, all I can say is find yourself another company. There's a reason no one has heard of KB. Spend your money on a name brand with customer service, not some half-assed, back street, boiler room, incompetent bunch of buffoons like Kingston Brass. Buyer beware!
These faucets are amazing. The swivel faucet makes cleaning so easy.
We installed the faucet as replacement for a faucet that tarnished.  This was no different and tarnished within 6 months.
It came with a broken piece inside the cold tap.  It is a plastic white piece that stops the movement of the handle.  Taps won’t stop dripping because of it

Very pretty, very heavy quality but a bear to install. Kept getting a few leaks and unable to tighten the handles down very well. My husband has installed many faucets over the years but complained a good bit on this one...

I purchase two of these faucets and they look great! I had a professional install them ( he remodels bathrooms for a living) he said it was hard to install and the small metal part for the pop-up drain kept falling off so he had to use wire to hold it in place. He was upset because it makes his work look sloppy. I agree everything else looks so nice even under the sink the plumbing was done so nice and neat but not the wire is there. I could not find if this product is safe to sell in CA due to the lead content. Lastly, the water pressure with the additional part on the spout is very poor I had to take it off to get enough pressure to rinse my kids toothbrush. I would probably buy Delta or Moen next time they have ones that look similar but they are also more expensive.
Beautiful fixtures and great price
This is a very high quality faucet.  Extremely well made and very heavy to hold.  All of the parts fit perfectly and was as easy to install as any faucet I have ever purchased.

everything good.  Fairly easy to install if you have the necessary tools.  Recommend a larger diameter washer for underside of counter top.  Drilled holes in granite are about 1 1/4 inches and not exactly straight through.  Not much overlap to clamp against.

I actually had a plumber friend install it because I was working and just wanted to get installed. It's a great faucet: solid and "weighy" so there is no doubt it will last. I'm doing my kitchen now and will be installing the same there, though a bit larger of course.

Faucet is nice. The aerator does restrict a decent amount of flow but it is acceptable and energy wise .  One thing to note is that the entire spigot does Swivel so you can move it left to right  This allows tou to clean the sink but you might want to watch you don’t move it too far. Overall those nice faucet for the price and it includes all pieces you would expect to install.
Look great in master bathroom
Great design and quality.
so well made and perfect for our bathroom.

product_title: Kingston Brass GS2792GLBS Georgian Widespread Two Handle Kitchen Faucet with Matching Brass Sprayer 8 1 4 Inch in Spout Reach Polished Brass
product_description: Fabricated from high quality brass material for durability and reliability 1 4 turn lifetime hardies ceramic cartridge 8 Inch 16 Inch Widespread installation Max 1 8 GPM 6 8 LPM Water Flow Rate At 80 PSI ASME standard Compliant with California Energy Commission Title 20

reviews.review_body:
Handle broke during assembly.
No support whatsoever

Loved the looks of it . Was very disappointed the stems were too short for installation through a two inch counter. Would order it again right away if some type of extension or adapter is available for it, or if a longer model is available.

Kingston never returned calls. Used their website email, they sent two new valves. Didn't work, water continued flowing when turned off. Valves are brass but moving parts are ceramic. Returned to Amazon for full refund. Ordered Kingston Bridge Faucet from different site. Same brass/ceramic valves but this one does not leak.
Beautiful set, very heavy and well made.
WOW.. I've got preasure I never had..Very pleased with my purchaes..Love the sprayer..

Do not order this product.  We've had it for about six months; the faucet sounds like a train whistle when it's running, we replaced the washer-thingy to make it better; the hot water handle got all wonky after about a month; my husband replaced washers and stuff; it still doesn't sit right.  This morning, the faucet itself stopped running, the only way to get water is to use the hose.  This is a lousy product.
Love the look.

The faucet is heavy brass and of high quality to be sure and from a quality standpoint I highly recommend it. Where it falls short in my opinion is on the installation instructions.
For example on the instructions I received there was no mention of the ordination of the hot and cold spigots when using a lever mounted handle. Luckily I saw the red o ring on the spigot and I knew this to be the hot spigot to the mounted on the left side.  If you are have installed faucets before this is likely to be no big deal.  On another note the parts diagram shows the faucet breakdown but identifies the parts by number only, there was no description. Also their warranty is not a lifetime warranty Moen is.
Having said all that it is a beautiful faucet you cannot go wrong there
I haven't had it very long, but the quality was surprisingly good for the money.  I love it!
Quality

product_title: hansgrohe 28719003 Inversa 2 Way Showerarm Mount Diverter Chrome 0 5
product_description: SUPERIOR DESIGN German design delivers sleek style for your bathroom INSTALLATION NOTES Hansgrohe recommends a licensed plumber install this product LIMITED LIFETIME CONSUMER All hansgrohe products are covered by a limited manufacturer applicable to the original purchaser Package Dimensions 5 9 L x 3 1 W x 1 6 H

reviews.review_body:
I bought one of these locally about 4 years ago and it has worked flawlessly since with everyday use.  It still looks and operates like new.

We were told to turn the water off before operating the valve because operation under pressure can damage the o-rings.  We operate it under pressure and have had no issues. I have not needed to try but I was told the o-rings are serviceable.

I plan on buying another for our guest shower and would highly recommend it to friends/family.
worked out great.
Just what we needed and in the right color.
Nice and solid.  Easy to pull and push the diverter.
Works well. Good quality.
Works easy, without it there would be extra plumbing to have a handheld. It stays nice and shiny, it's just nice.
Works Great!
Great quality.  You don't wanna have to change out a cheapo one. This piece is solid.  Looks and feels great.
After less than a year of use, it became nearly impossible to operate.  Another piece of poorly engineered German junk!
This unit, as other reviews have described, is made of solid metal and not plastic, so the feel and switches work flawlessly.  no complaints here.
Good product.  I didnt want plastic.  This valve is all chrome.  It switches easily, even under water pressure.  I bought this for a removable hand shower head.  All the connectors fit perfectly.
Easy to use and install, and looks great with the rest of the Hansgrohe shower accessories.  I used the plumbers tape to attach and haven't had any issues.

Install this diverter in our shower for our hand held shower head and found it to work perfectly. I do not see any loss in water pressure and the push-pull works very smooth. Would recommend to friends.

This is a quality product and is not cheap compared to other options.  Well worth the $.  Water flow is not affected at all, which was my biggest concern.  I have had similar products that were substantially inferior.  Don't waste your money on a cheaper product.  This is a winner.

Thought I was buying expensive quality, but 2 years later this is VERY hard to pull it to divert the water.  Was fine when we first got it.  Did not use it much but now we are using it almost daily.  It does not seem to be corroded but still is not loosening up either.  We have soft water so should not be a scale issue either.  Not sure what the problem is, but I'm back in the market for another one.

I replaced another diverter with this one and so far so good. Easy to install and easy to use. Wrapped white sealing tape on the threads and installed this diverter to the water pipe end and the other two sides to a hand held sprayer and to a new shower head. Everything works and no leakage noted.
You can feel that the quality is good, but it is difficult to switch between the two situations

I am  fans of Germany product and had many Germany products include Hansgrohe or Grohe but this one the worst experience for me.

the push and pull control most of time just not worked, when I push it down it always automatically return to up position automatically,very very rare chance it can stay at the pushed position for a short time - I only used it 2 times each for 10 minutes to wash my dog.
I had to manually push it in the down position to finish the washing ( I surely tried to push/pull with no water pressure)

I just realized I am too lazy - it just exceed the return window last weekend and I should return it after first usage.

My only choice is to discard this poooooooor product and find another cheaper working one.
very good

As other reviewers have no doubt noted this is a nice solid heavy duty piece which for a change may outlast my shower head! It operates a bit differently in the push down pull up methodology for changing between the shower head to the handheld, and you can't have both which is the only slight disappointment.

Very good build quality. All metal construction with some rubber bits on the inside. There might be some plastic in there too but I can't tell. Finish is excellent and product feels quite heavy and substantial. The effort to move the diverter is lower than I expected, especially with wet hands.
As reported by others, did not stand the test of time. Became VERY hard to switch after a couple of years and then started leaking. Leak couldn't be helped with plumbers' tape.
Great purchase. Durable metal construction, nice finish, and works every time without a hitch.

The quality of this product is fabulous.  It's heavy and feels SOLID.  It's does not feel cheap or flimsy and definitely not made of plastic.  However, I could see right away that it was going to put a huge water restrictions on both the handheld and the main faucet.  There is no way to increase the flow.  Also, it made my showered too look clunky.  I decided to go for a diverter that is attached near the wall end of the shower arm rather than the end of the shower arm.  I am very happy with Amazon's ease of return.

Very nice valve!  I replaced a plastic version that worked well for quite a while.  This valve is impressive. Works flawlessly with little effort.  For those who appreciate reparability  it appears that the internals can be accessed with a pair of E ring pliers and a hex wrench.  The only downside was during installation.  A synthetic washer is supplied for the connection to the shower arm. Upon tightening, the rather thin tubing slices through the washer rendering it useless.  I used about 4 wraps of plumbers tape and only tightened till I was satisfied. All is well!
It arrived on time and is working fine so far (used less than a month, too early to tell)

First diverter replaced under warranty as it became too hard to pull out the control knob. Same issue happened with the replacement diverter. Threw it out and bought a different style Delta diverter. Sorry to have wasted my money on this product and the added labor costs.

This hand shower diverter is all metal, not like those cheap plastic diverters that will break if you over-tighten. This will just stop tightening if you over-tighten, as it should be. Although it doesn't specify it in the instructions, I used teflon tape around the shower pipe, around the nipple on the diverter valve for the showerhead, and installed it until it was quite tight.

You should install it as per the instructions on the package. If the valve starts to leak when you turn the water on, then take everything apart and use the teflon tape. Wrap the threads twice, and then re-install. The reason for this is that all pipes are not made equal, so you should err on the side of caution.

Also, I installed the hand shower holder at 3 O'clock, which should prevent the valve from loosening up, as it provides an automatic tightening whenever you remove and replace the hand shower onto the holder.

With the water on, the valve feels smooth and you don't need a lot of force to use it. I'll post updates as time goes on about valve operation. But I think you will be pleased with the quality of this valve. And if you don't have a hand shower to use it with, you can always use it as a plumb bob because it's that heavy.

product_title: Kohler 79701 Replacement Part
product_description: Replacement valve stop kit Engineered to promote product longevity Made with premium materials for enhanced durability

reviews.review_body: did not need but did not return

product_title: Rohl A1408XMAPC 2 C Spout Widespread Bathroom Sink Faucet with Cross Handles Chrome
product_description: 1 4 turn ceramic disc control cartridges 3 x 13 8 cutouts 4 15 16 spout reach 1 2 NPT connectors Matching tub fillers A1454 and A1464 1 4 turn ceramic valves 3 x 1 3 8 cutouts 4 15 16 spout reach 1 2 NPT connections Matching tub fillers A1454 and A1464 15 3 4 maximum spread distance between valves Solid brass 1 5 GPM

reviews.review_body: I purchased the Rohl Country Bath collection about 5 years ago and made the very bad mistake of getting the polished nickel finish.  These are extremely expensive fixtures.  I have the bridge faucet, the tub faucet and hand shower and the entire shower group (temperature valve, volume valves for the rainhead shower and the hand held shower).  Within about 2 weeks, the fixtures in the shower began to tarnish.  Within two months, they looked like tarnished silver with water spots.  I tried to clean and polish them with the suggested polish (Simichrome), but it made a HUGE mess and nearly ruined the tiles in the shower.  It also did not work very well.  Upon contacting Rohl, I was told to wash the fixtures with dilute dish soap and immediately dry after EVERY USE!  So ridiculous!  The sink and tub fixtures look better, but they are not constantly exposed to water.  The sink drain looks like old aluminum, due to the effects of toothpaste.  I was told that there is no defect in the finish.  Seems that it will look great in a showroom, but don't use it or expose to water unless you have a full time staff to take care of it.  Bad product and a very bad company, customer service wise.

I bought 6 Rohl VIaggio bathroom faucets. 5 out of the 6 stream of water splashes all over the place. There is not a smooth stream. One works beautifully. Has anyone else had this problem. Rohl said the lines have to be blown out, but this is all new construction. In addition, ?I see water spots already on the Polished Nickel finish. Why would this happen and how do you clean it? I am most unhappy.

The sink faucet & drains were installed a month ago. Went away for a week. Came back & the drain is ruined. No one at the bath shop told us the polished nickel finish has to be wiped down after EVERY use. These faucets were ridiculously expensive. Rohl does not mention this fact anywhere. I can not restore the drains to their original luster. I’ve tried vinegar and water. So unhappy. Buy a different brand & finish
Beautiful and great ergonomically.  Styling is excellent.
excellent
Great quality!  Quick delivery

Came with piece broken. Distributor said only way they would help me is if I send installed faucet back for exchange rather than calling manufacturer for part for me. Broken and terrible customer service.
Stunning faucet for retro bathroom made to last forever.
Product is well made and beautiful to look at.  Plumber installed and had a more difficult time but it's done and I am pleased.  I am certain this faucet will last a long time.
The faucet is a little expensive, but definitely stands out.  Since I am using it every morning and night, I think it is well worth it.
Elegant faucet. i bought  2 of these for our his and hers vanity. They look really nice and give my bathroom the classic feel I needed.
Tricky to install yourself but good quality if you have the $$ to spend.

This is not only a beautiful product, great quality, but most importantly, the company stands firmly behind its merchandise.  We had a minor issue and without any hesitation, the company sent us replacement parts.  Thanks you Rohl!!

Worth every penny.  Feels solid.  No plastic parts here.  It looks it too.  I bought a similar style at Home Depot which is beautiful but you can clearly see the difference.  I don't plan to change these for years so the extra investment is worth it.  Came in felt duster bags to assure no scratches.  Also came with many accessories for the installation.

Love this product. The polished nickel is beautiful, but you have to clean it ALL THE TIME to avoid discoloration that the water marks leave. I dont know what it is about this verse all the other PN products I have bought in my bathroom, but this product almost looks rusted after only a month or two of using it. I am still trying to figure out how to clean PN to get that removed. But otherwise it looks gorgeous. High end. The drain was not long enough for my sink basin so its a little tight, but otherwise I am very happy.

Absolutely beautiful, high quality faucet! Feels very sturdy and well-made. I would have given 5 stars, but the one we received showed up with 2 “cold” labels and no “hot” (unfortunately, we were delayed in our renovations and didn’t catch this until after the return window had closed).

I LOVE how it looks! Sadly, water leaks from and causes yellowed water stains on the marble. I missed my window to return it because I bought it months before it was installed. So very sad and disappointed. Rohl is a high quality brand.

We purchased 2 of these for a bath remodel, and they are absolutely gorgeous.  They're made from brass with quality brass guts.  (Many name brands at the big box stores have plastic parts inside).  This product has ceramic cartridges so they won't develop a drip.  Surely, these cost more, but if you want something you won't have to replace--or have to replace washers and so forth--this is your item.  As with many items--it's pay me now, or pay me later.

We installed these ourselves and were amazed with the quality.  They are heavy with wonderful built in O-rings to prevent any possible leaks.  Logical.  The style went beautifully with our remodel and keeping with the year the home was built.  These are classical, beautiful, easy to install, heavy and high quality.  We would purchase again for another bath remodel.

I installed this faucet on my bathroom kolhler sink, it was easy to install. First time for me, thanks for YT! the only minor issue during installation was that I had to enlarge the faucet hole by using a DT-DIATOOL Diamond Finger/Milling bit for Tile Porcelain Hard Ceramic Diameter 20mm which worked great! 5 seconds with the grinder and it was enough.. I am very satisfied with this faucet.. i don't know if this faucet comes with interchangeable valve caps which I saw on others... but it did come with the hot and cold ceramic caps.. if anyone knows how I can find the polished nickel hot and cold caps please let me know..thanks!

product_title: EZ FLO 1 1 2 Inch x 16 Inch Kitchen Sink End Waste Center Outlet Direct Connection for Tubular Drain Applications Chrome Finish 35014

reviews.review_body: I have a vinyage cast iron sick. I have been battling leaks for several years. I finally found something that works with my sink
22 gage not 17 guage

product_title: KOHLER K 72791 CP Artifacts Wall mount bath spout with flare design Less Handles Polished Chrome
product_description: Non diverter spout Premium metal construction for durability KOHLER finishes resist corrosion and tarnish Coordinates with other products in the Artifacts collection Non diverter spout

reviews.review_body: I did not look at full product specs so this is my fault for purchasing. The spout is 8.7in in length. Many spouts are around 5in or so. We have a 60in tub for guest bathroom renovation and this just looked awkwardly big so we returned it. Fantastic quality, metal and heavy duty. If you have a big tub this would work! But standard size it seemed to look way too big in my opinion. Hope this helps!
It was reasonably priced and looks great.  I love it.
Absolutely love it!
Good QUality easy installation

Wow, this thing is an elephant trunk. I was aware of the dimensions when I ordered it, but it's something to behold once it lands on the doorstep.

And that's the thing with Kohler -- some of their stuff is relatively run-of-the-mill, like their hollow, stainless spout I'm replacing (didn't match my chromed-out scheme, oops). It's almost a shame to have to permanently attach this spout to the wall, because never again will anybody using it be able to appreciate the sheer gravitas of the solid brass construction (save for the plastic aerator in the tip). It's quite the piece of art.

Inside the back end are the options for a slip-fit onto a 1/2" copper pipe, or a more conventional threaded connection to I/2" brass. The slip fit connection provides quite a bit of installation leeway in determining the length of copper pipe protruding from the finished wall. The threaded connection provides a stronger connecting piece, with a little more headache in determining what length nipple to purchase, but preserves some flexibility in swapping out a different threaded connection down the road without tearing into the wall (though I think that's maybe an unlikely scenario?). Either connection should be fine; I went with threaded, but the slip fit would truly have been just fine for me if I hadn't already installed a threaded elbow.

The threads, by the way, are not machined in to the spout. Instead, they're part of a bracket that is slid into the backside, and affixed at three points with screws. The bracket, and therefore the threads, can be rotated into three positions, meaning it's quite easy to ensure the threaded connection is tight enough and the spout is oriented correctly (sometimes you'll reach full tightness but the spigot will be pointing straight up, or off to the left).

With the spout mounted, it's quite unique looking compared to your average Joe bath spout, but short of using it as a step to access an overhead storage compartment, I don't think its solid brass construction will every be appreciated by anyone other than those handling it prior to installation. And so goes the life of monumentally unappreciated bathroom fixture.
This spout is bigger than I thought it would be, but it looks and operates nice.
Made well and nice finish. I ordered a separate trim package from Kohler via a Kohler distributor.
Looks great, just wish it weren’t quite so long.
Nice length and shape, simple and stylish.  No problem at all with the installation.  Likes the clean outline and looks great for my tub.

product_title: GROHE 23956003 Plus Single Handle Bathroom Faucet M Size Starlight Chrome
product_description: Single hole installation Metal lever handle GROHE Silk Move 1 1 28 mm ceramic cartridge With temperature limiter GROHE StarLight chrome finish

reviews.review_body: Superior quality materials.  Unique modern design.  So far, the finish seems durable and easy to clean.  I love it.
Love the style, shiny, easy to clean and install.  Beautiful addition to upgrade my home.  Love this brand!

Top-notch quality as always from GROHE. Beautiful, sleek design with razor sharp finish. This is an item that will surely get compliments or comments from anyone visiting your bathroom for the first time. Installation was not easy and instructions were just so so. Took me awhile but I got it installed correctly. Operation is buttery-smooth and water-flow is adjustable down to a fine detail. Love having this in my bathroom.

Gorgeous, substantial, side handle bathroom faucet!

I had this faucet professionally installed in a master bath and the plumber said that the installation went as expected and he didn't run into any surprises.

The faucet itself feels weighty in your hands, and installed has smooth movements. The faucet height is good for a standard height countertop and allows you to wash your face easily. Flow-through is excellent and the stopper mechanism works easily/smoothly.  If you want a side handle, modern look, this Grohe faucet is worth considering

I had to replace an existing faucet that was installed by the builders in our new house because it didn't fit well with the vessel sink. The old faucet was too low for the vessel sink. When I saw this I knew this would fit perfectly,

If you have a vessel sink, this is high enough to give enough clearance. However, you must measure the clearance it requires (about 3 inches) for its lever handle. Make sure that there is enough distance from the sink to the faucet hole that allows for the lever handle to move freely in front of the sink.

 It looks very elegant, modern and high-quality.  Highly recommended!

This is a beautifully made and designed bathroom faucet. All the parts feel high quality, with smooth, secure movement. This was not difficult to install, except that the instructions are really vague. If you have never installed a faucet you might want to hire a professional. I like that the reach is higher than a usual bathroom faucet, but not so tall it feels like a kitchen faucet. It does swivel, which is such a good idea! It's so much easier to get the perfect mix of hot and cold water. Grohe has one of the best reputations in the plumbing fixture world, though the products are no longer made in Germany.

Beautiful addition to the bathroom renovation. The GROHE 23956003 Plus Single-Handle Bathroom Faucet M-Size, Starlight Chrome is a sleek and modern piece. I wanted something that would stand out and blend in with a very modern and clean white looking bathroom renovation. This handle delivered exactly what we were looking for. Tying in beautifully with the whites and grays of the marble and tile in the bathroom, along with the dark cherry colored vanity this chrome faucet stands out beautifully. Installation is incredibly simple. I am by no means a plumber, yet I was able to install this on my own in about 30 minutes. All the parts are very well-made and heavy duty. So far we’ve had zero leaks and zero issues with this so far I am absolutely confident that this faucet will last a lifetime.

As with all Grohe  items you are getting a real quality product.  The craftsmanship  is superb.  You can tell just by lifting it.  Top notch components are not overlooked.  And with all Grohe products, they are very modern looking.  Once you get by the non user friendly installation directions the installation wasn't all that bad.  Just take your time so that you know you are doing it correctly the first time around.  Once it was installed you can really see what makes Grohe so good.  The components glide smoothly and the features are awesome.  Like the gliding faucet.  Real nice feature!  The finish on it is also top notch.  Easy to clean and leaves no water spots.  Grohe is the star of my bathroom!

Grohe is just TOPS for plumbing fixtures...
they always made the most reliable fixtures, first rate...
this is no exception, the finish is, as always superb, which is partly what u are paying for...
but what grabs you with this faucet is the look...it has such a sleek modern look, just love it ...
motion lever is smooth, like a Porche...
the instructions are pictures, that is because its one product for the world... things have changed thorugh the years
since I  have installed them for 30 yrs....
this one is a must have if you like modern sleek look....
Kudos to the Grohe design team!

I love the sleek design this faucet offers. It's gorgeous, stylish and works like a charm.  Grohe products represent quality, reliability and endurance.  However, the instructions for installing this are not so clear.  Thankfully, my neighbor is a plumber how clearly knew how to install this despite limited instructions.  My advice, find someone who knows about plumbing more than you do for support! Once the faucet is in, you'll be truly happy with it!

Really pretty faucet. It’s so high, however, and our sink is quite shallow, so the water splashes the faucet terribly. Recommend this for deeper sinks! Ours did not come with the flat piece that covers up the extra holes (sink has 3 holes), so we bought that piece separately. Other than that, installation went smoothly. The stopper handle sticks out on the back, so be aware of that if you have a backsplash close to the faucet. (We wanted to put in a backsplash, but we couldn’t.) Basically, nice faucet but not the best for this little sink.

When we purchased our home it came with taps that were installed in the 80s. The one we had in our bath was a basic one with two knobs and it broke a few weeks ago. Our neighbor who is an all-purpose handyman was able to easily install this one. The big thing I love about this tap is that it's easy to control the temperature, this is really important because my old tap was super temperamental and would jet out boiling water or nothing at all. It was also easy for us to teach our four years old how to safely use it. Finally, the tap is super stylish.

I installed this in the guest bathroom and every time we have guests at home, I hear praises for this faucet. It looks good with its elegant design and is very easy to use. The installation was a little tricky and requires some specialized tools. But its not impossible. The instructions that came with it (and for that matter come with any Grohe faucet) were scant and confusing. Finally, I watched a YouTube video and installed it. Still, it took me more than an hour.

But it was time well spent. The new faucet saves a lot of water because earlier we had two separate faucets for hot and cold water.

I like this and would recommend it.

Some people don’t like a blocky faucet, I love the block design very much. The finish is absolutely stunning and also is easy to maintain with just a wipe down. The handle was easy to maneuver and it had a silky smooth motion that was most pleasant to feel and operate. The provided instructions were excellent and informative and easily understood. The pictures to were excellent for installation even for me to get and understand. No doubt on the quality of materials that were used. Accessory Items to were of quality and design. The pieces and parts all fit together well and the lines and curves were consistent throughout this top of the line bathroom faucet. Four Stars!!!

I love this Grohe M Faucet, but I hated the instructions. They are wordless IKEA-like line drawings and diagrams. While very precise in technical detail, the steps lack text of any kind to warn of pitfalls. Grohe should not assume that the pictures are self-explanatory. Yes, some of them are, like make sure the water lines are not twisted, pinched, or bent at very tight angles, but would it have hurt anything to include a short text blurb?

For step 1, there is 1a, 1b, 1c. 1a and 1b look like they pertain to the optional metal plate at the base of the faucet. But is 1c optional? Then there's 2a and 2b. If I chose to keep the metal base plate (1a), do I only do 2a? The problem is that the diagrams show the top pull

This fixture is awesome.  I wanted a tall faucet because I frequently wash my hair in the sink, and this one works beautifully.  It looks super handsome with the gleaming starlight chrome finish, clean lines, and a very modern style.  The ability to swivel the faucet head right or left adds to the versatility.  The quality level is excellent too, and I expect this well-made piece to last.  Unfortunately there are a few things that keep it from perfection.  First, the lever on the back of the faucet for raising and lowering the pop-up drain looks surprisingly chintzy.  I realize you don't really see it all the time, but it doesn't match the rest of the fixture in finish or looks.  Second and more importantly, the installation manual is not good at all.  It covers two faucets with different designs, so you're continually having to determine which pictures to try to follow.  The pictures themselves - there is no text or written instructions - are hardly better than technical parts diagrams and should be better considering that this is a $250+ fixture.  Grohe has a few install videos online but they're not product specific and weren't helpful for my faucet.  My install was further complicated by the fact that I put this single hole fixture on a vanity made for a 3 hole fixture.  No problem, as I ordered an escutcheon plate from Grohe that covers the two unused holes.  Unfortunately the plate didn't come with instructions at all, despite having multiple pieces that need to be installed in the proper order which isn't self-evident.  Then I discovered that the metal pipe tube at the base of the faucet and which must go through the counter top was bigger than the hole in my vanity.  I was able to grind the hole bigger but only after a trip to Lowes to buy a special rasping bit for my drill.  A very long review to say that the faucet is fantastic, but installing it wasn't.  Please improve your instructions, Grohe!

At this price you would think that if the different models had different parts to assemble them then they EACH would need their own instruction manual, right?? I guess that would cut into their profit margin by a couple of cents.
  This got me so mad, we wasted sooo much time trying to figure where the missing parts were, looking online  for info on how to get them etc..  BTW forget about any customer support from GROHE, that's not happening.
  So in a nutshell, if you happen to read this before ordering I can save you a headache by letting you know that they have instructions (generic) for two DIFFERENT faucets (*other one is: GROHE 33170003 Plus Single-Handle Bathroom Faucet S-Size, Starlight Chrome ) in the one pamphlet, yeah wasn't that swell??
  I really don't think this is worth this price unless you need it to complete your bathroom look with another of their bath shower fixtures that coordinate with this. We were mixing and matching, the coordinating shower fixture was about double this price and didn't even include a tub water spout. I am still so aggravated about the bad directions and lack of support I don't think I will ever get another GROHE fixture again. Wish I could find some made in the USA products! Maybe soon we will start making things here again and it will be done right (*including  the instructions)! Not happy.

I really like this M-Size Bath Faucet from Grohe.
It has excellent design and styling.
It pairs well with a modern design theme.
The geometric shapes of it give it an engineered look yet with a touch of playful styling.
It is uniquely proportional in many ways from the thick robust main riser, medium sized horizontal spout to the thin small handle lever. This gives it visual interest while keeping it from feeling too bulky nor too thin.
The curved areas lend a softer feel to what otherwise would have been a hard metallic angular design.
Even the drain pull adds its own distinctive element with it's small cylindrical shape.
The build quality is as usual for Grohe, second to none. Silky smooth valves that are quiet with great precision.
A uniform and flawless finish. Easy to keep clean and beautiful to look at. This one is when paired with the right design elements can make a statement. One of my favorite faucets by Grohe. 5 stars.

I've been updating the house and discovered Grohe after having used American Standard or Kohler on my other houses. I'll never go back to any other brand now, I'm a Grohe convert!
The finish on these truly is exceptional- sure, it looks like chrome like all of them but it's different. It cleans perfectly and easily and has a depth to the shine that the other brands can't pull off. It's hard to describe, but you'll notice it instantly.
The build quality of this faucet is fantastic as well. It's really heavy and solid. The way all the parts move is smooth and firm. There's no mistaking that this is very high end in every way. This particular faucet has a rotating feature which is unusual for a bathroom fixture but I love that feature. With the height and rotation feature, it makes for a more versatile sink. My master bathroom is being renovated now, with the floors being done this week and all the plumbing next week- including a complete Grohe makeover with shower controls, towel racks and everything all matching. You just can't beat this stuff- and I anticipate it will last forever.

The Grohe Single handle bathroom faucet is a feast for the eyes – although the style should be compatible with other fixtures in your bathroom. It’s modern, fairly angular, and might not look right in your bathroom.  This faucet is designed as a one hole installation – I bought a Grohe plate to cover the two holes in my sink that would otherwise have been uncovered. (Since then, I’ve removed and re-installed it without the plate, putting a soap dispenser in one hole and a faucet for purified water in the other hole).
With that warning, let me say that this faucet has features that few others (aside from Grohe) provide – the faucet swivels – if you want to direct the water anywhere from either side of your sink, to the center of the sink, this will do it. Why would you want this? There are times when you might get things on a side of the sink, and not want to put your hands into the sink to move it – think toothpaste, for example. This faucet takes care of that right away.
Temperature settings limit how hot the water will become – you don’t have to worry about getting burned by hot water when you use this faucet.
The faucet has a feature that is disappearing from many made by other manufacturers – a pop-up that can be controlled by a lever on the faucet, instead of a pop-up that you must press to open or close. I prefer being able to open and close the pop-up using a lever, rather than putting my hand into hot, soapy water to open the pop-up.
In addition to having great features, the chrome finish on this faucet is probably the best that I’ve seen on plumbing fixtures.
It’s expensive. It’s got a style that you either can’t use – or you can. It can cost you a LOT of money – because you may want to upgrade your vanity or the rest of your bathroom to do this faucet justice.

I'm deducting a star because the installation instructions are too generic, covering many of Grohe's faucet models, and providing little specific guidance for THIS faucet. I've installed many faucets, so this wasn't a major problem, but I can see how it can provide a challenge for a person with little experience installing faucets.

Excellent performance!

This family of Grohe “Starlight” fixtures is distinguished by a Grohe proprietary chrome plating process providing a best in class appearance with extraordinary scratch resistance. The internal solid brass and occasional peripheral high impact or composite support seem the same across the full product range. The Grohe ceramic cartridge moving-part is the best in class from my perspective.

Grohe “SilkMove” delivers a best in class water temperature mix across water volumes. It is a premium mixer available in top faucets from Grohe.

I install a lot of plumbing fixtures across the range of product prices. It’s a no brainer distinguishing among low-cost, quality, and premium fixtures. There does exist a category of very expensive super-premium that I infrequently install. Super-premium is twice to three times more costly than Grohe. Unless it’s a specific external appearance you want to pay super-premium for, the super-premium’s have the same premium innards as the Grohe.

Grohe has been a consistently premium fixture in the quantities I’ve installed. Once installed, Grohe doesn’t fail to achieve appearance, fit, and function, and for years. I have had to replace the Grohe ceramic cartridge in homes that have super hard water. On installation, I do advise the client that the ceramic cartridge is subject to future replacement due to hard water calcification. Calcification is the destroyer of plumbing fixtures inside and out. A house full of 5-year-old calcified, crusty fixtures costs a whole lot more to maintain and replace than the upfront cost of home water conditioning.

I can't speak to the step by step instructions some have cited as a problem. The dimensional data I need is spot on. Some Grohe's are new to the US market and this might be one where the translation from German might be improved and I'm only guessing.

My bathroom sink had been there for like 25 years. Still worked, but looking at it each day consciously reminded me that I should replace it. I finally got that chance when I was able to review this. I know my comparison chart is only one, but what I can vouch for is the great quality of Grohe faucets, and specifically this one.

First of all, I got the shiny chrome-like finish, which was what my old faucet was. I didn't have a choice, but if you do, I would recommend you to get the brushed nickel finish if you don't like wiping down your faucet daily because you hate water spots. The shine looks great, until it doesn't, which will last you about a week at most if you're like me and love to splash water everywhere when you wash your hands and face. But nonetheless, the chrome version looks good when it's clean.

I didn't want to touch installing it with a ten food pole, as I'm all thumbs when it comes to plumbing, so I had a professional friend did it for me. Hopefully you are less useless as I am and can do it within an hour, as it took the pro about 40 minutes to do mine. I couldn't see what he was doing really, as he had to lie on his back and really dig in there underneath the sink cabinet. Lord knows I can even see what's what and where's where, let alone know what to do with anything. However, once done, it works like a charm. The knob controls both the hot and cold water, and it's easy to turn and use - the mechanism is smooth and easy. The faucet raises about 7.5" off the countertop, and provides almost 7" of clearance room, so it you feel very comfortable using it and not have to worry about not having enough space to wash your hands or other things that you can fit under it. My old faucet kind of just juts out like a bridge, so the clearance room was very low and it was a bit annoying using it. Finally, the fit and finish is top-notch. It looks and feels like a luxury, premium faucet through and through. Grohe has an excellent reputation for their faucets, and this one is no exception.

I know this is not a cheap faucet. My old one probably cost $50, so I can't really compare the two. But if you have the budget for it, you will not be disappointed. If my old one lasted 25 years, this one should outlive me.

We used this faucet, along with a new bar sink, as part of the addition to our wet bar/beverage center.

The styling looks really good, and the low profile works well where you are swinging glasses and bottles. It has been installed for over two years, and has worked flawlessly with not a drip in sight.

The finish has held up well, and it is easy to keep clean.  It still looks as good as the day we unpacked it from the box.

We had it professionally installed as part of the construction, and while our plumber is not a Grohe fan (always a hassle somehow or other), it went it without any drama.

A great product.

product_title: Moen 8227 Commercial M Dura Widespread Kitchen Faucet 2 2 gpm Chrome
product_description: M DURA faucets feature solid cast brass construction M DURA faucets feature solid cast brass construction vandal resistant torque screw to discourage tampering meets current legislation including ab1953 California and s152 Vermont

reviews.review_body: The quality of manufacture is high, great chrome finish.  Installation took several hours but instructions were clear.  I was able to use the handles from my previous faucet (like the design better) - the action of the valves is very smooth with just the right amount of resistance.  Am quite pleased and would look to use other m-dura products in the future.
These are really good heavy duty faucets!! Amazing price!! I got two for my 2 sinks in the kitchen. I like the curve design for greater ease of use when washing larger pots and pans.

I bought this faucet in March 2013.  For the first year, it worked great...no complaint and I would highly recommended at that time.  After the first year, I began to experience some minor problems such as the spout loosened and the water dripped very fast (I didn't measure the rate) and another minor problem that I can't describe.  My husband tightened the spout and the drips stopped plus he resolved the other problem for me.  The problems were insignificant and I would still recommend it.  We are going into our 4th year with the faucet and I am very unsatisfied with the faucet.  Here are the problems I have been experiencing since August, every time I turned on the hot water handle half way, the whole faucet shakes violently.  I can feel the vibration when my stomach touches the counter in front of the sink.  In the last two weeks, the shaking doesn't occur every time I turn on the hot water handle.  However, on several occasions, the hot water drips even when I turned it to the max.

My husband diagnosed the problem and said something is wrong on the hot water side.  Unfortunately, I can't remember exactly what he told me.  To get it fixed, we would have to get a plumber out.  Unless, the situation is critical I don't like to call people out because I don't like strangers in the house.  He said he can change the faucet so now I am looking into a new faucet.  The specialist in a home improvement store recommended me to call Moen first to see if the company try to make it right by us.  Will try to update later.

The list of things wrong with this faucet and Moen is long.  First two parts that were supposed to be included were left out intentionally by Moen.  The instructions show how these parts are to be used.  I contacted Moen support.  They told me they no longer include these parts.  My faucet was packed with outdated instructions.  Installing the faucet without these parts left the spout wobbling on its base.  The set screw that is supposed to fasten the base is poorly made and strips easily.  The plumber did his best, but with incorrect instructions and a product that was indifferently packaged by Moen, he did not stand a chance.  DO NOT BUY FROM MOEN!  They do not live up to their reputation.

February 28, 2017 update.  If I could give this faucet a rating below one star, I would.  Now, after only a little more than a year installed, the hot water valve leaks.

I love how substantial this faucet is while still being a looker. The handles turn in a direction opposite to what I am accustomed and it took some brainpower for the first week not to fight it, but now my muscle memory is in place and I couldn't be more pleased with the product.

After 22 years installed our old kitchen faucet gave up the ghost.  It had been a really good faucet and had many features we liked, so I had hoped that it had remained in production for all of those years, but it hadn't, and I'm glad.  This new one is considerably better.

One of the challenges with something being in place for 22 years is that it doesn't often come out the way that it went in, as demonstrated in the second picture.  It's never a good day in plumbing when a hacksaw is required, but required (and effective) it was, but any hope of repairing the old faucet was squarely out the window at this point in time.

One of the features we really liked about the old faucet was the high arc of the spout, and the ability to swivel between the two basins in the sink we have, so any new faucet needed to have those same features.  It also needed to be a 3 hole installation.  I added a Water Nymph sprayer in place of the stock aerator to add some flexibility in directing the spray, I'll review it separately.

Another thing that 22 years allows for is for things to improve, and in today's world I know that's not always true.  For the most part products I buy for our house are either outrageously expensive to match the quality of the rest of the house, or just cheap (and not in the good way).

This Moen Faucet surprised me with its amazing high quality, (see all brass fittings in the third picture) and its fair price.  The improvement over the old faucet comes in terms of user serviceability, all of the parts for this are available separately, so if something goes wrong I can fix it, and installation.  The old faucet was a complex installation with several hoses and fittings running under the counter from each of the individual pieces (the two valves and the spout) to make them all work together.

This faucet has a solid brass valve body, adjoined with an undersink "bridge" made from copper,  with all of the items at the correct spacing.  The bridge was slightly bent when I opened the package, but the soft copper was easy to realign so that everything fit perfectly.

With the helping hands of my 13 year old son only needed to get the valves installed to the countertop, the installation was smooth and easy, and the result fantastic.

I really like the tactile feel of a good valve operating properly, and this faucet has that in spades.  The valves provide the right resistance to feel subsatantial, but don't bind.  The same is true with the spout swivel.  Smooth and well engineered.

The faucet flows a good amount of water, making it useful in the kitchen, and it looks great.  It is highly recommended.

product_title: American Standard 7385000 295 Reliant 3 1 Handle 4 Inch Centerset Bathroom Faucet 1 2 GPM Brushed Nickel
product_description: ORGANIC DESIGN Soft curves complement casual bathrooms DRIP FREE FOR LIFE Ceramic disc valve for precise control EASY INSTALLATION Speed Connect pop up drain installs quickly FEWER INSTALL PARTS Exclusive Speed Connect pop up drain requires fewer parts and installs in less time WATER TEMPERATURE SAFETY Prevent accidental scalding with adjustable hot limit safety stop WATER EFFICIENT EPA WaterSense certified with 1 2 gpm 4 5 L min maximum flow rate to save water without sacrificing performance SUPPORTS SUSTAINABILITY CEC Listed and CALGreen Compliant ADA COMPLIANT For ease of use

reviews.review_body: Good product

Surprised at how heavy it is compared to the one I replaced.  Removing the old faucet took some time but installing this new one was very easy.

The only downside is that now the vanity and sink look pretty sad and I'll have to replace them.
looks and works just what i wanted
Am satisfied with my order
Almost perfect, but missing nuts to fasten in place.
It was very well made, but to big and bulky for my vanity sink. Sent it back.
Was able to install to replace existing faucet.  Came with supply lines.  Only qualm is the base is a little small.  Didn't cover same area as previous faucet.
Excelente producto por el precio lo volvería a comprar

The positive reviews on Amazon's website led me to select this faucet, which I had installed by a plumber. We're quite happy with its appearance and performance. I attached a Pur filter (tap water here is unpalatable) which does not interfere with the faucet's performance.
replaced old american standard faucet  works fine
Very easy to install.  I am just an average home handyman and had no trouble . Works smoothly.

Good build quality, smooth handling, and nice looking. I was originally planning to install it myself. Due to difficulty to remove the old one, I ended up to hire a Plummer to complete the installation. It was finished nicely. If feels very durable. I will not hesitate to recommend it to anyone!

Really excellent....especially since I needed healing after putting up with a substandard Home Depot faucet for many years. Even my husband loves it, which is a minor miracle if I choose the appliance.

I bought this to install at my dad's bathroom. Very nice faucet, much better than I thought for only $65. The mechanism is very smooth. It feels solid, smooth, and not cheaply made at all. I highly recommend.

I need to leave very positive feedback for this product. Extremely easy to install and a high quality product. The pop-up cable design is amazing as well with an extremely easy install.  Loved the very grip-able faucet lock nuts.
Very easy installation, even the popup. All Installed in an hour. Works well. Time will tell how long.
dislike the washer, instead use plumbers putty

It's really hard to go to the local big box store and buy really great quality products. This faucet replaces an Asian made one that came from that big box. The superior quality is obvious from the get go. Easy straight foreword install and just so much better than what is available locally. I love my faucet.
nice faucet, easy install.  Not the best, but, with our hard water, I expect it will last as long as our expensive imported faucets, which seems to be right at 20 years.
Works fine, looks fine for the price. Easy to install (relatively) and I am not good at this stuff. I would buy again, in fact I am going to buy another one for the next sink over.

Very noisy and tall.  I never really thought of the noise level of a faucet but when the water is running, it seems very loud.  Also it seems to  always have water spots on it and I'm constantly wiping it clean.  (Installed a different brand last year in another bathroom and didn't have any of these complaints.)
Great looking very well made. And it works great

I've purchased many of these in Satin Nickel and Chrome finishes.  They are a high quality faucet and have a nice 'feel' to them.
the pop up drain cable system is a snap to install.  I've seen other brands of faucets at higher prices, but would still reccommend this faucet and continue to recommend them to my clients for my bath remodel projects.
The quality is very good but gave a four star because of very limited water flow rate.
No dislikes.

I replaced an old Delta faucet which lasted about 14 yrs. I wanted something more durable so I purchased this item. The faucet's finish looks very good and it does have some heft to it. My only complaint is that it is made in Mexico.

Excellent value, a quality product well made. This faucet was delivered quickly as you would expect from Amazon. Installation was very easy. If you have installed faucets before, this will be your easiest one. If you are on the buy or not fence, buy. Every once in awhile you get more than you paid for. This is it.

I WOULD NORMALLY BUY DELTA, UNTIL I CAME ACROSS THIS AMERICAN STANDARD. DELTA IS A VERY GOOD BRAND WITH GOOD QUALITY, BUT SO FAR THIS FAUCET HAS GREAT QUALITY AND AN EXCELLENT PRICE, VERY EASY TO INSTALL, AND THE CABLE OPERATED STOPPER IS THE BEST, MUCH BETTER THAN THE STOPPERS THAT USE LINKAGE TO CONTROL IT.
Easy to install and it looks great. Plus, it works.
We have installed several of these faucets in a private school facility over the past couple years. No problems whatsoever.

Product arrived on time.  The installation was easily accomplished by the plumber.  The instructions were clear in what to disassemble to
fit the drain cable through the small middle hole of a three hole installation.  Opening and closing the drain is very smooth and efficient.

I bought this faucet partially because it advertises that it includes the required hoses. That sounds like a great selling point until you find out that they're only included because they are built-in to the cartridge. So, if (like me) you receive one of these with a damaged hose, you can't simply use a different hose. You'll need to swap the entire cartridge, which entails disassembling the whole faucet. And if (like me) your cartridge is installed with stripped screws, you probably won't be able to unscrew said cartridge and (like me), you'll probably end up throwing this in the trash. This was a huge shame, because the design of the drain is absolutely ingenious. I guess you get what you pay for, and there's a reason this is one of the cheapest faucets you can find.

it seems to be well made and nice fast shipping price reasonable but the handle is to pointed needs be little rounder and bit longer. kind of annoying.my fault although should looked at it before husband purchased.

Faucet arrived quickly and is as described at a good price. I would just point out that this version of Satin Nickel has a yellowish tone and needs a bit of upkeep to keep it looking good. If you can do with shiny chrome, I would recommend that finish instead

Works well, installs quickly.
Complaints:
  1. Very large for most bathroom sinks ... this should have been clearly stated in amazon description.
  2. Should have come with a gasket for between sink and faucet.  Instructions are silent on this problem.
Looks beautiful with our double sink vanity! Works as a faucet should, install was quick, directions were clear. Great price from Amazon warehouse!

Quality METAL faucet and drain - no plastic! I love the easy hook up braided water supply lines and the innovative pop up cable - a vast improvement on the stupid old pop up rod. I suspect the complaints about the cable pop are due to not reading the instructions. The assembly must be point to the rear for it to work properly. Works great and looks beautiful

I can't believe how easy this faucet was to install. What a great experience.  It seems that a lot of manufacturers try to get cute with their engineering and end up making it a total hassle for the end user/installer.  A.S. got it right with this one.  Great value for the money, works great, easy installation, what's not to love?
EXCELLENT ITEM WITH THE EXCEPTION OF INSTALLATION  LOCATION AND MY AGE. HAD TO MAKE A MODIFICATION BECAUSE OF MY TANK LESS WATER HEATER RECIRC SYSTEM, BUT ALL IN ALL A GREAT FAUCET.

One day, we'll replace the trap but these components came so precisely machined that the super managed the connection, just by applying a gentle touch.  Your gasket was superior to putty, to his surprise.  Congrats, because he used Delta.

It's hefty, but only because we have a small bathroom.  I wanted curves and look at the confounding shape:  functional art.

I'm not one to gush over a bathroom faucet, but I had an 18 year old Delta that was dripping constantly. I read excellent reviews for this and decided to go for it. Well, I don't regret it a bit. Easy to install, love the bicycle-type mechansim to lift and lower the drain, love the big handle, and love the look. If you like this style, you can't go wrong.

My only problem with this is that the supply lines come from the center, not from under the 4 inch spaced holes the way every other faucet set I've bought is.  Our sinks are older, and the sink center hole is only large enough for the sink stopper mechanism, not for these supply lines.  So I can't use them where I bought them for.  They're probably good, but haven't been able to use them....

Everything about this faucet is excellent. Easy to install (once the 25-year-old broken faucet was removed), comes with pop-up drain replacement much better than old one (all metal instead of mostly plastic). If you have older permanently attached metal lines from the water values, you'll want to replace the old valves with something like "SharkBite 23036-0000LF Angle Stops and Fixture Supply Fittings, 1/2-Inch by 3/8-Inch" which are also simple and easy to install.

Great value and quality. Not plastic junk and easy to install. Love the easy drain installation and the manner in which it works.
 Also like the modern design.

A couple months ago, I replaced a similar entry level faucet that had a cartridge so frozen a puller wouldn't remove it; it just wasn't worth saving. This faucet and an online DIY video easily saved me a few hundred dollars. Installation was a breeze. Everything works. No leaks.
Video Player is loading.
A beautiful faucet. Smooth operation, quiet. It was an easy installation after a tough removal of the old faucet. I don't expect to have to replace this one for a long time. Quality product.

This faucet feels and works very nice.  I had to change my Delta faucets, in our bathroom, that would not shut off.  I have had them for over 10 years and about 1/2 of the time they leaked.  These were easy to install, and feel like a much higher quality faucet than I had before.  Of course there is a plastic piece on the underside of this faucet, but you really don't notice it.  The chrome is very nice.

This is a very nice faucet and very easy to install.  The hardest part was removing the old faucet and drain... I needed a hacksaw to get the drain pipe out since there was so much corrosion.  However, after that it only took a few minutes to pop in the new faucet, connect to the hot and cold supply and install the drain.  Instructions were very clear and easy to follow.  I have a second faucet which I'll install tonite.  Highly recommended.

I specifically wanted a single handle bath fauset in brushed nickle.  It has now been installed for two weeks and we are very pleased at the way it looks and performs.  Although we had a handyman install it for us he said that it was an easy install.  We would purchase another one for a different bath if necessary.  Good price, fast delivery, good looking, operates well - what more could you ask for.  Amazon is good to do business with.

This is a solid faucet!  I usually buy the peerless brand that's cheaper. You can definitely tell the difference between the two faucets. This one is well put together. The knob moves easily and the parts are much better. It also comes with the water lines. I absolutely love the drain assembly. It's metal (not plastic) and you can unscrew it into 2 parts so that you can easily install it into a pre-existing sink.

I ordered this faucet this morning and it arrived at 5:30 today on a Sunday!
This was one of the easiest home projects I have done, the hardest part was taking out the old one.
Faucet is so much better than the Moen it replaced. The stream of water comes out further into the bowl
so it's easier to wash your hands. It looks great and has a super smooth handle action, great buy!

This faucet is elegant and was easy to install.  The only suggestion I have for persons installing this faucet is to have some plumbers putty on hand.  The foam "washer' that comes with the faucet drain did not seal the water in my sink.  I added some plumbers putty to fix the problem. I was replacing an older faucet so it took several hours to remove the old plumbing but installing this faucet only took about half an hour once the old plumbing was removed. I highly recommend this American Standard faucet.

This is a nice, solid fixture. The handle moves smoothly and feels solid.  It was very easy to install. We bought this from Amazon to replace an old American Standard faucet that we'd had for probably 18 years, and which was finally starting to "go."  This one actually feels like a higher quality unit than the old one, which we had purchased at Home Depot all those years ago.  I am thinking of purchasing a second one to replace the faucet in our other bathroom, just to have the same quality there.
