I really like this! It has innovative pop up system that is cable rather than the old "bar-on-a-round-piece-attached-to-a-bar". My only complaint is the handle has a indentation running down the center that collects water and then water deposits. I'm slowly putting these in rental properties as needed.

This faucet is an excellent replacement for the cheap, 2-handle faucet that originally came with our RV. The faucet was easy to install. I especially like the fact the Speed Connect drain comes with gaskets so you don't need messy plumber's putty. The reach of the spout is also a little longer than many faucets I looked at so you don't slop water on top of the sink at the base of the faucet when you're washing your hands.

This faucet not only looks good but is very easy to install. Hoses & drain assembly come with it.  Probably the easiest faucets I have ever installed.  I now have three of them. Not a cheap plastic piece of junk, well worth the money.

It took me less than 30 minutes to install, and I have very limited plumbing experience ( close to zero). The drain pop up mechanism works like a charm and it was much easier to install it than to take the old one apart. I am a little concerned how it will last since the parts in the drain mechanism look a bit delicate. The faucet itself, on other hand, can be used as a murder weapon - very solid and substantial. Maybe even too substantial - the handle especially.  In terms on operation - the faucet is absolutely perfect.

Bought this as a replacement for an older American Standard faucet that corroded through. The design of this is different then the older model, the flexible tubes are pre attached and are not replaceable. Hope it last longer then the last one did.

I’ve used this for a few months now and my two complaints are that the flow of water isn’t as strong as I like and it needs a lot of cleaning because water pools on the handle. Aside from that, it works fine and looks nice.

The first faucet had a small leak in one of the supply hoses pre-attached to the faucet body.  After spending a lot of time diagnosing this and wasting more time on hold with American Standard 'Customer Service' I hung up and requested a replacement from Amazon.  It arrived in two days and works fine.  If the first one had no leak or American Standard had picked up the phone perhaps I'd have bumped this to four stars.

A very well established company which was the reason we bought this brand.  We however had a leak and found out from the plumber after second time that a couple of handle collar pieces were not included in the box.

I installed 3 out of 5 so far.  The hardest part was removing the 25 year old faucets and installing new shutoff valves. The American Standard faucets then installed very easily and work just as expected.  The included instructions were quite sufficient.  I seleced this model because it has "lifetime" ceramic cartridges. I will post another review in 20 years or so, sooner if they show signs of failure.  At some point we will be installing new sinks and will get to see just how easy these faucets are to remove and re-install.  For now we are very happy.

I bought this as a warehouse deal return for $43 and at that price it's unbeatable value, but I have to judge it at the $70 price point. At that price it's an acceptable value and still a very high quality piece with great finish and fantastic ease of installation.

My husband installed this. It was to replace a horribly difficult to put in previous faucet and stopper. he was done replacing it with this one in maybe 20 minutes. No cussing. He basically said from now on when we chose sink fittings we go with this brand. Done. It looks great too.

- Review for Chrome model -

GOOD:
- Better looking than your cheap standard faucet
- High quality components and connectors
- Faucet handle moves nicely

BAD:
- The handle is bulkier than it needs to be and could be slimmer
- The little valley on top of

Faucet has good instructions and could not be much easier to install.

I used it with

I bought this because of the reputation of the manufacturer.  I also thought that the pop up stopper control looked like it would be easier to deal with than the lever system on most pop ups.  This was a BIG MISTAKE.  After I got the faucet and drain installed, as soon as I attempted to hook up the pop up stopper the mechanism fell apart in to several tiny pieces.  It took me half an hour to figure out how to get all the pieces together in the proper sequence.  A VERY FRUSTRATING EXPERIENCE.  Even afer I managed to get it to work the stopper does not pop up sufficiently to allow maximum water flow.  Also the stopper mechanism that is attached to the drain is on there very tentatively and I'm sure it is only a matter of time before it falls off or gets knocked off by someone rummaging for something stored under the sink.  The threads on the mechanism are cheap plastic and do not hold well to the attaching point.  I was also not impressed with the build quality of this faucet.  It looks nice from above, but the supply hoses were very small in diameter and were almost impossible to keep from kinking when tightening the connecting nuts.  I'm not a plumber but I've installed many faucets before in kitchens and bathrooms and consider myself a fairly proficient DIY person.  Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY from this product.

The quality and design is great and very good and worth 5 star.  However, I only give it 3 is because the installation is not accurate.  I found small leaking from countertop after installed.  I had to put silicon on the faucet panel to avoid leaking.  The instruction did not mention to put silicon.  I check the installation guide of other brand of faucets like Delta and they instructed to put silicon on the countertop panel.  One more thing to mention is the pop-up design is great and very easy to install.

This faucet is very nice looking and is quite heavy compared to my old Moen faucet.  The chrome is nice and I like the single lever.  It was very easy to install. My biggest problem was getting the old drain pipe out of the sink!

Note - the compression hoses are 16" long, so if your water supply lines are farther away than that, you'll have to buy extra compression hoses and couplers to connect the two (approx. $8-$10).

Love the design of the drain plug connector.

This faucet has rounded corners (my old faucet was more rectangular), so I can see a little bit of discoloration on the vanity top where the corners used to be.  Not a big deal, though.

First product shipped had bad finish but Amazon shipped a replacement right away.  Second one had good finish but it was missing some parts - called American Standard and they shipped right away.  The drain piece was then leaky so it was another call to American Standard.  We've bought American Standard before and found their customer support to be excellent.  Most importantly, their faucets are so easy to install.  This is still true although it took us several steps to get there this time but both Amazon and American Standard provided great customer service during the process.

Buy this faucet as soon as you can. This high of quality for this price, it doesn't get much better. It's sturdy and has a good weight to it. the cable that connect the pull to the stopper great. You barely have to pull it and push it to release the stopper. Installation was easy. The water supply lines are long and are factory connected to the faucet. I've installed cheap and I've installed quality and the quality is worth the extra money. But this is only a little more money than contractor grade cheap faucets. I'm tempted to buy more while they're available and replace faucets i don't even use that often.

This faucet is a great value. It looks and feels high quality, and it's very easy to install. No putty, silicone, or Teflon tape needed. The attached supply lines are flexible and of ample length. The pop-up drain assembly is of chrome plated metal, and its cable operated mechanism couldn't be simpler to install. Just a couple of turns of a threaded connector and you're done. The only tools I used for the entire installation were an adjustable wrench for the supply line connections and channel lock pliers for the drain nut. I followed the clearly laid out instructions and had no leaks or other issues. The faucet looks great and works smoothly.

Getting the old faucet off was the hardest part of installing this faucet. Once that was done this faucet took less than 10 minutes to install. It doesn't get any better than that. Instructions were great and American Standard has a video on You Tube showing you how to install this faucet if you'd prefer a visual aid. All the parts you need come with this. It looks outstanding. No leaks once hooked up. So simple even a caveman could do it. It doesn't get any easier. Great product! Leave it to American Standard. They have never let me down!

It nice.. you can tell it's high quality.  Mounts to the sink flush and the plastic gasket keeps water form getting in there.  The drain pop-up is an interesting, compact and functional design.  The gasket for the drain in nice too.. no putty.
The only negatives..that indent on top holds water, and the finish picks up water stains quickly.
You will need to wipe it down CLR more often.  I would buy it again tho.

This faucet was fantastic to install. Auper clean and easy. Was considerably more work removing the older one fhan it was installing this. Plus it looks nice. For the price this is an excellent value as I would've expected to spend way more for a bathroom faucet. The adjustment features make it easy to customize as well. Overall, would buy this again and recommend to a friend. I will update this review in a few months if it changes.

This is a beautiful piece of chromed hardware.  The beauty even extends to the replacement drain tube.  It is chromed, seems to be a heavier gauge metal than the Delta unit it replaced and has a stopper mechanism that is so much simpler to install than traditional units--no adjustment is required  The preinstalled supplied lines are plenty long for most installations and may save you $12 to $16.  The standard 7/16 or 1/2 inch nuts used to mount a faucet are replaced with large plastic/steel mounting nuts that are finger tightened instead of having to fight to use a small wrench or extra long socket while you are lying inside the cabinet on your back.  This is a well engineered, great value.

I ordered this to replace an American Standard single lever bathroom faucet that was almost 40 years old and still working good except the handle broke and I couldn't find a replacement.  Since I got 40 years of service from that American Standard, I should try them again.  The Reliant Faucet is an attractive faucet, quality made and easy to install.  I particularly like the cable operated stopper control that is part of this package.  Very easy to install and works great.  I would have given a five star rating except the chrome plating on the handle has a small blemish which should have been caught by quality control before the item was shipped.

I purchased this as a Gold Box special for $88 making the price outstanding. The faucet is well made and gives our bathroom a modern look. I have installed many faucets and this one was very easy to install. Took less than 1 hour to remove the old faucet and install this one. I appreciated that you can install the faucet without the need for plumber's putty. Some people don't like the quick connect for the pop-up but I find it much easier to install than the traditional pop-up which requires you to get underneath the sink and try to attach the pull to the drain. This system is much easier but you do have to be careful not to disturb the connection on the tail piece or it might come apart. Installed easily without leaks around the water supply or the drain. A great value for an Amercan Standard faucet.

The second worst part of installing a faucet is that trip rod for the drain.  Too high?  Too low?  This new system is amazing.  No more rods to bend, adjust, try, adjust, try, adjust.  Screw the cable into the drain mechanics and done!  Thanks American Standard.  You Guy are the best.  Still loving my three AS Champion 4 tb’s. Cant beat the Champ!

Pretty easy install. It does come with the popup drain, and the attachment for that is the easiest of it's type that I have ever done so that was a huge plus. Visual improvement over the early 90s model with missing/broken popup that I replaced. You have to remove your P trap to install the drain/popup. I broke the galvanized pipe of the old p trap (it corroded almost all the way through and I finished the job during the install) and had to make a hardware store run anyway for a new P-trap (I bought plastic). So maybe look at your P trap at the time of purchase and if it is looking old and corroded plan to replace it at the same time too. I'm sure Amazon sells those as well. ;-) I had a 1.25" OD P trap.

I couldn't be happier with these faucets.  I replaced the older builder grade Moen junk faucet (twist temp, pull valve type) in our foyer with one of them to test it out and see if I liked it.  This faucet went on faster than any other faucet I've done.

The body feels solid, the action on the faucet handle is smooth, the aerator is easy to remove.  Honestly, the hardest part about the whole install isn't even the install.  It's getting the old stuff off.

The drain pop-up uses a cable, instead of a bar linkage, which is what makes the install so fast.  It's literally a quarter turn into the drain body and, boom, it's installed.

We liked the first one so much, I replaced the rest of them in the house for less money than one of the "designer" brands in the local big box store.

The one thing I didn't know is some faucets are built for sinks with overflows and most sinks today do not have over flows.  Had to buy new down pipes to close the overflow hole.  If the write up had said anything about an overflow I would have asked more questions.

Easy DIY - NO!  I very much like the chrome faucet part but the instructions and water feed lines compression fittings seem faulty.  The feed lines are permanently attached to faucet base and they leak.  Had to buy two!  At $54 each = $108 , contracted a plumber  ($253  yeah, pretty reasonable, considering) who told me I had to get a second new faucet due to the feed lines and the hot water line of the second faucet still leaks!  Instructions do not say to use plumbers putty - was necessary on drain pipe (plumber solved this problem).  Also, the instructions do not  specify tightening instructions on the feed lines which require gentle tightening or they surely WILL leak.  I'm not new to DIY and respect instructions whether familiar with the project or not so I know it's not me.  So far I've spent $361 and the hot water line of the second faucet still leaks.  Returned the first faucet, reimbursed $54 so tally is now $307.  I'm attempting to fix the remaining leak on the hot water feed line but may have to return this one, too.  So disappointed in American Standard!

This is not the cheapest bathroom faucet. But it has the quality of higher end models. I know; I've bought expensive faucets that did not hold up over time. You tend to have faucets for at least 5-10 years. So, to spend another $40 is very little in the grand scheme of things.

It is so beautiful, sturdy, and easy to clean. I replaced two-handle faucets for this single handle model. The old faucets were attractive, but impossible to keep clean. To get in between the faucet and the spout was a pain in the butt -- and 5 minutes later it looked dirty again. This faucet is a quick wipe-down and done! (As an aside, I highly recommend Brasso brand cleaner for nearly any metal surface in your house. Great for stainless steel appliances.)

This is American Standard; a classic brand that I trust.

I strongly recommend this particular faucet. I will now consider American Standard's other products for my home and investment properties.

I almost love this faucet...It is really good quality made of all (heavy) metal with a very nice chrome finish. The handle works well with an easy turn mechanism. The water flow is good and the drain is also good quality with a rubber sealed drain stopper. It really looks great!

What isn't so great is it comes with a plastic (should be rubber or with rubber) base plate. For the price and quality of this faucet, plumbers putty should not be needed to seal the base. Okay, I used a little plumbers putty and all is good. FYI: Moen faucets (which I also have) come with a rubber sealed base plate. Also it is a bit larger than it appears in the pictures so make sure you have enough room (counter/back-splash clearance) for your installation.

Overall, this is a really nice faucet with a lifetime warranty.

Note: If your drain installation is not correctly aligned (must be straight up & down), your drain stopper may not seal properly.

The good and bad points of my non-American made American Standard faucet.

My favorite thing about this faucet is that it comes with steel braided hoses instead of pipes that you need to bend or cut, or just fittings where you need to provide your own hoses.  This is a great feature, as in most cases, you wont need to do any messing around cutting supply hoses or make additional trips to the hardware store.

Another comment is just about the American Standard brand in general.  I tend to have better luck with American Standard than other big brands such as Moen.

What I don't like is that "fancy" pop up valve design, and you can't convert it to a regular style either, as the hole in the faucet will not line up.  This affected me because I needed to use a "non-overflow" drain instead of the overflow style drain that came with the faucet, and now I am stuck without a pop-up.  I didn't bother to return, as I don't really use a pop-up that much anyway, and just wanted to get the 1/2 bath project over with.

Two more annoyances, and then I will pipe down.  The flat style handle is not as easy to grab to turn on quick as the faucet in my other bathroom, which sports the traditional style handle.  There's that, and this faucet seems to really show the water spots fast and obvious.  After a couple days use, this faucet is really ready for a wipe-down...

Great purchase. Here are the pros: customer service that actually helps, excellent instructions and (almost) all the parts needs for the job. The cons: you'll probably need a new drain pipe extender (not included) and instructions/parts on how to install if the center sink hole is too small. The second con happened to me. My fifty year old American Standard sink has three holes, but the middle one is 1/2 inch in diameter. Each water line is 3/8 inch and the drain cable is about a quarter inch; they can't all fit through that small hole. Here is how I installed this unit. (1) remove the drain cable from the faucet. Note that it is reverse threaded! (Thank you customer service). (2) Put this cable through the small center hole and reattach. (3) Put each water line through it's corresponding (large) hole and mount the faucet. (4) To secure the faucet with the wing nuts, get the largest PVC coupler  that when cut length wise will fit under your sink (my clearance was 2 inches; I just used some 1 1/2 PVC pipe I had laying around). (5) Drill a 3/8 inch hole in the split coupler and install on the threaded rods in the faucet allowing for the water lines to pass underneath. (6) Tighten using the wing nuts.
Liked everything, nothing to dislike!

I am giving this a five star rating because I think that the product deserves it but it just didn't fit my application. I live in a 10 year old mobile home and one of the faucets started leaking so I placed an order with Amazon along with the optional installation from a local Amazon approved installer as an additional charge.  The water supply lines for this faucet are permanently attached by the manufacturer and are not removable. The fittings on the ends will fit a standard water supply line but the ones in a mobile home are a different size so cannot be connected.  The installer was not able to complete the installation with this faucet so, with my approval,  he went to a local hardware store and bought a faucet that he was able to attach using the original supply lines. I had to pay an additional; charge of $75 for labor to complete the installation. I have returned the unused faucet to Amazon. Adapters for the supply line are available but the hardware store didn't have any.  They might be available from a store that has RV supplies.

A further note:  The Amazon referred installer's charge was $98.95 plus an additional $75 labor for the extra time it took to install the faucet from the hardware store.  I previously bought a faucet from Amazon and had a local handyman install it.  His labor charge was $100 and he furnished the required adapters at no charge. So this installation cost me more than it would have if I had used the handyman again. Lesson learned !  I

A decent quality basic 4" spread faucet. I gave it 4 stars based on it's competition in the same entry level price range, not overall which would be a much lower score. It's of better quality than a Moen Chateau or any entry level Delta faucet. I'd rate this about as good as a Kohler Coralais. Having said that none of these top brand faucet bodies are made out of brass or even diecast metal but plastic as are all basic faucets. You have to spend more to get something that is even made out of low quality diecast(which disintegrates over time when exposed to water). If you want a brass(the best time proven material) body faucet then you'll be spending top dollar on the most expensive faucets these days. Unfortunately, only the internal water channels are made out of brass on cheaper faucets.
This faucet features a plastic body, diecast handle, brass water channel, plastic mounting nuts, and flexible hoses.
The best feature is obviously the braided stainless hoses. To put it in perspective, Delta uses very stiff and overly long solid plastic hoses on even their higher level faucets.
The weakest features are the plastic and diecast main parts and the poorly made mounting nuts. The nuts consist of a 1/4" regular steel small nut encased in round plastic. They do not allow to be tightened very well since you can't really put a basin wrench on them to get them secured sufficiently. The are made to hand tighten only.
Overall, it's better than most basic faucets under $100 but you're not getting anything to brag about here. If you want something to last for decades this isn't it. You'll have to spend $200 or more to get something that has a shot at lasting these days. Oil rubbed bronze, satin or polished nickel, etc will always cost significantly more for a real quality faucet.

I installed this faucet 6 months ago and the chrome finish still shines up well. The price is good, although I notice the Amazon price has increased since a March, 2020 when I bought it. The installation is easy because of the built-in water supply hoses (see comments below). The pressure washer secures the drain well without needing plumbers putty and the drain plug installation is simple (see comments).
Cons: if your water supply valves are on the floor like mine you’ll need extensions as others have mentioned. The pre-installed supply hoses will only reach if the supply valves come out of the wall. This was annoying because all they had to do was make them about 6 inches longer. So it took a trip to the hardware store to buy the supply hose extensions. Also the drain plug doesn’t always go down by pulling the handle. Sometimes  I have to push it down. It does come up though using the handle. The single handle works smoothly turning the water on and off, but stiff if turning from side to side to adjust hot/cold.
I still rated the faucet 4-star because it looks good and does the job pretty well for the price.

Some comments after 8 mos. use:
If you want to remove the stopper (to clean hair out of the drain) without having to remove the plunger assembly, install in the “unlocked” position. The “locked” position would be useful only if you don’t want your kids to pull out the stopper and shove a toy down the drain!

Bought the Satin Nickel version.  The satin finish is beautiful when brand new, but the water spots are prominent after first use.  For me the whole point of satin nickel was to reduce the visibility of water spots, compared to a chrome finish.  That's not the case, this satin finish spots easily and now people don't think it's a new faucet, after a couple of days of use.  Sure, I could wipe it down with a clean paper towel after each use, but I wanted something that would not spot as easily to begin with.  Other than that, it's a high quality product, very easy to install.  Larger and bulkier looking than I imagined, it probably won't go well with a small sink.  The underside of the arc is plastic, but all the other surfaces are metal.

Yes, it looks good and works great but just as important for someone who hates to do plumbing, but still wants to save money, this was the easiest install that I have ever done (I have replaced approx. 1/2 dozen over the years).  The flexible water lines were very convenient but the best feature was the unique "speed connect" drain.  There isn't any need to use plumbers putty to install the included drain body to the existing drain outlet because it has a foam gasket that works like it is supposed to.  The additional feature is the cable connector that allows you to hook up to the pop up drain so that I now have a sink stopper that actually works.  The pop up sink stopper was always a source of leaks for me so, to avoid the frustration in the past, I often did not connect the lift knob on the top of the faucet and resorted to operating the sink stopper manually. This meant I really didn't have a functional stopper if I wanted to fill the sink with water.  Thank you, American Standard!  I wish there had been a choice of brass or bronze finish but the brushed nickel is still attractive.  I will purchase another for my other sink.

We wanted a quality replacement for our 23-year-old leaky faucet.  This is very well built, solid and nice looking.  It was very easy to install, although I thought it needed a bit too much torque to keep the drain tailpiece from leaking.  We like this product so much, and were so impressed with it that we just ordered two more to replace the ones in the master bath.

and looks too big on my tiny vanity that's in a tiny bathroom. It's probably (personal taste here - don't be insulted!) one of the ugliest faucets I've ever purchased. I bought it because I love the speed connect drain/pop up and I have to have the nickel finish. I installed a  different style years ago in the house I moved out of and knew I wanted another one for this bathroom.  I wanted a single handle control knob and had a hard time finding a speed connect drain with a single handle.
I settled for this design and truly regret it. It's ugly. IMO
I intended to install this myself and had the entire old faucet out except for the final piece - the cold water supply line wouldn't budge so I had to call a plumber. Grrr.
Two young plumbers, who didn't bother to read the installation guide, installed the drain completely wrong and insisted the issue with the pop up not working was because of American Standard QC. ??
After they left, I looked at their install and the drain was installed so the pop up cable was on the right side instead of facing the rear of the sink. So I pulled out my wrench, loosened the drain, twisted it to where it was supposed to be - facing the rear - removed the cam cover and cam, turned the pop up to the "unlocked"  position, put the cam in turning completely clockwise until it couldn't turn anymore, reinstalled the cam cover and screwed the pop up cable on and low and behold!!! the pop up works PERFECTLY and I can remove it for cleaning. American Standard QC is just fine. It helps to read instructions! Swallow your pride and just read them. Seriously.
The faucet is heavy duty. All metal. And functions perfectly. I just don't like the style so I'm on the hunt for another single handle speed connect nickel finish faucet. It will be an easy swap since the drain is already installed.
I do think this has a more masculine feel with the chunky size and would look better in a man's/boy's bathroom or even a laundry room where only you see it.
It's great quality if you like the style.

Quality is nice.  We will install this in a spot different for which it was purchased.  I was going to use it with a small sink but the faucet is kind of tall.  Looks disproportionate for a small sink.  In person, the handle is taller than what the picture presents  it to be.  The quality looks good so it seems like a good product and feels substantial.  Comes with the drain and popup controlled with a newer style cable.  Never had one of these before so I hope it holds up as well as the lever type.  Got this installed and looks good. It is a big faucet compared to most others so I would consider the size if you are not installing in a large sink/vanity area.  Reading other reviews I would recommend only hand tightening the water line hook ups.  If that is not tight enough, quarter turns with a wrench, bit by bit to seal the fitting.  You don’t need much to tighten them.  Also, the tailpiece is 4”, I had to buy a 6” tube.  No biggie but check what you need.

The old faucet was looking very bad.  The finish was damaged.  This faucet was easy to install and there were no leaks.  The newer style supply tubes with the metal mess covering were the standard size and length connections for the stander bathroom supply turn off valves.  This was the easiest facet install I have ever done.  The color and finish was quite nice.  There was a seam on the underside of the water supply projection, but it was hardly noticeable.  In order to make a faucet like this at a price that is reasonable, there will be seams to install the parts the faucet is made from.  I like the ease of function this faucet provides.  You can tell  this faucet was made from metal not vinyl.  I have a sink that is not very deep from back to front, so I could not get an over sized faucet that would spray to fare out and would not look to large for the install.  Although this faucet is larger than the one it replaced, the soft lines and great design do not overpower the sink and is pleasing to look at.  The satin nickel finish and the flowing lines of the faucet make it very easy to clean.

I've purchased three of these now, to replace the old Kohler models in two different bathrooms.  I've installed a lot of faucets in my lifetime as a do-it-yourselfer, but this is one of the easier ones I've ever put in.  The pop-up drain attachment is really easy, especially compared to trying to install the typical type with lever and pull rod.  The mounting of the faucet itself, as well as the new drain/popup assembly into the sink bowl were very easy, and did not require putty or caulk.  I especially appreciated the long attached supply hoses that come with the faucet - worked perfectly for me, connecting directly to the supply valves.
Overall it's a solid unit that's easy to install and looks good.  A great value for the price.

This is an excellent faucet that is really easy to install. I bought 3 (satin nickel versions) to replace all the faucets in my bathrooms and they all went in without a hitch (well, except for me accidentally detaching one of the sinks from the countertop when I tried to remove the old faucet). The drain setup has to be the easiest thing ever. I was worried that it would leak since they said it didn't need any putty, but the foam "washer" and tightening it appropriately has led to zero leaks and quick installation. The stopper itself was also unexpectedly easy. There's no manipulating of the rod and screws to make sure everything lines up properly. You just screw in the adapter on the back and you're done.

The faucet looks great and when it gets a little dirty, I just splash some water up on it and wipe it down with my wet palm. I haven't seen an unexpected amount of water spots (we have extremely hard water and no room for a water softener), and any that do show up are easily washed down using the method I just mentioned. I never dry the faucet unless I'm doing an in-depth cleaning of the bathroom, but certainly not for normal use.

My only complaint with this faucet is it can be quite noisy when running at a lower pressure. If I only turn on the faucet half way, it has quite a whine in addition to the sound of the water coming out. Once I open it up all the way, the whine goes away. This happens on all 3 of these faucets, so I imagine it is something inherent in the product. However, this minor annoyance isn't enough for me to mark this down. If I had additional faucets in the house, I wouldn't hesitate to buy this again.

product_title: Kingston Brass KB8612NFL NuWave French 4 Centerset Bathroom Faucet Polished Brass
product_description: Heavy Duty Brass Construction 1 2 GPM 4 5 LPM Water Flow Rate at 60 PSI 1 4 Turn Washerless Cartridge Matching Accessories Available Standard 1 2 IPS Connection Includes matching finish pop up drain

reviews.review_body: Beautiful faucet. Well made. Easy to install. I liked it so much that I ordered two more faucets from Kingston Brass for my master bath, that are almost identical to this one, just the handle is slightly different. I love them all.

product_title: Moen 8554 Mpower Sensor Operated Single Mount Above Deck Lavatory High Arc Battery Powered Faucet Chrome 1 25
product_description: Touch free operation for improved hygiene Lever handle for temperature control and manual on off override Above deck battery and faucet mechanics for ease of access Adjustable sensor activation distance from 3 to 12 default 5 1 2 Vandal Mode 30 second time out feature Maintenance Cleaning Mode Allows for a 30 second deactivation for maintenance or cleaning Sentinel Flow Eliminates stagnant water supply lines every 24 hours factory setting off

reviews.review_body: This tap is not working. Water constantly runs and does not turn off. Tried to adjust, but useless Do not buy these taps.

Put this in my salon and the sensor malfunctioned after 6 months use. Called Moen for warranty support. The standard wait time for a call back according to their automated recording  is between 1 to 3 hours. It is actually longer since this is my third time calling and I have yet to receive a call back.

product_title: American Standard 738826 0070A
product_description: Replacement part Adapter seal assembly For use with the American Standard Champion 4 toilets With mounting screws

reviews.review_body: Correct fit but wasn't brass as shown in the picture. The piece that showed up resembled the correct shape but was made of some kind of plastic.

My toilet is leaking water between this seal and the ceramic part. You will not see the rubber gasket on the picture, you only see the top view.
I wanted to buy the rubber gasket only, called the American Standard customer service. They do not sell the rubber gasket only, you have to buy the entire assembly. It is a rip off as far as I am concerned. They should sell the rubber gasket and not the assembly.

This part is grossly overpriced. It is not brass as it looks, but rather plastic. I gave  it four stars because it does the job. A more reasonable price point for this thing would be probably $15-$25.
perfect fit

This item costs about $60.00. The only part of it I really needed was the rubber washer, which wasn't available separately. My guess is that washer would have only been about $5.00 if I could have bought it alone.
what can u say about a part that allows the toilet to flush  wqith out flooding the bathroom  it does its job

Well I agree with the other review.  It IS NOT as pictured!  It is a plastic part and not a solid brass part as was the origional.  So this listing is very misleading.  However, the part does fit and works.  My only complaint is that for $50+ you should be getting what is pictured.  If you want to offer a cheaper plastic replacement then you just say that.  Here they seem to be offering an exact replacement part, and charging accordingly, however sending a plastic part instead.

Unfortunately I wanted to get my toilet up and running so I installed it and it seems to be working.  I will comment in a few months if I have any problems.

The product I received was not brass as pictured. It was a molded plastic part. It work as advertised. But as plastic it should be about half the price. Plus, there are 4 screws pictured in the ad were missing. These are needed to mount the Fluid Master on top of the part. I fortunately was able to find 4 - 1 inch 10-32 screws laying around to mount the part and get my toilet working.

Many other reviews have complained about the bait 'n switch picture. It should be corrected!

Not exactly as pictured but did repair the issue with toilet. American standard Canada was not very helpful on the issue, they never answered :E" mails and when phoned you could be on hold for 30-55 minutes and still no answer. I as a consumer would probably not purchase  another American Standard product.

product_title: DELTA FAUCET T4759 CZ Champagne Bronze
product_description: 4 Hole Installation Copper supply tubes Two Handle Lever Package Weight 7 15 pounds

reviews.review_body: We love the handheld. We use the handheld for my wife and daughter’s hair when using the tub or to wash off excess soap. If you are trying to decide between getting the tub faucet with or without the handheld, then I’d strongly recommend that you go with the handheld as you won’t regret it!

product_title: Danze Mid Town Single Handle Pull Out Kitchen Faucet with Snapback Retraction Stainless Steel
product_description: Designed to extend your cleaning reach the Mid Town Single Handle Pull Out Kitchen Faucet can switch between a steady 1 75 gpm flow rate and a powerful spray while adding some architectural style to your decor The Right Fit The reach of the spout extends 9 1 4 235mm the overall height measures 11 7 8 301mm and the overall width measures 4 1 8 105mm Drip Free Function Single handle kitchen faucet design allows effortless control over water temperature and flow while the ceramic disc cartridge ensures drip free performance and smooth operation Flexible Design Swivel spout offers 360 degree rotation for moving spout out of the basin area to accommodate larger pots and dishes and to provide on the counter fill ups Fast Installation Single hole mount kitchen faucet includes integrated supply lines with Quick Connect hose couplings and all mounting hardware for complete installation optional matching finish cover plate DA617054 sold separately conceals holes from previous installations for quick setup in replacement applications Accessible Use Lever handle is ADA compliant for ease of operation Saves Water A 1 75 gpm 6 6 L min water conserving flow rate saves on household utility bills

reviews.review_body: A friend walked in and immediately said, “I have sink envy.” The turning function is wonderful. We placed the handle in the front - directly under the spout because I didn’t have enough room between the countertop hole and the backsplash to have it on the side. Honestly, I like it better this way.

We bought this replace another one almost exactly its twin. It was about half the price. There’s a noticeable difference in quality. But not enough to pay double for the other guy. The water pressure is great. And this was one of the easiest installs I’ve done. We’re quite pleased.
really unique shape- in a good way. Plumber who installed it said the quality is very good. And- water comes out of it- best feature!;)
It is so beautiful!! Remodeling a bar area. Cant wait to install !!!
Stylish and functional.
Very nice quality, very heavy and modern looking, haven't installed it yet and found it cheaper, so will be returning it for the same faucet, but for less money.
Matches my 90 degree faucets thru out my home
This is a great faucet, with slick and modern design. We are in the process of upgrading our kitchen and I love this faucet. It is also finger print and water drops resistant.
I loved the way this faucet looked on the website, but you have to see it in person! Just beautiful! Everyone who sees loves it. A work of art!
It looks great in my refreshed kitchen.  It replaces a very similar model from a different maker; this is a MUCH better design.
The handle must be turned up for hot water. If installed under or near a ledge you need to have enough space to turn hot water all the way on! Otherwise a beautiful and well made faucet!
Very heavy duty, pleasing to look at, well worth the money for a nice looking and functionable faucet for the kitchen.

product_title: Delta Faucet 72174 BL N A Square Push Pop Up Less Overflow Matte Black
product_description: Matte Black finish Metal push pop up Genuine Delta repair part Overall product Dimensions 8 27 32 H x 2 11 16 D x 2 11 16 w

reviews.review_body: This is definitely not a universal part.  It appeared to fit the vessel sink I chose initially but when I had the plumber install it, once tightened into place you can push the drain part down to fill but then it gets stuck and won't release - I had to pay the plumber twice to install and then remove and now wait for another drain to have them install again.

I ordered the stainless steel model.  The upside down sticker in the photo correctly identifies what I ordered, but if you look closely you'll see it was placed over what the item actually is.  The chrome model!  Even through the plastic it's easy to see the chrome and yes, I took it out of the plastic to verify its mirror chrome finish.  I am so tired of returning amazon items!  Their quality control is non-existent.  I'd rather pay a few dollars more and get the item I want rather than return another one at whole foods.
While well crafted and machined, it is a very large square. Overly so and would require a extraordinarily large sink in order to accommodate its size. Returning it.
Larger than I expected, but it looks really nice.  Easy to use.
